They are really soft, much softer if you want to compare to the common popular brands and the stretch is great. Overall really good quality, durable, and comfortable fit. Price is good too

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Great for night diapers for a potty trained toddler
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2025
reviews.review:
We use these for our 3 year old for night time. Easy to pull down and up when she tells us she needs to potty at night without having to risk her wetting the bed.

Biggest complaint is the giraffe being used as the front/back indicator is hard to figjre out which way is correct and or remember which way.

reviews.name: Crystal Daniel
reviews.title: Love them
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2024
reviews.review: They’re helping my toddler get potty trained. Plus they hold really well if he does have an accident so there’s no leakage. The only thing I don’t like is sometimes the cotton sticks around his area. Other than that, it’s great and helps him recognize when he should use the restroom! The fit is a little small around the back so that’s not completely true to size because his cheeks are out. Lol

reviews.name: Stef
reviews.title: Our Favorite Diapers/ Training Pants
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.review: We've done cloth diapers during the day, but for night, they always leak. We tried several brands of diapers. I was adamant that they needed to be as environmentally friendly as possible while still being comfy and doing their job. Several other brands had a rough feel to them. Dyper brand is so soft, and we've never had a night or nap leak in them. That wasn't true of the other brands we tried. Now that we're potty training (also he's a big boy so his size outgrew the diapers. He's got too much junk in the truck and the diapers were too slim) it just made sense to stick with Dyper training pants. I'm very happy with them. They fit great, are still soft, and don't leak at night. I only wish the charcoal ones came in training pants.

reviews.name: Kellie Fleming
reviews.title: Best diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2024
reviews.review: Everything else we tried leaked! I love that the company offers pickup for composting!

reviews.name: Sean
reviews.title: These work great for potty training transitioning
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2024
reviews.review: We bought these diapers as our two year old is transitioning out of traditional diapers. We wanted a product that was clean and did not have a bunch of chemicals in them. These checked that box. Our two year old really likes them and seems comfortable in them. They are very absorbent and we have had no issues with leaks.

reviews.name: Laura D.
reviews.title: The softest
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2024
reviews.review: We’ve tried a lot of different brands of diapers and pull ups, but always come back to Dyper. The “training pants” (pull ups) have really nice stretch, are super soft, and absorb a ton.

reviews.name: Eric J
reviews.title: Fantastic pull up
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2022
reviews.review: We’ve been using this brand since our second was an infant and love them. We used the P brand w our first for a while and decided we wanted something more environmentally friendly, so we paid for a composting service. When we got these pull ups for night time, true to brand they are slightly bulkier than plastic name brands but much softer, absorb more, more comfortable (4 yr old opinion) and scent free. We were gifted a pack of brand P that a neighbor had outgrown the other day and I noticed that they were much harder to get on when the kids are wet after bath. They would stick to their legs despite me working to get them dry. This meant we got leaks overnight twice in a month because I didn’t get them sealed around the legs. The has not happened w the Dyper brand, much easier to get on.

reviews.name: Nadiia Bik

reviews.review: I used these for a month to potty train my girl and these held up well. Even when she didn’t pee one night I would use them the next night. They were comfortable for her.

reviews.review: Fine

reviews.name: Emilie
reviews.title: I like these briefs style more than "normal" diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2022
reviews.review:
I like these training pants / briefs style of diapers. We're actually not using these as potty training pants yet and have just been using it as a normal diaper. I really like these! My little one knows to lift his legs up now when I tell him we're putting pants on, and he did the same for me with these. These diapers are soft and plush. This definitely feels better than some of the other cheap, plastic-y type of diapers. These definitely have a good amount of stuffing, and is way better than some of the drugstore brands I purchased - talk about paper thin on those diapers! I'm not trying to compare these with the "cheap" brands, just pointing out the obvious physical difference in the material and stuffing. All that said, the softness does not matter all that much though, as long as the overall quality is good - and these are.

At first I got these 2T-3T thinking I would save them for when my baby is ready for this size. He is still wearing 12M clothes and I believe we're still using size 4 or 5 diapers! I was surprised when I opened these and they look to be about my son's size. When I put these on him I was surprised that this fits. It does have the stretchy band, so it can stretch quite a bit. I can't say if these run big or small but it seems like most people are saying it runs big, so I am very pleasantly surprised my little one can wear these already. Although these are pretty "clean", they do have a bit of a smell to it. I recommend to take these out of the packaging and let it air out for a little bit. Once you let it air out it is fine. We usually take out all the diapers from its packaging and dump it inside a box, regardless of brand. I like to mix and match different ones on a daily basis.

I appreciate the indicator line on these, and that is the one thing about diapers that are non negotiable for me. That's a feature I need to have on my diapers as I often rely on that line. There is a the Dyper giraffe logo on the front, which makes it easier for you to tell which is the front and back. The diapers looks very simple, clean, and straightforward.

These diapers are advertised as plant based and eco friendly but I didn't see any information about how well these disintegrate in the landfill. I don't know if these do or if they just sit in the landfill for decades. I wish they provided more information from an eco conscious perspective, as that would have been something that would make me support this particular brand of diapers and make these diapers stand out from its competitors.

Overall I would say give these DYPER(s) a try. Diapers seem to be a personal thing that works differently for every baby, this might just be your new favorite. The diapers seem pretty "clean" and if that type of thing is important to you, definitely check this brand out.

Last thing I'll add is I would like to urge the company to hi-light the eco aspect of these, as that will be one of the things that will help you stand out from major big name brands. As of now, all I know is these are made from bamboo, but I'm not being convinced as to why I should make the switch to this material over some of the other "clean", plant based materials.

reviews.name: UCSDsoccer
reviews.title: Better than you expect in every way
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2022
reviews.review:
Absolutely love these training pants! Our toddler has just started potty training, so this is new territory to us... but these have been awesome so far. She is able to take them off and pull them back up by herself with ease - and they are still nice and snug without leaking. I've read about bamboo vicose before, but this is the first time actually getting something made from this. I was skeptical because my initial, unlearned opinion was that bamboo cannot become something soft?! However these are actually more soft and plush than our usual diapers! It is super absorbent and comfy.
SIZING
Our LO was wearing size 4T diapers and I was worried these might be too small. However, when I lay them flat on top of each other, these Dypers are actually about 1/2" wider and 1" longer than the 4T diapers. So these are great if you usually use 4T, but may be too big if you normally buy 3T.

reviews.name: asterisk
reviews.title: Stretchy, comfortable waist. Very soft
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2022
reviews.review:
These training pants have a very stretchy and comfortable waistband. It fits snugly, and moves with baby. It stretches out easily to go on or off. It fits well for the size, and feels just a tad bigger than other brands. The material is very soft, both inside and outside. It absorbs well for daytime accidents..

The wetness indicator is on both the front and back. So I couldn't figure out at first, which side was which. The giraffe goes on the front - it's printed small on the package. I wish they had just printed the word "back" on the back like other brands.

I love that this brand doesn't use chlorine, fragrances, or other toxins.

reviews.name: Tim
reviews.title: Thick training pants
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2022
reviews.review:
These are very absorbent and soft training pants. They are also fairly thick. They don’t feel cheap and thin like some store brand ones I have tried. My daughter said they made her sweaty but I’m not sure if she just isn’t used to them. They are plain in style so I think that can be good and bad. My daughter does seem to be motivated by the characters or print ones. But a basic plain white like this is gender neutral and crisp looking. They have the wetness indicator on them. Also most of the printed training pants are pretty obvious for front versus back. These have a subtle mark so I had to show my daughter which was which as she likes to put them on herself. It took some practice. Size wise, I went by weight versus age and actually went up a size so they wouldn’t be too tight or binding. That worked out fine for us.

I appreciate the fact they are made without the chemicals. They have caused no irritation and have been gentle on her skin while being absorbent when needed.

Pleased with these overall and I would buy them again.

reviews.name: Nicocallie
reviews.title: Great For My Daughter With Super Sensitive Skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2022
reviews.review: My 3 year old is in the middle of potty training and she has really sensitive skin. I have tried lots of diapers over the last couple years. I knew I was going to have a struggle finding her training pants that would work for her. I had tried Dyper's diapers and they worked for her so I was hoping the training pants would too. I know the price on these is really high but I hate seeing her suffer so I am willing to pay what I need to, to ensure she doesn't get a rash. These training pants are great. She never gets a rash with them. They are very soft. She can easily pull them up and down on her own. She still has trouble telling the front from the back but that isn't a big deal. I love that they are using bamboo as the resource. Overall I do wish they were slightly cheaper but you get what you pay for and these are great.

reviews.name: Trelakopela
reviews.title: I like this brand for my son
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2022
reviews.review:
Hopefully he’s digging these too. No real fuss when wearing. Both diapers are by Dyper. One training pant and the other is basic diaper. I was stumped with the training diaper as I really didn’t know which side was the back or front - but does it really matter in the end.!? According to the package it’s giraffe yellow side to the front.
Good absorption. Holds quite a bit for descent about of hours.
I got these in size 3t 4t & 4t-5T & so far the 3r-4t seem pretty ideal since they run a little big. He’s prob like 25-26lbs 31”-32” inches long.

reviews.name: Zü
reviews.title: nice
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2022
reviews.review:
DYPER Bamboo Toddler Potty Training Pants are super soft and absorbent. There's no tape or tabs, but the sides are stretchy and would allow your toddler to move around freely. There's no harsh dyes, bleach, scents or other chemicals, and no brightly colored graphics - the pants are white with a giraffe on the front.
We are almost done with potty training, so are only using these for long car trips or overnight, and haven't had any problems - no leaks, blowouts or irritation.
These are a bit pricy, but are a good choice for eco-conscious mama.

reviews.name: Denise
reviews.title: Good pull-up but pricey
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2022
reviews.review: My toddler did great with these pull ups , but very pricy

reviews.name: D.T.
reviews.title: Better than other name brand training pants.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2022
reviews.review: I have tried various training pants on the market. The biggest complain of training pants my son had was the scratchy seams so he keeps tugging at them and after a couple of tugs, they tear on the side. We currently use a named brand pull up and was pleasantly surprised by the dyper version that is very similar, just as soft with a stretchy seamless band and as absorbent. Happy to switch to Dyper from now on. They do run a little big, see comparison of pull up and dyper.

reviews.name: Lilbear
reviews.title: Soft, absorbent and true to size
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2022
reviews.review:
My 17 months old normally wears diaper size 5 or training pants 2t - 3t. This DYPER Bamboo Toddler Potty Training Pants Girls & Boys Size 2T-3T fits him nicely. I was a bit hesitant to order as the DYPER diapers run large on him but this training pants is a perfect fit!
The absorbency is great during the day. Never leaked so far. It is also a lot softer than many other similar products, especially on the waist. My LO moves comfortably while wearing this. Highly recommended!

reviews.name: FSUmommy
reviews.title: Soooo soft!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2022
reviews.review:
I absolutely love these training pants by Dyper. I was concerned about the level of absorbency since a lot of the “clean” brands just don’t make the cut (as much as I try and make them work). These pull ups actually do work well and I’m happy to report we’ve had no leaks middle of the night. These also get a 10/10 for softness- they are literally the softest training pants I’ve ever purchased and my son said they are comfortable. We have a little diaper rash now and I feel good about him wearing these versus some with chemicals.

Overall highly recommend. We went with 2T-3T for my 25 lb 3 year old and it’s a perfect fit!

reviews.name: 🌟Shemira🌙☀️
reviews.title: Very soft and good for sensitive skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2022
reviews.review:
Size is running big compared to huggies or pampers.
My 18 months old wear size 3-4T from both pampers and huggies. 2-3T from this brand fits him nicely.
They are very soft and fits well. No are not leaking. Both front and back were well designed with thick and soft cotton for better absorbing. These honestly are very nice pull-ups but they are pricey.
My son has quite of sensitive skin type, and this pull up not causing any discomfort or redness.

reviews.name: ga9
reviews.title: super impressed!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2022
reviews.review:
We snagged a box of these bamboo training underpants as part of the Amazon Vine review program. I normally wouldn't pay nearly $100 for diapers or pull-ups, but the price is right when they're free.

I really wasn't expecting much at all. I figured these would be an overpriced junk quality pull-up made to be overpriced because they're made of "bamboo."

I was wrong.

The quality and absorbency is far superior to any other diaper or pull-up we have tried before. Yes, this training underpants has BETTER absorbency than an actual diaper. For a point of reference, our 3 year old usually uses Huggies diapers and pull-ups. These are way better than those. This box lasted us far longer than a box of regular diapers or pull-ups last us. And our son started calling these his "giraffe undies" versus the other pull-ups which he thinks are still diapers.

Now, am I going to go and spend $100 on another box of them? Yeah, I actually am.

reviews.name: @@@Bruins@@@
reviews.title: good potty training pants
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2022
reviews.review: These are soft and snug, and the long elastic-like material on the side has a good grip but doesn't bother my child at all. These training pants are made from plants and are environmentally friendly. They claim to be made of 100% bamboo vicose. They are non-toxic and do not contain chlorine, latex, alcohol, perfumes, PVC, lotions, TBT, parabens, sulfates, or phthalates. To protect the next generation, they are unprinted, unscented, hypoallergenic, and cruelty-free. There is a small giraffe on the pull up. That will be sewn onto the front of the training pants.

reviews.name: Amavon
reviews.title: So soft!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2022
reviews.review: You will not believe how soft these diapers feel! They are very lightweight and work superbly! I love that these are made from bamboo, a renewable resource. Very happy with these and will purchase more!

reviews.name: Chad
reviews.title: The perfect training diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2022
reviews.review: These are an amazing substitute for my cloth diapers. I have been using cloth diapers with my todler for the past 2 years but after second baby I wanted to use disposable diapers to help with the transition to 2 kids and I am extremely happy with these. I have used their regular diapers and now that we are potty training these pull ups make it so easy for my toddler to pull them down to use the potty and they can even pull them back up, great practice for real underwear. They also are perfect for an on the go toddler that refuses to lay down for a diaper change, you can change them standing up!! These are a little more pricey the other options but their great for the Earth and hold so much liquid so you don't have to chang them as often so I believe they are 100% worth the extra money.

reviews.name: Shasta daisy
reviews.title: Perfect for overnight!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2022
reviews.review: These Dyper bamboo pull ups are the best I’ve tried! I was super impressed they are soft, extremely absorbent, and stretch and move with your toddler! We had no leaks throughout the night with these! My nephew also has sensitive skin and these didn’t cause any irritation or rashes! Definitely recommend

reviews.name: Danice
reviews.title: Good quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2022
reviews.review: They fit perfect and are quite absorbent

reviews.name: Amyrose2019
reviews.title: Works out great for us
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2022
reviews.review: The dyper bamboo pull ups have worked well for us. I feel comfortable knowing my daughter is in a safe product. No leaks for us! She only wears them at night as she is trained during the day. The size is accurate as others have mentioned maybe slightly a tad big compared to honest but not much, yes a bit on the pricey side but you will always pay more for a “clean” product. My daughter has extremely sensitive skin and we’ve had no breakouts. For that I would continue to pay the price.

reviews.name: Max
reviews.title: Premium Brand, Better for the Environment and Your Baby's Butt
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2022
reviews.review: With Dyper, you'll be paying a little more than 2x competitor brands, but what you get is softer, all-natural, eco-friendly diapers. If you're loyal to their brand, you'll know their stuff usually runs large; this one is no exception. If you care about the perfect fit, get one size smaller, but if oversized diapers don't bother you, then this will be fine. The larger diaper allows it to contain blowouts better and absorb more liquid. These training briefs are perfect on the go and when you start potty training. Best of all, these will leave your baby's butt dry. Like other diapers, there's no front or back indicator for these. At least, they include the blue wet line indicator.

reviews.name: Josh/Emily
reviews.title: Thick!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2022
reviews.review: These pull up training pants are very nice and thick quality! Almost too thick! They do fit a little big, but that’s generally a good thing holds lots. The elastic seems pretty nice and fits tight! My son does a good job of getting them up and down easily, he’s had trouble with some of the other brands!

reviews.name: Kimberly Whitney
reviews.title: Organic pullups
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2022
reviews.review: These are super plain pull ups with no designs, but they are pretty awesome and super absorbent. My toddler wears them to bed and wakes up still feeling dry. They fit true to size but have a good stretch to them on the sides and waistband. I wanted to try a brand that didn't have characters slapped all over them so my toddler will transition to cool underwear and ditch the pullups faster.

reviews.name: M. Smith
reviews.title: Baby’s Potty Training Made Easy!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2022
reviews.review: These bamboo briefs for toddlers are designed for softness, comfort and functionality! They are not only plant-based, but being eco-friendly they are right up my alley. They are also hypoallergenic, which is just a pampering benefits for my toddler’s sensitive skin. And thanks to the ultra absorbency it offers her, she feels comfortably dry even when technically, she isn’t. These potty briefs are a godsend!

reviews.name: THERESA
reviews.title: Great brand for all ages
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2022
reviews.review: We have some Dyper Bamboo for the infant in our house and when I saw the had pull ups, decided to give those a try as well. Fit very well and made it through the night. Right now, this is the only time we need a pull up as the rest of potty training is complete with the older kids. These are soft and comfortable for them to sleep in, I heard no complaints. Easy up and easy down plus a little better for the environment. Overall, we are pretty happy with these!

reviews.name: LiquidSteam
reviews.title: So incredibly soft and comfortable
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2022
reviews.review: Absolutely love these diapers, hardly any scent yet super soft and absorbent zorban, no leaks. Also has the line to show when it's full

reviews.name: Alice W.
reviews.title: These surprised me
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2022
reviews.review: Better than I thought. The Dyper brand is super soft, has great absorbency and is environmentally friendly. It’s a high end diaper with a price that matches but it lives up to its hype.

reviews.name: Emily J. Morris
reviews.title: Sturdy, roomy, and keep it all in
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2022
reviews.review: While these are slightly on the pricier side, these are a line of pull-ups that are certainly worth the cost, and I believe in paying within reason for good diapers. These potty-training briefs are plenty cozy and quite in line with the quality I expect from the diapers (which are also fantastic, by the way). These have a good, tight fit that moves with the baby, so leaks are prevented. They're wonderfully absorbent and don't get all disturbingly bulgy if you go too long between changes. The material is perfect for sensitive skin.

reviews.name: Dinosaurs and Mermaids, mom of both
reviews.title: No leaks, fit just like Huggies Pull-ups

reviews.review: My daughter usually wears the 4t-5t Pull-ups from Huggies and I would say that these fit just the same. I like that it has the wet indicator strip. The material is soft, yet durable. No leaks

reviews.name: Katielmo
reviews.title: Guys these work great!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2022
reviews.review:
As soon as I received them my daughter saw they were like her underwater and was so excited to put one on
She put it on herself and took it off when going potty and was so proud
She is 2.5
They are very thick and hold the pee great
I am super pumped at the quality and how these work
I've tried one other pull up and it was paper thin and didn't hold any pee basically
This was wayyyy better

reviews.name: HeardItThroughTheGrapevine🍇
reviews.title: Awesome potty training pants
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2022
reviews.review:
These are thick and great quality! What differs these from traditional diapers are that the urine doesn't dissolve as well so the toddler is motivated to take them off. I got through them much quicker is my son pees in them, but it does help tremendously with potty training. They don't leak though so they're great for nighttime too!

Yes, I recommend this product

reviews.name: Infinite3
reviews.title: Comfortable and very good materials
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2022
reviews.review: This bamboo potty training is is really good! The diaper absorbs very well and has good quality. I like the idea of ​​using more natural materials as it helps the child's sensitive skin!!!!

reviews.name: mystery book lover
reviews.title: Soft and Absorbant
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2022
reviews.review: My child loves these training pants. She commented how soft they are and that the sides are not scratchy on her skin. They do feel soft and thick. We use them at bedtime to protect against bedwetting accidents and she has not had any leakage problems.

reviews.name: Lindsay
reviews.title: Maybe run a tad small but they’re really great quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2022
reviews.review:
I currently have a 3 year old who isn’t interested in potty training yet. We had a bunch of size 2T and 3T pull ups left over from my first son but those are already too small. He is about 39lbs and wears size 3T and 4T clothing and size 6 in most diapers. I tried the size 6 in this brand for him and they ran too small for him to wear comfortably. I decided to try these as a slightly larger size option. These actually fit him really well and comfortably. Considering these are supposed to be 4T-5T I would say they definitely run on the small side if you compare to other diapers and toddler clothing. The smaller sizes did fit my daughter accurately though. I think my son just has a little more junk in his trunk and around the sides lol.
These briefs have almost all the same features of this same brand of diapers that I really love. They are super soft, have the yellow wetness indicator, and when they get liquid in them they stay pretty firm/solid instead of feeling mushy. What’s even better about these is the elastic between the front and back. It’s super soft and stretchy and comfortable for him to wear and feels more secure than just the little strips most diapers have. What really blew me away is the extra elastic/stretchy pieces down around the leg opening too. It really makes for a much more realistic brief type fit and feeling and far superior to the big name brands of pull ups. My son may be a little bummed about no fun characters but he will get over it. I will mention I did notice a slight smell to them when opening though. It’s not a chemical smell per se but its definitely not a fresh/natural smell. It’s very very faint though.
Even though my son still isn’t quite ready for potty training I may have him start wearing these regularly anyway just because they fit so nicely on him. They are easy to tear down the sides as well in case you do have to clean them up more like a diaper.
Overall I really like this training pants/briefs and will definitely continue to use this box. If you have the extra money to spend since they are pretty pricey, I would definitely recommend these. Considering usually training pants aren’t worn for near as long, one box might be enough and might just be worth it to have this nice quality.

reviews.name: Angry Face
reviews.title: The best disposable training pants I've ever used, BUT...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2022
reviews.review:
These are probably the best disposable training pants I've ever used. The elastic is good and stretchy and my 2 year old doesn't hate them. He's able to pull them up and down by himself. They don't leak. They're actually absorbent enough to use as diapers. The material is soft, and doesn't irritate his skin.

I asked the manufacturer if these were biodegradable. There's no mention of it on the packaging or on Dyper's website, and I received no response to my query. To me, that means that no, they are not biodegradeable. I like that they're made of bamboo and that the manufacturing process has less of an impact on the planet, but hate that they're not biodegradeable. That's the big thing. Diapers take at least 500 years to break down. Five. Hundred. Years. Basically, my child's great great great great grandchildren will be gone before these training pants fully degrade, and that's just a guess. The first disposable diapers are still solidly full of poo in a landfill somewhere, and won't be degraded for another 450 years.

Better for the planet, but not best for the planet. Though effective, convenient and the best at keeping my carpet / furniture clean, once they're done I'm going to stick with our cloth training pants for a clean consience.

reviews.name: CM
reviews.title: Soft and absorbent but expensive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2022
reviews.review:
These DYPER disposable training pants are very soft and super absorbent. They were great for my son for nighttime (he’s daytime trained). The sides are very stretchy and they don’t sag.

Overall I’m very pleased with them. Unfortunately we can’t buy again because of the higher price. If you can afford them, they’re great. Much softer and less paper like than other brands at the store, although the other brands function just as well. I’d like to see more data from the company about their eco friendliness, because the packaging states their ingredients which contains plastic materials. I’m sure they’re much less plastic than other brands, I’d just like more info about this. They are also eligible for the REDYPER program, where you send used ones back to DYPER for a price to be composted. How much of it gets composted since it has plastic materials? I don’t know.

But anyway, if you want a soft and absorbent disposable training pant and cost isn’t an issue, these are perfect.

reviews.name: A.L
reviews.title: They are really quality, but a little pricey
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2022
reviews.review: Things I like about these pull-ups: they work for nighttime use, they are really really organic and go over the top for the environment, and they are easy to put on. What I don't like? The price point. For 17 diapers, this is $23, so over a dollar a diaper. To me, an avid Luvs user, this is pretty high of a price point for something my 3 year old toddler wears only at night to catch any leaks. I do like knowing that the material is very safe and clean for wearing for over 12 hrs., but I'm not sure if I would regularly buy these. The packaging is really nice and these make me feel really good about buying, but at the end of the day, it's an overnight diaper for my use and I'm just being honest in saying that I will go back to the Luvs brand instead when these are gone.

reviews.title: Works great overnight even with a toddler who drinks alot at night.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2022
reviews.review: Was sent a size 5-6 and they were the same size as Pampers Pull-ups 4-5t for size comparison. Thankfully they fit my daughter just fine, they stretch and it looks like there is some room in these. The fit is nice; my daughter is very active and these allow her to be. They don’t hinder her. These diapers had no decorative aspects but honestly this didn’t bother me; I am used to more color on the diapers. I would have liked some sort of front/back guidance because we never really were sure if we put them on right. Thankfully no accidents at night; they have been very absorbent and made it through the whole night no problem. My daughter drinks a lot at night and so we put the pullups to the test with how much they can hold.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2022
reviews.review:

These diapers are surprisingly soft (bamboo never ceases to amaze me) and seemed to be comfortable for my granddaughter. They’re roomy and absorbent, as well. My granddaughter is 2 (3 in July) and usually wears a size 5/6 and the 5/6 were just a tad too roomy - so keep that in mind when ordering, as they seem to run a bit big.

My only critique would be that they’re not always amazing at keeping everything “contained” during messier situations, but that's probably because they’re a too big for my granddaughter.

reviews.review: These training pants are surprisingly soft and seem to be comfortable to wear. They absorb nicely without leaking, and keep my little one's bum (and his sheets) dry through the night! They do run a little large, but this is manageable. I love that these are made from mostly sustainable resources and are biodegradable...much less impact on the environment than traditional plastic trainers, something I'm happy to pay a bit more for!

reviews.name: Brianna
reviews.title: Almost love it
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2022
reviews.review:
So these have been decent and my son really likes them. They are soft and comfortable. They stretch enough and hold in place well.
My ONLY complaint is that my son was laying on his side and went potty and somehow it found the one spot that doesn't hold because his pants were drenched even though the pull up wasn't full at all. That's only happened once. Other than that, these have been great.

reviews.name: Christopher Wells
reviews.title: Good buy!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2022
reviews.review: A pretty decent diaper. Comes with a very good amount and the diapers themselves seem soft. The kid doesnt seem to be uncomfortable or anything so thats a plus. She also has a sensitive butt and these haven't aggrevated anything so big plus!

reviews.name: Izamar
reviews.title: Soft and absorbent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2022
reviews.review: These diapers are so soft and absorbent. I use these for my 4 year old sometimes at night in case he might wet the bed when he drinks too much liquids at night. I got size 5t-6t and they fit, they seem comfortable but doesnt cover all the butt area.

reviews.name: Shy
reviews.title: Great briefs but pricey
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2022
reviews.review: These briefs are very soft and well made. I like the design of the giraffe picture on it and the indicator line. I would say that the briefs have a slight smell to them, but that's okay. The brief fit my three-year-old great. But overall, I am fine with this brief; it's just a little on the pricey side.

reviews.name: Mrshouck86
reviews.title: Stretchy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2022
reviews.review:
These training pants are very durable, as per my pics, they seem smaller than Huggies but they stretch to accommodate. They are also very soft. I am sure that's because they are sourced from eco friendly, plant based materials.
My son is potty training & did not pee before bed so these pants were def a trial....yet, they passed the test!
He woke up full, yet contained. The pull up pants absorbed very well.

Priced at over $1 per piece, I would purchase again, should they have a sale.

reviews.name: E. S.
reviews.title: Pricey
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2022
reviews.review: Pricey but really good with its absorbing. They come up to size.

reviews.name: d
reviews.title: nice
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2022
reviews.review: Love the concept of these bamboo briefs from Dyper. They do seem a bit more bulky than others, but they perform the same, if not better. I don't care for the price for them. The cost is too much for me to repurchase.

reviews.name: Cindy
reviews.title: Soft and Absorbent. Runs a Bit Big! Expensive!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2022
reviews.review:
Current Price $23.99 for 22 diapers size 4 to 5T.

These are soft, comfortable, absorbent, but expensive. The other name brand diaper training pants are approximately $45 for a one-month supply or around 100 pairs of panties. 4 Stars. Hope you find this review helpful! Super nice panties but very expensive.

reviews.name: E. S.
reviews.title: Pricey
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2022
reviews.review: Pricey but really good with its absorbing. They come up to size.

reviews.title: nice
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2022
reviews.review: Love the concept of these bamboo briefs from Dyper. They do seem a bit more bulky than others, but they perform the same, if not better. I don't care for the price for them. The cost is too much for me to repurchase.

reviews.name: Cindy
reviews.title: Soft and Absorbent. Runs a Bit Big! Expensive!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2022
reviews.review:
Current Price $23.99 for 22 diapers size 4 to 5T.

These are soft, comfortable, absorbent, but expensive. The other name brand diaper training pants are approximately $45 for a one-month supply or around 100 pairs of panties. 4 Stars. Hope you find this review helpful! Super nice panties but very expensive.

reviews.name: Susanna D’Addazio
reviews.title: Dyper's Training Pants Fall Apart
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2025
reviews.review: I quite liked these at first, no smell and safer for my little one/the environment. However, we quickly discovered they are not up to the output my little guy has to offer. We have had quite a few leaks/wet beds. Using up what we have for nap time. Do not recommend.

reviews.name: Alex U.
reviews.title: Expensive, not great, ecological?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2024
reviews.review: This is very expensive, with performance much worse than the Pampers Pure Protection. They're supposedly more ecological and better for the skin but it's hard to measure. Their "composting" program is also super expensive and not available where I live. Once you get these pants off, you'll need to find a trash bin asap because there's not way to bind the used diaper.

reviews.name: Jacob Litton
reviews.title: Beads everywhere.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2024
reviews.review: I had three diapers explode and release the chemical beads all over my toddler after only a few hours of her sleeping. It’s a very unsafe design. I was under the impression that this brand didn’t use the beads, but sadly I was wrong. Regardless, they should be able to last more than a few hours.

reviews.name: Raphael Coloma
reviews.title: Nice material but way too narrow
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2023
reviews.review: I've been a fan of Dyper's diapers for babies but these bamboo briefs did not work out. I had seen other reviews saying they were too narrow and figured it'd be perfect for my extra skinny toddler. But I was wrong! Now the material is fine, similar feel to their diapers but the kiddo does not want to wear them because they always slip into the butt crack and end up being very uncomfortable. I tried hooking my finger in the gussets to make sure they are on the outer butt cheeks but it did not work out. Cannot buy again until they redesign the width in the bottom and crotch area. (Waist sizing is fine, stretch is nice. Absorbance worked for overnight!)

reviews.name: Joanie Sala
reviews.title: Toddler Peed Through Diaper in 5 minutes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2023
reviews.review: I’m so disappointed because I really wanted to like these but I was using them for overnights with my potty training toddler and every morning he woke up with pajamas that smelled like pee. I decided to stop using them overnight and just used them for temporary use during the day when he briefly wears training pants to go #2. Within 5 minutes he had peed through the diaper. This has never happened with any other brand. I literally found a puddle on the floor beneath him.

reviews.name: Lissette
reviews.title: Great quality but leak at night
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2023
reviews.review: I was so excited about the quality and performance through the day. However, today in the morning when I was taking out the sleepsack from my toddler I noticed he was wet, hasnt happened in a long long time, exactly just now that I changed from Pampers 360 cruisers to these ones. I’m going to try Coterie now….

reviews.name: Cristina Cascaval
reviews.title: The quality is very Good But first try was failed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2023
reviews.review: My baby wore during the nap and woke up with his wet cloth😞 2 star just to soft quality

reviews.name: Jennifer Kaup
reviews.title: Fibers could have caused us a big problem
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2022
reviews.review: I wanted to like these pull on training diapers so much, but they definitely didn't work for us. My 3 yo is a 5T and working on potty training. Automatically, we didn't like the fit. They were like a sumo diaper fit, riding up on the sides and his butt. This made it really easy for leaks to occur. BUT our biggest concern was that there were fibers that shed, and we found them around the head of his ____. They were wrapped around and needed to be carefully removed as he complained that his ____ hurt. Thank goodness that we found it when we did because that could have become much worse. Especially for the price, I would not recommend these at all.

reviews.name: Somalia
reviews.title: The a little heavy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.review: The are not light and seem really thick for potty training

reviews.name: Henderson78
reviews.title: Ok for naps, leaks overnight
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2024
reviews.review: I quite liked these at first, no smell and safer for my little one/the environment. However, we quickly discovered they are not up to the output my little guy has to offer. We have had quite a few leaks/wet beds. Using up what we have for nap time. Do not recommend.

reviews.name: Alex U.
reviews.title: Expensive, not great, ecological?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2024

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Elastic lining bunches up
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.review: These are awful. I don’t know how a manufacturer messes up this bad on a basic design… But the inner elastic linings aren’t spaced out far enough, and within a few minutes of wearing the pull up and walking around in it, they bunch together and create the worst toddler wedgie ever. My daughter hates them and is visibly annoyed when she wears these. I’ve never seen a pull up do this. On any other brand, the elastic lining on either side of the main pad always is spaced out enough that it sits on the buttcheeks, NOT wadded up right in the crotch. I don’t know how it would even catch any poop with how bad the lining bunches up on these. Terrible awful bad. Especially for a low tox expensive product. They really need to fix it.

reviews.name: Bfree
reviews.title: The worst pull up ever!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2024
reviews.review: They soak all the way through. Even the outside of the pull up is soaked. They are like a thick pair of underwear they don’t protect or hold the potty in. Woke up several nights completely soaked, clothes, bedding everything! These are literally the worst!!! What a joke!! Parents do not buy these!

reviews.name: lesa
reviews.title: WAY TOO BIG
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.review: these things were MASSIVE and way off in sizing. They were completely unusable. I went by the weight just like I have for other brands and they was practically falling off. I was really disappointed because I bought them right before a roadtrip and had to make an emergency stop elsewhere to get a different brand. Do yourself a favor and skip these.

reviews.name: Glenda
reviews.title: RASH
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2024
reviews.review: I usually use Pampers never once had a rash before but my boyfriend has been wanting our daughter to use better quality organic bamboo diapers and first time using these and they gave her a horrible rash.

reviews.name: amcamc
reviews.title: LEAKS
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2024
reviews.review: I have used these for over 3 months every night. Each time they were full, they leaked. The outside of the pull-up was wet which wet the pajamas, sheets and blanket. I just thought my son had peed a lot, but I tried another brand (Bamboo Dreams) yesterday, same amount of pee, but no leaking whatsoever.

reviews.name: Stephanie
reviews.title: Expensive, leaky diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2023
reviews.review: My kid has incredibly sensitive skin so this is one of the only brands he can tolerate. Unfortunately they have a major issue and it seems like 1 in 3 diapers leaks completely through soaking my son (and anyone who may be holding him) entirely. I’m on vacation now and having to carry multiple pairs of backup shorts around for the next accident. Isn’t the first time and when I contact customer service I get the run around. Don’t waste your money.

reviews.name: Norland20
reviews.title: NOT for Sensitive Skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2022
reviews.review: I had high hopes for these but I was disappointed. My son has sensitive skin and mild eczema and these caused him to tear his skin apart from all the scratching near the diaper area. I even ordered directly from the website just in case I received a bad batch from Amazon, but it was the same result. So much so that I accidentally left one in the bottom of the diaper bag and a month later his grandmother used it and couldn’t figure out why he was scratching so much. Sadly, these were the culprit.

reviews.name: Roxanne Saunders
reviews.title: Awful!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2023
reviews.review:
These diapers are awful! They leak so bad just after one pee! And even after taken off to change my son is soaked in his own urine. They rip around the diaper so my daughter and son is waking up with the diaper half off.
I WILL NEVER BYE AGAIN!

reviews.name: Hailey Lampa
reviews.title: Leaked
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2023
reviews.review: My son wears a size 4 in pampers 360. I tried using the 3t ones but they leaked every time for a week straight. Was so disappointed. Love how soft they are but I couldn’t get them to hold overnight.

reviews.name: Nancy
reviews.title: no vale la pena
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.review:
compré estos pañales porque mi bebé siempre se rasca por el pañal pero estos no duran nada se pasa muy rápido la
orina

reviews.name: Innocentia Jones
reviews.title: Horrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.review: Quality is okay but the fit was horrible!

products.product_name: DYPER Baby Diapers Size 4 | Honest Ingredients | Cloth Alternative | Day & Overnight | Made with Plant-Based* Materials | Hypoallergenic

reviews.name: C.Wheelis
reviews.title: Love them!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2025
reviews.review: So worth the money! Love the fit, quality and absorption!

reviews.name: Krista Jessie
reviews.title: My son loves these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2024
reviews.review:
We have tried just about every type of diaper out there and my son either hates them or gets a rash from them. We got a package of this brand as a gift and my son loves than. The fit great, are great quality, and not so thick he cannot move. With other diapers he was waking up every time he peed at night because he could feel the wetness now he goes 4 hours at night (that's when he wakes up to nurse). We also have never had an issue with rashes in these diapers.
They do have issues with blowout in the back of you didn't get to it soon enough but that can be solved by folding the back flap a little. Also they are a bit pricey, but if it means his comfortably and him sleeping I'll cut a coat somewhere else.

reviews.name: Chelsea
reviews.title: Our favorite
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2024
reviews.review: This is our primary diaper. We love how soft it is, it's super absorbent, and it's just white so we don't have prints showing through our outfits. Great diapers. Fit pretty close to size. Never had a blow out happen in these.

reviews.name: Kristin
reviews.title: Exactly what you want in a diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2024
reviews.review:
I wanted a diaper that was more natural, without harsh chemicals against my LO’s skin. I’ve tried several different diapers in an attempt to find the one that works best for us and my baby. Turned out, it was this diaper. I’ve tried both this specific diaper, as well as their charcoal infused diaper - I prefer the plain white diaper.

We’ve used size 1 and size 2 so far. Neither have allowed for leaks. This diaper holds a lot. Right now my LO is peeing and pooping frequently, so we change him every 1-2 hours during the day, but the diaper would hold for longer if we let it. It’s also been great for overnight when he is in the diaper longer. The absorbency is great. My baby hasn’t had a single diaper rash with this diaper.

The diaper is your basic diaper design, and plain white. The materials are all listed, and natural, so there won’t be harsh chemicals on my baby’s skin.

It’s definitely worth the money. Five stars.

reviews.name: Celeste k Jack
reviews.title: Best diapers ever!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2025
reviews.review: Fragrance free, durable, and I love that they work very well. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: Zuleyma M.
reviews.title: One of our favorite brands
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2025
reviews.review: Exp friendly and no rash

reviews.name: chelse Sorensen
reviews.title: Shockingly absorbent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2024
reviews.review: We were on a trip and needed diapers overnight in a pinch and ordered these based on the reviews and description getting them. I thought they seemed a little thin. We are used to using the moon diapers which are pretty puffy and soft, but these ones were shockingly, absorbent overnight it absorbed all of the pee a there was a lot of it.

reviews.name: Hanna
reviews.title: Great but always out of stock
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2024
reviews.review: I love those diapers: the shape, the sustainability, no leaks, no rash, very simple white design... But for some reason, the newborn size is ALWAYS out of stock. So if you want them in this size, know that I used ~2 packs a week and order accordingly. Had to buy a pack of regular supermarket diapers while waiting for those ugh

reviews.name: Dawn Bernard
reviews.title: Great diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2025
reviews.review: Great diapers for the price

reviews.name: Ashley
reviews.title: Amazing but pricey!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2024
reviews.review: Gotta say that these diapers are definitely high key one of my favorites even though they’re just so expensive but it definitely works well, moisture retention and hold capacity

reviews.name: Rachel
reviews.title: Serious let down-AMENDED!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2022
reviews.review:
EDIT- I have to eat my words from earlier. We’ve been solely using these diapers for his whole life (6 months) and they are amazing and wonderful and I can’t sing their praises enough. Not to mention- the company is incredible with customer service! The trick here is your baby will size out of these like a thief in the night- don’t know how to else to describe it. It seems to fit fine but it just doesn’t- you have to size up pretty early, earlier than the weight stated per size in my experience. As long as you do this they work like a dream!

I was so excited to use these for my new baby. I try to be as eco-conscious as possible and avoid a lot of the toxic ingredients found in just about every single thing they sell is in America. This brand has made a step in the right direction as far as safety of ingredients and the capability of these diapers to break down naturally! I thought for sure I’d use these the whole time for my baby. HOWEVER…

These diapers leak everywhere. Any time I put one on my baby he ends up covered in a mess. They do run bigger so I waited a couple weeks for him to even be able to wear the newborn size but even now they do not hold anything in. I’m so sad, I really wanted to love these. The idea is wonderful, as is the softness and I love that they don’t use ink and are plain white- but the functionality is just not there and I can’t possibly use them.

reviews.name: K. Besser
reviews.title: Very absorbent, last all night, great value
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2024
reviews.review:
I really appreciate that these are just plain white, no silly images printed on them. I mean really, do we need to introduce ink to our infants genitals?

They fit well on my grandson's sweet, chubby legs.
These can handle overnight volume, no need to buy separate diapers for that. Well done Dyper!

reviews.name: Steph
reviews.title: Best diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2024
reviews.review: I love these diapers. Just the feel and look of them make them amazing. They're so soft yet thick enough to hold body fluids. They fit so nice. My second didn't suffer from diaper rash so I'm not sure how they hold up for sensitive skin. The only con is the price of these for how much they bring. I was ordering every 2 wks and my son is already 1.5 so he doesn't have to be changed as often as a newborn but I still change him quite often throughout the day.

reviews.name: Chasi K.
reviews.title: BEST DIAPERS EVER MADE!!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2023
reviews.review: I am a mother of 6 and I have been a mom for over 25 years and my youngest is 5 and I also have 4 grandkids from ages 5 down to newborn so my word is golden wisdom lol… and I came across these by chance whilst looking for a nighttime pull up for my autistic youngest and I seen these and loved they are eco friendly and no chemicals that typically are found in those other brands which cause my daughter to get a rash on her sides and bum! So i got these and the minute I felt the amazing softness and thickness of these I was blown away, then the real test was that she hasn’t had one single rash at all and these are seriously the most luxurious diapers ever and they’re the most gentle and earth friendly toss diapers you can buy, so buy them you’ll love ‘em!!

reviews.name: lisa
reviews.title: Great diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2024
reviews.review: I love these diapers, after trying several different brands, these diapers have been leak proof, easy to put on and not too bulky. I now subscribe to these diapers because they are solid and dependable.

reviews.name: Lauren
reviews.title: Hold up overnight, fit great, clean
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2024
reviews.review: Bought a small pack to try them and I loved them. My son’s almost 6 months old in size 3 and they fit great. I like them to fit a little big. He wears them overnight a span of 8 or more hours and had no leaks. They hold up really well with #2 also. These diapers are clean and he’s had no rash. I feel good about putting these on my baby! Just ordered more and trying the charcoal ones.

reviews.name: Lindsay Street
reviews.title: Normally cloth diaper but ...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2022
reviews.review: I decided to use disposable diapers for the first two weeks of my husband being gone with a three week old and another child to care for. First off, I don’t know how people afford to pay for disposable diapers. Secondly, my conscious would have been screaming if not for the compostable claim. They want you to do it in a commercial facility. We already have a humanure composting system in place, so we are going to see if they break down there. Thirdly, how do disposable users deal with all the blow-outs? I had to call to get some tips from my sister because wtf. I get a blowout in a cloth diaper very very rarely. Anyway fairly good product that helped me out of a jam, lessening the load just a little. Also, cloth diaper as much as possible, please. No matter how “eco friendly” the product, it’s cheaper and less hard on resources. I am using the same diapers I originally bought for my five year old

reviews.name: PNC
reviews.title: Sturdy diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2024
reviews.review: I have been using Coterie diapers on my child for a couple years now. I was tired of the auto ship thing. So I tried Dyper. They are great. Not as soft as Coterie though. But far far stronger and better than the national popular brands. Love them.

reviews.name: Sarah
reviews.title: One of the top two diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2024
reviews.review: Good diapers. Soft. Super absorbent. Good fit. Mostly compostable!! Hurray!

reviews.name: Avory Noel Bowers
reviews.title: Love this brand!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024
reviews.review: Never had a blow out using these diapers. Super soft. We’ve tried so many other brands, these ones are the only ones that don’t give my son a diaper rash. Only diapers we use!

reviews.name: Lashedbyangie
reviews.title: Very comfortable
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2024
reviews.review: Honestly I decided to try new diapers because my child easily gets a rash with Luvs and Huggies. This was the best decision ever!!! Very soft and comfortable I haven’t seen a rash since. A little more pricey but definitely worth it.

reviews.name: Momma's Cookin with Crisco
reviews.title: Nice quality diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2024
reviews.review: Purchased as a baby shower gift

reviews.name: Casey Simpson
reviews.title: Great brand
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2024
reviews.review: Absorbent and no chemical smell. These are over priced but good product.

reviews.name: Howtypical
reviews.title: Love these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are so soft! They fit well and are absorbent. Best of all they are nontoxic. I have purchased more.

reviews.name: Diane
reviews.title: Bought these for an expected grandchild....
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2023
reviews.review:
This will sound silly, but it's true....

I have an upcoming baby shower for my daughter. I want each guest to write a message of inspiration, or encouragement, or (better yet) something funny to make the new mom laugh during middle-of-the-night diaper changes. This was the only diaper without printing on it that I could find. Seems like a very, very nice quality diaper. I'm sure the baby will love them....

reviews.name: Fatch Racall
reviews.title: Excellent diaper for road trips
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2022
reviews.review:
We cloth diaper normally, but for a 2 day (each way) drive, decided to use disposables. We went with this brand because our friends suggested it, and wow! Super absorbent, no compression leaks or anything, and no other issues. No blowouts either, though that was probably just luck - she didn't have any huge poops on the drive.

I still advise cloth to everyone for the cost savings, but if you can't or don't, these are a pretty darn good alternative. Not sure about the environmental impact of bamboo though.

reviews.name: Albert's Wife
reviews.title: Keeps his PJs, dry all night so he doesn't wake up freezing cold.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2023
reviews.review:
We've tried a few different diapers and pull ups and these are by far the best. They really wick up the moisture incredibly well.
He's a squirmy 1 year old now that loves to run away from diaper changes and these tab fasteners help get the job done quickly. I really love that they are compostable so Mother Earth doesn't suffer as badly as she does with non compostable diapers too. They are worth the extra cost if you can afford a little more.

reviews.name: Robert H.
reviews.title: Eco friendly and absorbent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2023
reviews.review: I tested these and Honest company and Dyper is the winner. The bamboo diapers are soft and absorbent as advertised, but the kicker for me is the Redyper program. This allows you to subscribe to a pick up service where the dirty diapers are industrial composted, meaning they stay out of landfills and lower your carbon footprint.

reviews.name: Dahlia
reviews.title: Took many diaper brands to get here.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
reviews.review: My baby would always get irritated with certain diapers. If she sat in a diaper for more than 2 hrs not would start irritating her. I’ve tried and tested so many brands. Many brands left chemical smells but this one was nice. It didn’t irritate her like the other ones, and holds a good amount of pee especially for overnight.

reviews.name: Kaela
reviews.title: Soft, really absorbent and durable
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2024
reviews.review: Love the fact that there's no prints so you can easily see the blue line. These are the only ones I use at night because they're more reliable

reviews.name: KW
reviews.title: Bamboo diapers make all the difference
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2024
reviews.review: Very absorbent

reviews.name: Syndra

reviews.name: K. Chan
reviews.title: Excellent Quality Diapers that Run a Bit Large
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2022
reviews.review:
The DYPER Bamboo Baby Diapers are excellent diapers that are free of chlorine, latex, alcohol, lotions, TBT, or Phthalates. The diapers are unprinted, unscented, feel soft, and are durable enough to hold in large amounts of your kid's outputs. The diapers fit snugly, wicks moisture away well, and didn't irritate my nephew's skin. They are on par with other well-known brand-name diapers, and the nephew had no issues with leaks or blow-outs. The only real issue that we had with the diapers is that they do run larger than other diapers. This isn't a huge issue given that diaper sizes vary from baby to baby and because we could use the diapers on my nephew at a later time.

The thing that makes these diapers unique is that they are made with very eco-friendly materials. The diapers are made of bamboo and are packed in bags made with oxo-degradable materials. There is a service called Redyper where you can send back the used diapers via mail, or via local pick up so that the diapers and their contents can be composted. My niece didn't look up to try this service for her kid, but rested a little easier knowing that the diapers would at least compost down. Overall, as far as diapers go, this is an excellent quality diaper that is safe for your baby's skin and ensures your baby will be dry throughout the night.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.review: They have a good absorbency, they keep the odors in, and they run a bit bigger than other brands; which is great. The only con is that they’re not as soft, they’re not rough but they could be much more softer

reviews.title: Diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023

reviews.name: Lashello
reviews.title: Absorbs Very Well
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2022
reviews.review:
This review is for Size 6 Bamboo Baby Diapers and I will continue updating it as I continue using it.

I was very hesitant to try a new diaper brand, I was going stick with the top brands as I had a newborn and I was fearing skin irritations, I got this brand as a vine seller and honestly it perfect for the baby’s skin as they are super soft, size one was a little bit big for my newborn she is now 2 months and still using them, we also still use size one in other diapers during the day but at night we use them when she sleeps. The diapers are quite absorbent through long sleeping hours.

The Good

Very soft on babies skin, the diapers are also pretty absorbent

Cons
The size maybe a little bigger for smaller baby’s so what is 1 in most diapers brands you may need to get newborn size instead.
Your going to miss the blue indication line which is on almost all other brans, they will need to eventually do something about that.

Conclusion

The diapers are almost perfect, would work well for baby’s with sensitive skins more than other brans, if your kid has this problem this would be the way to go , you won’t even need diaper rash creams. before purchasing this you will need to check the size to make sure as in my baby’s situation size one was a little bigger than other brands, and finally I think if they start including the blue/yellow line it would literally have this one of the top diapers out there.

reviews.name: Webb
reviews.title: More sustainable and soft
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2022
reviews.review:
We really like these diapers. The fact that they are made from bamboo is really great. They are slightly on the more expensive side but we are happy to pay a little more. They seem to be compostable but I'm not sure how that would work with our curbside composting. For now, we'll just be happy to be putting less plastic and chemicals in the landfill.

The diapers seem to be a bit on the larger side but they also seem to be designed to cover a bit higher than some other brands. The extra protection is welcome and it is nice to know we have a little more flexibility about when to go to the next size up. They also seem to work fine with the top of the front folded down in a pinch. The fact that they are slightly larger is actually an advantage since they can stay in a smaller size longer which includes more diapers in the pack for the same price. a

Overall very happy with the "DYPER Bamboo Baby Diapers | Natural Honest Ingredients | Cloth Alternative | Day & Overnight | Plant-Based + Eco-Friendly | Hypoallergenic for Sensitive Newborn Skin | Unscented".

reviews.name: DBAGproductions
reviews.title: Amazing diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2022
reviews.review:
Pretty difficult for me to be excited about diapers. One of those things that are just necessary with babies. That was, until I found these. These diapers have exceeded all expectations and I can say we’re hooked. The diapers are simple in design but work so well. The lack of design makes it even easier to see the wetness strip and tell if it needs to be changed.
The bamboo material is so soft and absorbent. Our baby has pretty sensitive skin and we’ve had issues with other diapers seeming to cause diaper rashes. Since starting these diapers, we haven’t had any issues.
My absolute favorite part about these is that the company is trying to as environmentally friendly as possible. They have composting services with pick up and mail in options. I was a little hesitant about how shipping dirty diapers was going to go but it’s been working so well! We pack up our box and send it away - knowing that the diapers won’t end up in a landfill somewhere.
So happy we found these!

reviews.name: Jeffrey Van Wagoner
reviews.title: Excellent Plant-Based Diapers for Sensitive Skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2022
reviews.review:
I got this for my daughter-in-law, and the following is her review:

These diapers are absorbent and free from harmful ingredients you might otherwise find in mainstream diaper brands such as Huggies or Pampers. They have no chlorine, phthalates, perfume, lotion, dyes, or latex in them, making them the ultimate eco-friendly, non-toxic, hypoallergenic diaper. They contain a unique ingredient, Bamboo Viscose giving them excellent layered protection and comfort. The diapers have no pattern or prints on them and have no smell, which is one thing I love about them. I like that these diapers were made with the environment in mind; and that no harmful chemicals are in them. The diapers come in a unique eco-friendly wrapped package that comes with a total of 28 diapers. I’m happy with this brand and would purchase these again.

reviews.name: Prime Cat
reviews.title: I think these are GREAT but not for Overnight
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2022
reviews.review: I'm impressed with the quality of these diapers. A lot of times I feel like similar, natural ingredient diapers aren't as effective as other brands like Pampers, which I do use, but I honestly like these and how it fits my baby. I like that it is unscented even though I do like when diapers have a pleasant baby powder smell (like Pampers), and that there is a wetness indicator. The absorbency is great but I'm not confident about using it as an overnight diaper, especially if you baby is at that age where it starts to sleep for longer stretches without middle of the night diaper changes and breastfeeding. My baby woke up with it's pajamas covered in pee. I felt so bad about that. And this was after a 10 long sleep overnight. But for daytime wear, these worked out fine.

reviews.review:

The sides are stretchy, although not as stretchy as other brands -- so they work well now, but might not pull enough for a larger baby. The leg fit well, not constricting.

The inside is pretty soft, and absorbs well. No leaks with liquids or solids. These don't work as overnight diapers for us, but then again, they are not advertised as such.

I do like that these are made without fragrances and bleach like other brands.

reviews.title: Great EXCEPT for newborn!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2024
reviews.review: Yes like everyone else I selected this brand because of their ingredients. You don’t want to worry about what you’re placing on your baby and this is a brand I feel I can trust. And yes it is true, when I had my newborn twins we HATED these diapers. They leaked everywhere!!! So we gave them up pretty quick. I surrendered and switched to pampers pure since you can imagine the amount of diapers I go through with two babies and need a cheaper reliable option I can always find at Walmart. However, one day when my twins were bigger, Walmart was out of pampers pure so I had to buy the size 1 Dyper brand. And to our surprise, these diapers did not leak!!! No problems whatsoever. These quickly became my favorite diaper because they look so trim and nice and just the simplicity (and of course great ingredients). So maybe find a different diaper you like when you have a newborn so you don’t have a bad taste in your mouth and then give it a go once your baby fits in size 1 and above.

reviews.title: Great but expensive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2024

reviews.name: Victoria
reviews.title: Small around the waist
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024
reviews.review: Small around baby’s waist but kind of long in length. Absorbent, feels soft, and doesn’t irritate baby’s skin. Definitely recommend and would gift to others! Docked a star for small waist and lack of accessibility to compost the diapers. (Costs $$$ if you don’t live near one of their centers.)

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Excellent Diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2024
reviews.review: These are excellent diapers. If there’s no poop, these diapers hold great and you can change every 3-4 hours no problem. I haven’t used them overnight, but I’m sure they’ll hold great overnight too. My complaint and hence 4 star review is that the diapers are a bit scratchy when compared to other premium brands. Also, the design is a bit bulky and seems uncomfortable. So, if your priority is eco friendly diaper and you’re okay with the price this is your diaper.

reviews.name: Alexis K.
reviews.title: Love the quality, but expensive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2023
reviews.review: I love the quality and nontoxic properties of those diapers, but too expensive for us unfortunately. They are super absorbent, we used them for over month without any leaks. They are also soft, but not as soft as other competitors.

reviews.name: No Name
reviews.title: Expensive but hopefully good for the environment
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2022
reviews.review: These are the only diapers I’ve used with my baby that don’t give them a diaper rash. We’ve used these over night, and get no leaks. There were only a handful of times during blowouts that we experienced anything messy, but that’s because the baby was in between sizes.

reviews.name: Alba Hernandez-Segovia
reviews.title: Very good quality for sensitive babies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2023
reviews.review: My baby is super sensitive so these were perfect! Another plus would be they run big so great for chubby legs.

reviews.name: sauanu
reviews.title: good diaper

reviews.review: we like this dyper, but as our little one has grown, so has his bladder. we find that others absorb more. Other than that this is a great diaper.

reviews.review: Babies not born yet

reviews.name: tiffany winstead
