reviews.review: They hold more than a normal diaper

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Chemical smell :/
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2024
reviews.review: All other diapers from this brand were great but this last time my mom ordered some for me they smell so bad! I've gotten my other ones straight from the company or from Amazon so I'm not sure why these ones smelled so bad

reviews.name: Emilie
reviews.title: no frills clean diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2022
reviews.review:
These diapers are soft, yes, but not super soft in a memorable way. They definitely feel better than some of the other cheap, plastic-y type of diapers but I wouldn't say it is the softest diapers I've felt. The inside of the diapers do feel a little softer than the outside. These definitely have a good amount of stuffing, and is way better than some of the drugstore brands I purchased - talk about paper thin! I'm not trying to compare these with the "cheap" brands, just pointing out the obvious physical difference in the material and stuffing. All that said, the softness does not matter all that much though, as long as the overall quality is good - and these are.

Sizing wise these fit our baby about the same as other popular brands, with no issues about it being too tight or loose. The closure works great and seems comfortable on baby. I appreciate the indicator line on these, and that is the one thing about diapers that are non negotiable for me. That's a feature I need to have on my diapers as I often rely on that line. These diapers have no cute cartoon or graphics on them, which is fine as that is one less chemical to worry about. The diapers just look very simple, clean, and straightforward.

Our little one doesn't have blowouts too often as we're mostly at home and we change him as frequently as needed. We rarely have to change him in the middle of the night or wake up to him soaked in his crib come morning. That said, we did experience 1-2 wet diaper leaks. One was during the day and other was at night, so I will not be using these for night time use anymore. Overall these work well in the day time though, and it isn't anything to where I'd say to avoid these or for me to never use this brand again. He could have just had too much water/milk that day, more than usual, so until I test this out throughout a longer period of time, I won't fully blame the quality of the diapers.

These diapers are advertised as plant based and eco friendly but I didn't see any information about how well these disintegrate in the landfill. I don't know if these do or if they just sit in the landfill for decades. I wish they provided more information from an eco conscious perspective, as that would have been something that would make me support this particular brand of diapers and make these diapers stand out from its competitors.

Overall I would say give these DYPER(s) a try. Diapers seem to be a personal thing that works differently for every baby, this might just be your new favorite. The diapers seem pretty "clean" and if that type of thing is important to you, definitely check this brand out.

Last thing I'll add is I would like to urge the company to hi-light the eco aspect of these, as that will be one of the things that will help you stand out from major big name brands. As of now, all I know is these are made from bamboo, but I'm not being convinced as to why I should make the switch to this material over some of the other "clean", plant based materials.

reviews.name: Elizabeth R.
reviews.title: Something Had To Have Changed **Review updated, 2024
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2022
reviews.review:
I used Dyper brand diapers for my first son last year and had no troubles, but I just had a newborn and began using Dyper again only to find that they feel very paper-y and my baby pees through every single one. The urine just soaks right through (and this isn’t me allowing him to sit in a diaper for very long either). So, I am sad to say I no longer recommend this brand. Something had to have changed for there to be such a stark difference from my first go-around with these diapers. These are trash now. Literally. I might as well just throw out my opened package because they have no use to me now.

Update, 2024: I figured out that it’s just the newborn size that doesn’t seem to absorb the urine the same way the bigger sizes do. My first son never wore the newborn size because he was a rather large baby. I followed the weight recommendations appropriately for my second son, and he wasn’t an abnormally heavy wetter, but he did start in the newborn size unlike my first son. Once I switched to a size 1, however, the problem ceased entirely. I’m updating my rating to a 4 for the quality of the sizes above newborn.

reviews.name: Verified Purchase
reviews.title: The more we use them, the more we like them. Keep messes contained well so far.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2022
reviews.review: We've been using these for my daughter for several weeks now. I initially liked our regular brand, Pampers Swaddlers, more because those feel much softer vs these that have a bit more of a paper-like feel on the outside (but they are not at all rough - that is just in comparison). While I still like Pampers, I've come to really like this brand. We've had a couple of heavy diapers and these have kept the messes contained well. The shape of the diaper is what makes them stand out for me. I think they call it a "yoga" snug shape or something like that. Now I still can't get myself to embrace the cost. In comparison to what I use now, they are more expensive. I know that these are more sustainable, even the packaging, but when it comes to buying as many diapers as we do, it comes down to the cost. So I definitely keep an eye out if these go on sale or something. But if money is not really an issue, I think these are actually quite nice.

reviews.name: A. Nicole
reviews.title: Nice eco-friendlier diaper for little ones
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2022
reviews.review:
We’ve used pretty much every mainstream diaper brand that’s out there and these ones fall somewhere in the middle - not out favorite but not too many complaints!

I love that they are plain white with no patterns, so don’t show through under clothes, that they are super soft on baby’s skin, don’t contain any harmful chemicals or fragrances, and are somewhat eco-friendlier than other brands.

As far as absorbency, I don’t think these are a top performer. They aren’t bad, but don’t work as well as Huggies or pampers in this regard for us. We definitely can’t use them overnight. And the price, while not exorbitant, is definitely more in line with the most expensive diaper brands.

If your little one is prone to irritation or being a bit more eco conscious is very important to you, then I’d definitely recommend these! I would find a different option for night time though.

reviews.name: JL
reviews.title: Eco-friendly and absorbent!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2022
reviews.review: This is our first experience with bamboo diapers and we’re fairly impressed. These were slightly larger than other diapers of the same size range. This worked for us as we are in between sizes. We used these mostly for the daytime and they have been holding up fairly well. They are comparable in absorbency with other leading brands and conveniently has the wetness indicator. I only had one incident where the diaper was very packed and there was a small leak. The back of the diapers runs tall and provides coverage when poop rises up. I haven’t had back explosion yet. The texture is like paper towel and not as soft as other leading brands in my opinion. I did not notice any scent which is good if baby has sensitive skin. I also want to mention that there are no prints or designs on the diapers- just a plain color. It is a plus that the diapers are eco-friendly. My only gripe was that the packaging was thick and took effort to open it Also, the cost for these diapers seem higher per diaper. Overall decent quality!

reviews.name: Hyperiox
reviews.title: Good Diapers but Smell a Bit
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2022
reviews.review:
These diapers are true to size, and fit well. They only have the one velcro strip on each strap, unlike Huggies' double strips, but it isn't a problem yet for our son, who isn't finicking with his diaper much yet.

The diaper wicks away moisture very well from the skin, and keeps our son rash free quite well. It absorbs a lot of fluid, and we did not have any blowouts after going through about 100 diapers. For containing the mess, these are on par with the more common brands for sure.

The smell of urine does leak out much more than what we've noticed with Huggies and Kirkland brands... and these Bamboo DYPER's are quite a bit more expensive per unit... so it's hard for me to really recommend these over the competition for most babies, but if your child's skin is very sensitive to normal diapers, then definitely give these a try.

reviews.name: Borderline basic
reviews.title: Good diapers not as absorbent as Pampers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2022
reviews.review:
We are typically a Pampers fam but who can resist testing some new diapers?! My son is 32” and about 23 lbs he just moved into size 4 a couple weeks ago. The Dyper brand are very similar in length/width to his Pampers so they work on his long lean shape. He’s at the very bottom end of the size 4 so the waistband is a bit big but we can make it work. The length is great!
The bamboo is really soft, for the more eco conscious diapers I definitely like the feel of these better than Honest. If you’re familiar with Andy Pandy these are super similar in feel, sizing and quality. The Dypers do have a wetness indicator which is always helpful. We haven’t had any leaks so far but they definitely will not hold up overnight as they’re not as absorbent as Pampers.
Overall I give these 4/5. They’re a bit pricier and less absorbent but they’re soft and better for the environment than the big brands.

reviews.name: Karma
reviews.title: So far so good, fragrance free, feels like regular diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2022
reviews.review:
We are feeling a bit guilty about using disposable diapers those aren’t bio degradable. We plan to use cloth diaper for day time after 3-4 months (as we did with our daughter in past). In the meantime we were looking for size 1 and size 2 diapers those go easy on wallet and environment.

Tried these couple of times and so far these seems good enough as branded diapers (pampers in our case).

These do feel relatively soft and our baby has not shown any irritation with these. It does hold well. We are planning to so dar use these during day time and later based on confidence use them during night.

We dont know how long these would take to naturally decompose but anything up to 1 year would be a plus.

These do feel a bit costlier than pampers and other brands non biodegradable diapers, however, we will try to order these in a bit larger sized packages to reduce the per diaper size.

reviews.name: Jane Hinrichs
reviews.title: Really nice diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2022
reviews.review: My grandson has really sensitive skin and he is a mover. My daughter has been using these diapers and she says there have been no leaks and they fit well and no chafing or anything. They are performing great. The bamboo makes it great for the environment too. She typically buys Huggies and these are comparable -- perform just as well. They are more expensive and that is why I gave them 4 stars rather than 5. Families with kids in diapers often have very tight budgets and so this might be an issue for many families. It gets down to what they can afford. But if you don't mind paying the extra money these are quality diapers.

reviews.name: Breezy Andrews
reviews.title: Careful on spills!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2022
reviews.review: These diapers are very soft. Soft on babies skin and haven't caused any scratching or irritation. The are perfect newborn size. My daughter was born 5.12 lbs and came home from the hospital at 5.5 lbs. She is now 9 lbs within a month. She's been able to wear these diapers the whole time. The fit is nice. However, I do feel they fill up quickly. I have had several incidences or accidents of blow outs or leaks. My daughter does seem to pee a lot, but I haven't seen this same issue with huggies brand diapers. So these work well as long as you're on top of changing the diaper often.

reviews.name: Aloha.Tiger
reviews.title: New to bamboo diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2022
reviews.review: This was my first time using bamboo diapers and they have worked well. They are as absorbent as typical diapers, but maybe not as soft. I found the material to be a little stiff and scratchy. It didn’t bother my son, I just noticed they are as soft as other diapers I have used. Overall a good diaper, are they my favorite? Probably not but they definitely work for their intended purpose.

reviews.name: Momma Shark
reviews.title: Good diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2022
reviews.review:
Ingredients:
Textile Content: Outside Cover, Inside Cover: 100% Viscose From Bamboo Fibers, Legcuffs: 100% Pp, Inner Film: 100% Bioplastic, Elastics: 100% Elastane, Others. Components: 22% Sodium Polyacrylate, 35% Elemental Chlorine-free Wood Pulp, 4% Paper, 9% Polypropylene, 18% Viscose, 6% Bioplastic, 2.3% Adhesive, 3.7% Elastane

reviews.name: Shy
reviews.title: Dyper does not absorb well.

These diapers are very soft and pure, and there is no design on them except for the wetness line notification. I would say that the diapers have a little smell to them. These diapers are not good at keeping my son dry after just a little urine. I noticed that after my son urinates, the diaper doesn’t absorb the urine but instead just stays wet against his skin. I don’t know if I will be getting this again unless they design one with better absorbency.

reviews.name: Kacey
reviews.title: Size runs about 1 size smaller
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2022
reviews.review: A little disappointed because the size ran 1 size smaller but overall good absorption and soft diapers however it’s definitely overpriced.

reviews.review: I like that these are safe for my baby without added fragrances and chemicals. I only wish that the size number was on the diaper as well as some indicator of front vs back for exhausted parents. They do have the wet diaper indicator line which I appreciate!

I’m pleased with these diapers, they are working well for me.

reviews.name: Cristina_P
reviews.title: Not the best natural diapers we tried
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2024
reviews.review: We've tried a bunch of the natural style diapers and unfortunately the Dyper brand were at the bottom of our rankings. The only time baby had irritated looking skin was after wearing the Dyper brand and they were the only natural diapers to have leaks. The customer service came on strong like they were really going to be good communicators and then silence. Which was fine... we had moved on to some other natural brands that we haven't had any issues with. Our top three that we keep in the house are Pura, Nest and Terra, those can't be beat.

reviews.name: Suniyya
reviews.title: Not very absorbent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2024
reviews.review: Really wanted to use these for their environment friendliness. Unfortunately they were not as absorbent as regular diapers and my baby consistently leaked through them. I will not use them again for my infant. They were comfortable for the baby and didn’t cause a rash but being absorbent is the key thing one looks for in a diaper.

reviews.name: pamela payne
reviews.title: We tried to love it.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2024
reviews.review: I've been browsing the market for diapers that aren't cotton based after reading research on how cotton isn't good for a ladies who-ha, so I'm assuming neither are cotton diapers for little ones. I was really hopping this was the alternative but they leave stuff all over her down there. They're not terrible, but that was a put off for us, we'll be continuing our search.

reviews.name: Monica Gunter
reviews.title: These are okay
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2024
reviews.review: We tried so many diapers and these were okay. I don’t hate them but I feel like there’s better ones. So far my favorites are Millie moon

reviews.name: Luna Sage
reviews.title: Good backup
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2024
reviews.review: I try to stay away from the diapers that have chemical lines, although this diaper does have a chemical line i am happy that it didnt make my babies thighs break out like the other diapers have in the past.

reviews.name: Jeremy Warden
reviews.title: Meh
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are very soft and gentle which is great for sensitive skin. However the tabs aren’t good, they don’t stick well and have come off a few times leading to a big mess. They are also NOT leak proof. I like the material but wish they were constructed better. I won’t be purchasing again.

reviews.name: Haim
reviews.title: Leak so easily.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2024
reviews.review: While this is a great ecological option, they leak so easily and feel wet on both sides: in and out. I do not recommend this product.

reviews.name: JuGarrison
reviews.title: Run big
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2024
reviews.review: I’ve found Dyper brand runs big compared to Honest and Huggie brands.

reviews.name: Joey Baraga
reviews.title: Company began using bleach on diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2023
reviews.review: We have used dyper for about a year now and always were our number one choice due to clean ingredients and absorption for our 8 month old and pull ups for our toddler. Recently found out they began using bleach on their diapers. It’s a sad day when even a “clean” company begins using harmful ingredients for our little ones. Will no longer be ordering and switching Coterie Diapers due to actually being clean ingredients.

reviews.name: Andrea Furlani
reviews.title: Doesn’t stay super dry

reviews.review: Unfortunately our baby cries when there is pee on this diaper- it’s not that dry compared to pumpers or coterie.

reviews.name: Anthony

reviews.review: Overnight they leaked. Every single time.

reviews.name: Allison Danis-Martinez
