reviews.review: Our son is 24 inches long, a little over 12 lbs at 2.5 months. We were excited for him to grow into the size 1 diapers since they are so soft. However, we found that the diapers were way too wide and too short for him.

reviews.name: devildog
reviews.title: Meh runs smal
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.review: Bought these as my baby had developed sensitivities to others still testing them out so far they run small. Baby was 10 lbs and I felt I was struggling to get them on. There’s also what appears to be a plastic liner in the diaper thin like grocery style bag. After 2-3 hours with just pee babies diaper area there were red marks where the diaper was laying on the skin and the skin appeared somewhat shiny kind of like little to no air flow with high humidity. Will need to go up a size to rule out it just being too small.

reviews.name: CMT926
reviews.title: Not terrible, not great.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2023
reviews.review: These did hold all the overnight pee, however, when they get saturated, little pieces/balls come off and stick to baby. They're fine for daytime, though.

reviews.name: Paige
reviews.title: No size indicators 🤷‍♀️
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2023
reviews.review: Not for families who need to have more than 1 size on hand. There are no size indicators!!! We have some size 5s and 6s and literally the only way to know the difference is by comparing them side by side. How impractical! Otherwise, very good diapers but not practical for my home.

reviews.name: Bec
reviews.title: Way too expensive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2023
reviews.review: Ok I do love these diapers (from what I remember when my child was a newborn). After switching to cloth we like to have disposables on hand and 28 diapers for $20?? Way too expensive. Millie moon has 88 diapers (size 3) for $25. To get the same amount as Millie moon I’d have to spend nearly $100 on dyper brand diapers. I’ve decided we’ll go with another brand instead!!

reviews.name: TK
reviews.title: Made in China = not the most eco friendly when shipping across the world
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2022
reviews.review:
These worked well. But we were paying a premium for these (obviously) because we assumed they were more eco friendly. Found out they are made in China and shipped halfway around the world. American traditional manufacturers make diapers in the USA (albeit with heaps of plastic material). Decided bambo nature was a good middle ground. Bamboo but made in EU.

No point paying a premium for something that doesn't have the benefit it is intended to have

reviews.name: Sami
reviews.title: Leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2022
reviews.review: I really wanted to love these. I love that it is made of bamboo material and the material is soft. Great for baby's sensitive skin. Unfortunately we had more leaks with these diapers compared to other brands we use.

reviews.name: 4Home@Home
reviews.title: Not my favorite diapers from quality and functionality perspective!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2022
reviews.review: These diapers are not soft and can't say how great for baby's skin, however, these are very well built and very leakproof. Wetness indicator is good to have though and it is hypo allergic as well. But I would not recommend these over pampers or huggies brand that we have been using since we have our kid. These are highly expensive and for this price there are many soft and competitive options are available in the market.

reviews.name: S.C.
reviews.title: Decent but doesn't expand in the waist
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2022
reviews.review: The diaper is decent but they don't have a lot of room to expand in the waist like other brands and they fit smaller. For that reason they aren't as good for chubby babies.

reviews.name: Lilbear
reviews.title: Runs way too large
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2022
reviews.review: The softness and absorbency are okay. But the size is really off. My LO is about 25 lbs and 32”. We have tried almost every name brand on the market, all size 5 fits him well. But this size 5 from Dyper runs huge for him. Definitely order at least one size down.

reviews.name: Nottus81
reviews.title: Just okay diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2022
reviews.review: These diapers are soft and seem good for my baby's sensitive skin. The do fit large. They do not have great absorbency. I have often gone to change my baby only to realize she has peed through the diaper.

reviews.name: Brandi Easterling Collins
reviews.title: Sustainable material disposable diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2022
reviews.review: At about 50 cents per piece, these diapers are pricey, but they are made from sustainable materials and formulated for sensitive skin. These seem to be a bit larger than other brands, but the softness and absorbancy is about the same.

reviews.name: Lilbear
reviews.title: Runs way too large
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2022
reviews.review: The softness and absorbency are okay. But the size is really off. My LO is about 25 lbs and 32”. We have tried almost every name brand on the market, all size 5 fits him well. But this size 5 from Dyper runs huge for him. Definitely order at least one size down.

reviews.name: Sunshine
reviews.title: Overnight diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2025
reviews.review:
I originally bought these as overnights because I read they were really absorbent.
Though they are absorbent, it doesn't matter much because they can leak and cause blowouts really easily. The texture of the top and tabs aren't soft at all so they don't seem as comfortable for baby as other diapers may be. I will say they seem decent for diaper rashe/ skin protection because my baby does have sensitive skin and there have been no rash issues. They are fairly durable and size accurate. However, I won't be purchasing again and will be trying other brands

reviews.name: MarshaPinNC
reviews.title: Leaks & Fiber remnants
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2025
reviews.review: I appreciate how natural and healthy these are for my baby. But I don't care for it leaving stringy fibers (of cotton or something?) behind when I remove the diaper. But also, I've had these leak twice, and we're not talking about poopie blow-out, we're talking about pee getting on my baby's clothes from the leg/inner thigh area. Would not recommend without a design improvement on the fit/seal at least. Used newborn size on my ~7lb baby girl

reviews.name: Natalie Zappone
reviews.title: I can’t prove these caused the incident, but won’t buy again
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2023
reviews.review:
My son is 18 months old. Never in his life has he had a poop incident this horrendous. Sure; he had a few mustardy blowouts as a newborn, but this was so much worse. Literally the first diaper out of the pack that we tried led to an absolute disaster during his nap. I went in to check on him after an hour because his chatter with his older brother had turned to hysterical sobs and found his entire crib and self covered in poop. Not liquidy poop that would have leaked out of any diaper- THICK sticky poop that somehow escaped the sides and it seemed like he was trying to make it go away but kept spreading it.

I can’t prove that these diapers cause the problem, but when the very first one we tried caused so much drama and we’ve never had something like that happen before, I don’t want to try them again. Will be using the rest of this pack during his play time and not during his normal poop routine.

Also, for diapers trying to be all natural and better for baby, I don’t understand why these have a wetness indicator. Those are so toxic. The only reason these have 2 stars instead of 1 is because they are very soft and do feel nice. They seem to absorb plenty of pee as well.

reviews.name: Lindsey Johnson
reviews.title: Blowouts & overflowing with pee
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2024
reviews.review: I’ve only been using these for a day with my newborn but almost every diaper has been a blowout or he has peed through it. Never happens that often with the Honest brand diapers. It’s hard to find good diaper brands that have an actual newborn size. Will update as we finish using the pack if it’s just a coincidence or if they really suck that bad.

reviews.name: Sara
reviews.title: Wanted to like these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2024
reviews.review: I wanted to like these, but the texture was weird/plasticky (inside) and they run a little small. We didn't finish the package.

reviews.name: A Weary Sleeper...
reviews.title: Soft and Perfect for Blowouts
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2024
reviews.review: Unfortunately, the soft cotton for the baby bottom provides a soft surface for poop to leak. Without fail, every time I use the Dyper diaper on my baby and he poops, it comes out the back and manages to leak out the leg holes, even after carefully putting the diaper on. It may be good for diaper rash, but it’s not a good diaper for babies that poop... I won’t repeat purchase as I can’t deal with daily poop leaks.

reviews.name: The Sharp Household
reviews.title: They leak and the line doesn't show it
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2024
reviews.review: Overnight not so great. My daughter's back was wet and the line showed yellow, instead of blue. Perhaps because she was sleeping on her back the front did not show. But they leak so I call them defective. Gave 2 stars because the quality seems great, the material is very gentle and airy. The redness is decreased from moisture compared to other brands so I will use them during the day maybe until the pack is gone.

reviews.name: Auburn Alum 09
reviews.title: Lack of color change
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2024
reviews.review: Wanted to like these but got inconsistent color change indicator with wet diapers.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Not great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are really long so no poop stayed in. I even had a pee leak through. & the straps didn’t hold. We would take off the onsie and the straps would be stuck to anything but the diaper. Diapers were soft but didn’t work for us. Going back to Honest diapers

reviews.name: coleman r brown
reviews.title: They leak a modest amount of pee
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2024
reviews.review:
Have to change these every hour or two. They are not water proof at all and should be cheaper with that kind of rate.

Two stars for no plastic but design materials are not doing the job.

reviews.name: A. Smiling
reviews.title: No for my baby
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2023
reviews.review: I really wanted to love these but for some reason they just don’t work for my baby. Maybe it’s better for slimmer babies similar to how pampers brand is better for slimmer babies. Unsure the reason but by the third blowout that shot completely out of the diaper and up my babies leg I officially give up. I probably only used like 10 of these diapers and are giving up. May just toss the whole pack. Going to just stick to Huggies or coterie for a cleaner option.

reviews.name: Ogechukwu
reviews.title: Reminds me of giving birth
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2023
reviews.review: Ok these diapers feels soft but look so much like the diapers I wore home from the hospital after giving birth and I just can’t get that image out of my head. Also the size 6 just didn’t hold up well and ended up sagging and leaking. We tried these in a pinch but will be sticking with hello Bello.

reviews.name: jess
reviews.title: Adhesive doesn’t stay attached
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2023
reviews.review: I really wanted to love these but unfortunately the execution just isn’t there yet. Adhesive will not stay stuck. We had several leaks and major blowouts due to the tape becoming unattached. Only giving more than 1 star because I was really looking for a diaper that wouldn’t have a chemical smell and it does succeed at that… hope they’ll improve and we can use these in the future.

reviews.name: Miss Readster
reviews.title: Soft, eco friendly,but loose and leaks.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2022
reviews.review:
We are super crunchy granola vegan gluten free eco friendly family.

I bought these for our newborn to try them out. We will not be a repeat customer. They are just not absorbent enough. We change our baby every 2 hrs. We have no qualms about changing often. These simply don't hold poop or peeps.

Switched to Huggies Special Delivery much happier. I would not recommend these especially for the price.

reviews.name: brian b.
reviews.title: Does not hold in baby poop!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2023
reviews.review: While we all feel good about being eco friendly, you will use 2x the wipes to clean up. You will also be washing more sheets, clothing, and anything else the baby was in contact with while using these diapers. Would say they work in a pinch, but they don’t.

reviews.name: Adriana
reviews.title: Not actually better than other brands
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2022
reviews.review: I tried these because I wanted a disposable diaper for my daughter that is eco-conscious while we transition to cloth diapers. These are very soft but they aren’t any better than other brands because they aren’t absorbent and they gave my daughter horrible diaper rash. Paying a lot more for a diaper than doesn’t absorb is a waste.

reviews.name: Ashley
reviews.title: Every single one leaked
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2023
reviews.review: Unless your baby has thighs like John Cena, these will leak like a pasta strainer. Do not recommend.

reviews.name: H. Warren
reviews.title: Leak and Not Even That Soft
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2022
reviews.review: Night leaks with these. Don’t have that problem with Huggies or Pampers Pure. Not even that soft to be honest. Felt like a generic brand diaper. Skip these.

reviews.name: ashley
reviews.title: they’re like cardboard
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2023
reviews.review: i don’t get the reviews ?

reviews.name: kali kane
reviews.title: Leaky diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2022
reviews.review: I wanted to love these… I love the softness and the fact they they are sustainably made, but… they leaked all the time. I bought the newborn size for my 8lb baby.

reviews.name: Christopher J Grosse
reviews.title: leaks like a sieve
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2022
reviews.review: We liked the marketing for sustainable diapers but unfortunately that’s all these are. 3 days and 3 blowouts/leaks. We’ll be locking the rest of our stash in the basement for last resort.

reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.title: Very thin and Leak
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2022
reviews.review: These diapers do not absorb well and you end up using twice as many so not costs effective at all.

reviews.name: Jesse D.
reviews.title: Not absorbant. These leak easily.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2022
reviews.review: My baby pees right through these things. Not great for sleeping either since they're not very soft and leak.

reviews.name: Kristina
reviews.title: Major Blowouts & Leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2024
reviews.review: I really wanted to like these but they are absolutely useless. Pee goes right out the leg, poop goes out of the top and legs, it’s a mess. The fit is absolutely not tight enough around the legs and back to prevent blowouts and leakage, and it doesn’t matter how big your baby is. Please read the reviews before stocking up!

reviews.name: Rissa
reviews.title: Good for the environment not for newborn babies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2023
reviews.review: I loved that these were compostable and hypoallergenic. I purchased off their website for my newborn to try them out. I have tried them out for 5 weeks now and I’m not impressed. For the new born diapers, there isn’t a cut out for the umbilical cord so you can’t use these until their belly button is fully healed. Even after her cord fell off when I used the diapers it irritated her belly enough to make it bleed. Now that her belly is fully healed the diapers do not conform to her body and they leak. She regularly has blow outs in these diapers and not in hello bello or in huggies. We change her every 2 hours or sooner, and she’s regularly damp because the diapers do not absorb quick enough, they do not hold enough liquid, and they are too stiff and do not conform to her body. I couldn’t even imagine trying these for my 2 yo son who gets changed less often. If you want an environmentally friendly diaper check out hello bello. They’re cheaper, cuter, and most importantly, they actually work.

reviews.name: Amanda D.
reviews.title: Long and narrow. Didn't work for us.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2022
reviews.review: I like the idea of more natural products for my kiddo but they need to work well as well. These fell short. For one they are very long and narrow, not good when you have a short stalky baby. I felt like I was putting a 90s bikini on him with the tall sides. Given this strange fit I believe this is the cause of leakage for us. They just didn't hug the body right. Mind you I've had no problems with fit on him with other brands, he's a big boy but not excessively so. The pros are that they are clean diapers, no extra chemicals and products but the cons are the leakage and fit. If they can redesign I think it would benefit the brand.

reviews.name: Dawn Wessel
reviews.title: They leak...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.review: As exciting as it is to have diapers that are better for the earth, I need a diaper that doesn't leak. The ruched area around the legs just doesn't cut it. A loose bm is a nightmare...

reviews.name: Daniel Quintana
reviews.title: Blow out every diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2022
reviews.review: Got these as a gift and was excited to try them. Had to change my daughter's clothes after every single poop or pee, the fit was good, but they don't hold anything. They were soaking through in less than 5 minutes.

reviews.name: Honey Bunz
reviews.title: falls apart quickly
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2022
reviews.review: These run smaller in size than the normal brands we use and these also fall apart quickly. Both from our daughter picking the material on the outsize as well as the material on the inside coming apart. We always found little balls of material all over her creases. These are absorbent and did not cause any reactions to her sensitive skin. They just do not hold together that well.

reviews.name: Baby
reviews.title: Big summer BlowOut
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2024
reviews.review: Not meant for my newborn. Every shart has blown out the sides. And every shizzle's drizzle crept throught the diaper and stained his clothes. At one point it shot through the sides and into my hand. Pura1 diapers are where its at.

reviews.name: Baby
reviews.title: Big summer BlowOut
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2024
reviews.review: Not meant for my newborn. Every shart has blown out the sides. And every shizzle's drizzle crept throught the diaper and stained his clothes. At one point it shot through the sides and into my hand. Pura1 diapers are where its at.

products.product_name: DYPER Baby Diapers Size 3 | Honest Ingredients | Cloth Alternative | Day & Overnight | Made with Plant-Based* Materials | Hypoallergenic for Sensitive Skin, Unscented

reviews.name: Kim Whitney
reviews.title: Worth the extra money
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2024
reviews.review: I bought the first box from the company for my daughter to use on my youngest granddaughter. They quickly became her favorite brand. They are great at keeping my granddaughter dry, plus they have eliminated blowouts! They keep everything contained, which saves time and eliminates messes. They are soft on her skin and great quality without all the harmful chemicals that other brands have. My daughter loves that they don’t have designs on them. My granddaughter is almost 5 months old and she hasn’t had a single diaper rash. The only irritation has been in her chub rolls, which isn’t the diapers fault. I wish they were a little less expensive, but the price is worth it considering all the pluses.

reviews.name: K. Tanta
reviews.title: Sustainable diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2025
reviews.review: Our family is a big fan of Dyper and first stared using them in 2019. I love that these diapers are available on Amazon for when we need a quick delivery. We like the capacity, quality and sustainable materials of these disposable diapers.

reviews.name: Marissa Gonzales
reviews.title: The best diapers in the world!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2022
reviews.review: Extremely soft, and absorbent. I purchased these diapers for my son who has sensitive skin, and is very prone to diaper rash from all the harsh chemicals they put in Pampers, Huggies, Luv’s etc. My son was constantly waking up in the night with severe diaper rash, I tried oatmeal baths, diaper rash cream, air drying, prescribed creams and nothing was working. I even went as far as changing his diet to help soothe him. I did some research and found these diapers, I was hesitant at first due to the price point, but desperate to help easy my baby’s pain. After using these, he’s never gotten a rash since! I’m amazed. I highly recommend these diapers to any parent also struggling with diaper rashes with their little ones. These also do not leak which was a huge plus for me. My son drinks a ton of water before bedtime and with any other brand he wakes up completely soaked, clothes soaked and his bedding. But since these he’s dry. These are hypoallergenic, soft, absorbent and 100% bamboo. I love them and will continue using the DYPER brand until he’s potty trained.

reviews.name: Kim Whitney
reviews.title: Worth the extra money
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2024
reviews.review: I bought the first box from the company for my daughter to use on my youngest granddaughter. They quickly became her favorite brand. They are great at keeping my granddaughter dry, plus they have eliminated blowouts! They keep everything contained, which saves time and eliminates messes. They are soft on her skin and great quality without all the harmful chemicals that other brands have. My daughter loves that they don’t have designs on them. My granddaughter is almost 5 months old and she hasn’t had a single diaper rash. The only irritation has been in her chub rolls, which isn’t the diapers fault. I wish they were a little less expensive, but the price is worth it considering all the pluses.

reviews.name: Wolfrano and Mariel
reviews.title: I knew the day was coming when I couldn’t use them any longer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.review:
We used these for about two months, from 7-9 months old in size 5. She is a bigger baby and was about 20 pounds and 30 inches when we used them.

They are now showing to be to tight and we’re definitely restricting her from pooping. They don’t move with my baby very well as she’s learning to crawl. This is a complaint I had read about these diapers but was hoping the clean material would outweigh any negatives. They were good for the short while we used them. Maybe they would have been good for the first months before movement as well! We are still using their wipes. The wipes are ok. They are cleaner than a lot of options out there and fairly affordable. I don’t like that they all stick together so I always pull out a few and it definitely takes multiple wipes and a bit of pushing to wipe away messes. But the ingredients are pretty clean.

She still gets occasional diaper rashes and I try not to use wipes often on those days and use clean towels and water instead and let her air dry as long as I have the patience to.

reviews.name: Muthukumar Natarajan
reviews.title: Absorbence & comfort
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.review:
We’ve been using these diapers since infancy but now as a toddler I find the diaper do not grow so th baby, the flaps are short, so it makes it very uncomfortable and tight around baby’s thigh and makes it easier to leak as well.
These would be perfect if they where made to grow and move with baby, make the flaps longer

reviews.name: MaBelle
reviews.title: Soft and Accurate Newborn Fit
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2023
reviews.review:
6th baby. I’ve used a few bamboo brands in my day. Really happy with these, aside from the super high price tag.

Baby was 7 lbs 3 oz and the newborn size wasn’t too large like some other bamboo brands. You do have to fold down for umbilical stump. That said, baby is approaching 8 lbs and they’re barely working now. Squeezing her into the rest of them before we bump up to Size 1. Still, we’ve barely had any blowout issues (always to be expected with newborns), so the fit overall is top notch.

reviews.name: Teresa
reviews.title: Hypoallergenic
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.review: No more diaper rash when switching from Huggies to these diapers, but they are not as absorbent and leak overnight.

reviews.name: kevin n labar
reviews.title: So so
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2022
reviews.review: I love that these diapers are safe and clean for baby and that they are more eco friendly than most but they are not leak proof. I think the elastic around the legs need to be better because poop will come out easily and if baby pees a lot overnight they leak too. I will note that I have these issues with my toddler but not really with my younger baby.

reviews.name: S.O.
reviews.title: Not bad!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2024
reviews.review: I had originally given these diapers a bad review, but I was a brand new parent and apparently not that good at putting diapers on my baby. You need to put them on fairly snug, and the little frills along the leg holes need to be flared out if you don’t want leaks. Once you do that, they work pretty well. Material is soft and I love that they’re not made with any toxic ingredients.

reviews.name: Lindsay
reviews.title: These work well for my sensitive daughter
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2022
reviews.review:
I was super excited to try these as I currently have 2 kids in diapers and I’ve just recently discovered how soft stuff made out of bamboo is. As far as softness these diapers definitely don’t disappoint. They may be the softest diapers I’ve tried. A couple initial observations I made are that they do have the yellow to blue wetness indicator. One thing they don’t have is any sort of indicator on which size is which. With 2 in diapers this has led to a lot of confusion and my 1 year old ending up wearing way too large of diapers.
As far as putting the diapers on, I feel like they seem to have a lot of extra material that hangs down under the butt. It wasn’t as noticeable on my 3 year old in size 6 but was super obvious on my 1 year old in size 4. The 4’s fit my 24lb 1 year old who is just moving up to size 4 pretty well other than that. The 6’s on the other hand don’t fit my 38lb 3 year old very well at all. They’re tall enough but not wide enough. I have to really stretch the side pieces to get them to reach around him and he’s not chubby at all. He still wears size 3T clothes. He normally wears size 6 in Luv’s with no issues. I feel like the 4’s run pretty accurate for sizing but the 6’s definitely run small which is a bummer since its the biggest size. I included a photo of the 6’s (left) next to the 4’s (right) and they’re really not that far different in size, especially in width.
As far as performance, these have been great for my one year old. We haven’t had any leaking and we also haven’t had any issues with her super sensitive skin. I really like the absorption ability. When they get full they get firm like a dense gel instead of squishy and saggy like a lot of diapers. That’s probably my favorite thing about them since my husband likes to just toss dirty diapers on the floor while changing and the squishy ones leave little wet prints on the floor. These do not. With my 3 year old and the size 6’s these unfortunately leaked overnight. He normally doesn’t have any issues with the Luv’s, but I think thats mainly just due to the size 6’s running small.
Overall I really like these and will continue to use them for my 1 year old daughter. Unfortunately my 3 year old has sized out of them, but I’m hopeful to try the training pants in larger sizes once he’s ready to potty train. The 6’s will probably work fine for my daughter if she ever makes it to that size. I will just have to remember to bust them back out before she actually gets to the 6 size. I think I would still recommend these despite the couple flaws because they are soft and environmentally friendly and perform pretty well when they fit properly.

reviews.name: Mes.
reviews.title: Basic Diaper with Eco-Friendly Benefits
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2022
reviews.review:
I've been using Hello Bello diapers and they are pretty good, but we've been looking at other diaper brands that are good for baby and the environment. I've seen Dypers being advertised on social marketing and really wanted to give them a try.

First impression is that I love that there is no plastic in the packaging. The diapers are wrapped in this substantial/thick paper wrapping. They are fluffy and look very comfortable. The stretchy ridge along the side that holds all the grossness in seems to be more substantial. They have added flaps where the band attaches so they should fit a wide range of babies for a longer period of time - which is great when you have a baby between sizes. I think we left our kid in Newborn size diapers for a week too long. We didn't want to waste the diapers - but It was self-punishment.

My son doesn't really comment or react differently to the diapers so I assume he's good with either brand. He tends to have blow-outs at least once every other day - if not daily. I will say that the dyper kept one of the blow-outs in all the way, but he got the best of them the second time around.

With the other brand, we assume we know that we should just start undressing him the second he needs to be changed.

There are no cute decor to the diapers, they are plain white. I kinda like the cute designs, but whatever, white matches everything.

The last and most noticeable observation is....the price. These are almost twice as expensive as our other "responsibly sourced" brand. I love feeling good about the environment on the manufacturing side, however, these are all ending up in the landfill and I'm not sure if there is data that shows these decompose faster or better than other diapers. Our other brand will be manufacturing in the USA (or just started to...), so maybe they will be similarly priced soon, but for right now - it's hard to make the leap from .26 to .44 per diaper. I feel terrible saying that because I really love supporting earth-friendly "feel good & put your money where your values are" companies.

In summary: These diapers offer an improvement in design - and possibly function. They are recognized for their earth friendly manufacturing and materials. The diapers feel quality, not like they will disintegrate in your hands or on their booties. The only hesitation is the price. If you got the bucks, go for it!
Hope this review helps!

reviews.name: Hyperiox
reviews.title: Good but Expensive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2022
reviews.review:
These diapers are true to size, maybe a bit large but still fit well. They only have the one velcro strip on each strap, unlike Huggies' double strips, but it isn't a problem yet for our son, who isn't finicking with his diaper much yet.

After using about 200 of these diapers in multiple sizes, I can say the diaper wicks away moisture very well from the skin, and keeps our son rash free quite well. It absorbs a lot of fluid, and we have not had any blowouts yet. For containing the mess, these are on par with the more common brands for sure.

The smell of urine does leak out much more than what we've noticed with Huggies and Kirkland brands... and these Bamboo DYPER's are quite a bit more expensive per unit... so it's hard for me to really recommend these over the competition for most babies, but if your child's skin is very sensitive to normal diapers, then definitely give these a try.

reviews.name: Olivia
reviews.title: Runs a little large, but most absorbent!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2022
reviews.review:
We have been using Dyper brand Bamboo Baby Diapers for about 6 months now. With four grandchildren all in diapers, we have multiple sizes in the house! Dyper brand diapers are absorbent and we have had no issues at all with them. The do seem to run a little larger than other brands, but only by a smidge. They are adjustable, so it's not a concern at all. This quantity is amazing! We will not need to buy diapers for two of our grandchildren that both are size 4. It saves Mom and Dad from packing them what they need when they are heading here. These are a true alternative to cloth diapers, but you do get the disposable part!
Yes, they are a little more costly per diaper if you are comparing them to "other" diapers. If you compare apples to apples, the price point is spot on!
We are pleased and that's a lot coming from a parent/grandparent!

reviews.name: Debra
reviews.title: Really great diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2022
reviews.review:
These bamboo diapers are GREAT! These are the only diapers my kid hasn’t been able to leak through. I’m so grateful to have found them. It is extremely pricey for diapers but it is great as it is more eco-friendly than other diapers including the brand named brands. These diapers are light but thick enough to be able to provide flexibility and breathability for baby all the while providing comfort and durability. Nobody likes blow outs and this brand prevents them completely for us. It’s also the only diaper that my son doesn’t have any sort of reaction or itchiness to from the elastic part of the diaper. If your baby is between diapers, It’d be okay, imo, to size down. It does run a tad big for us. Holds a lot as well.

5 stars regarding quality
4 stars with price. Kids are already so expensive. This one, although worth it, is hard to afford for regular or low class families.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.title: Great Quality, No Leaks, a Smidge Big
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2022
reviews.review:
We tried these (well a different size) for our first kid and really liked them. They are no frills (no cartoon patterns or anything), fit well (a smidge big if anything) and we never had a leak. However, we did not continue to use them due to the price. The same is true of this size.

I'd peg them a hair bigger than the name brand Size 1's, but they don't leak and we haven't seen any skin irritation. The lack of a design or print does means sometimes you initially mistake the front for the back when you're getting ready to put them on, but that's not a big deal. Ultimately our only real complaint is that these run about twice the price of the name brand diapers and it's just hard for us to justify that when the name brand ones work pretty well.

reviews.name: Momma Shark
reviews.title: Great diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2022
reviews.review: These diapers are plant based and eco friendly. They are size newborn and come with 204 diapers. They state that they aee made with 100% bamboo vicose. They are non-toxic and are free of chlorine, latex, alcohol, perfumes, PVC, lotions, TBT, parabens, sulphates, & phthalates. They are unprinted, unscented, hypoallergenic, and cruelty-free to protect the next generation. My baby has accidents and these hold up so well! I do notice a slight smell similar to coffee when these get wet..its odd..but I'm guessing it's the filling inside them. I also think this brand of diapers run a little larger compared to other brands. Overall, these are excellent, which they should be for the price. I just wish they were more affordable.

reviews.name: Prime Cat
reviews.title: Great Quality Diapers, Best for Daytime
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2022
reviews.review: I'm extremely happy with these diapers. They are purely clean diapers, no scent, and fabric is soft AND has a wetness indicator. The fit is as expected, similar to Pamper's brand. These diapers work best for daytime, my little one has not had 1 blowout of poop, but has had some leakage of pee in the front overnight. So instead, I use overnight diapers and use these for daytime. I love the quality, they are exceptional but is not great for overnight use in my experience. My baby has not had any irritation using these diapers and it pulls the moisture away from it's skin, keeping my baby dry all day. So happy I would recommend these for sure.

reviews.name: bandbgirl
reviews.title: Odd pricing structure...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2022
reviews.review: These diapers are super absorbent, but also let the skin breath without leaking or pinching the skin at the waist and legs, so they seem comfortable to wear. I love that they're better for the environment and are made from a sustainable resource. They do run about half a size large, but this is manageable. And oddly, there doesn’t seem to be a discount for buying larger quantities as these seem to be the tiniest bit more expensive than the smallest quantity available. So, the 168 count is definitely a convenience purchase, but not a cost saver. Overall, these are great diapers with an odd pricing structure!

reviews.name: d
reviews.title: good diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2022
reviews.review: Diapers made from bamboo? Very interesting. These diapers are simple. White, no designs. They do have the wetness indicator in them (yellow line that turns blue). They aren't the softest, and they are a bit more stiff and bulky than other diapers. But they fit really well. They worked well for my child, but not enough for me to want to repurchase (unless there was a good sale). The company (Dyper) will dispose of used diapers, but you have to empty them out before sending them to be disposed properly.

reviews.name: Steel City Adventure Cats
reviews.title: Pricey, but great diapers! Note: these run LARGE!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2022
reviews.review:
We call these our son's "fancy diapers!" You can tell immediately that they are made of bamboo. The material is very silky and looks shiny, and is so soft to the touch!

Eco friendly diapers that are free of chemicals and unscented, yet very durable and keep baby dry overnight! These are pricey, but in my opinion, worth it!

I did remove a star because of sizing- these run very large. Per the sizing guide my 13.5 pound baby should be in a size 2, but he's swimming in them.

reviews.name: Sunny Bee
reviews.title: Very nice
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2022
reviews.review:
I like the simplicity of these diapers, they are soft with no baby powder scents.
Soft with no prints.
The fit is nice, the only complaint I have is the price.
Seems just a bit too high.

reviews.name: As-Described
reviews.title: Usually Cloth
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2022
reviews.review: I usually cloth diaper but in order to get our life back in order with her cloth we choose to use disposables. These have been ok. I ordered the size 4 based on weight but I feel like she should have been in a size 5. every now and then these have torn at the leg seam getting the silica every where.

reviews.name: JonAndFamily
reviews.title: Soft.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2022
reviews.review: I like this brand and have been using it for awhile. It seems to run larger than the more popular brands. It feels soft and plush and doesn't irritate my child's skin. However, the only downside is that when you remove it, you can still feel dampness on the top. Not a lot of dampness but a bit, so you won't want to leave it on for prolonged periods. Haven't had any blow outs with this brand yet.

reviews.name: Booknerd28
reviews.title: Expensive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2022
reviews.review:
Great diapers and I actually like that there's not any characters or designs on them (so you can't see under lightly colored clothing). The do have the pee pee light that turns blue/green when wet. This is such a helpful tool for newborns!
Very soft and work pretty well for leaks/breastmilk poop explosions.
However, they are VERY expensive.

reviews.name: Felicia
reviews.title: Work well
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2022
reviews.review: These are very absorbent and feel nice but also feel heavier than other diapers.

reviews.name: Lilbear
reviews.title: Runs large
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2022
reviews.review: The softness and absorbency are okay. But the size is really off. My LO is about 25 lbs and 32”. We have tried almost every name brand on the market, all size 5 fits him well. But this size 5 from Dyper runs huge for him. Definitely order one size down for your little one.

reviews.name: Izamar
reviews.title: Soft and absorbent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2022
reviews.review: I think these are one of the best baby diapers i have tried. They are soft and absorbent, tjey last all night no leaks. They fit my 5 month old perfectly, i got size 3. I would recommend.

reviews.name: Christopher Wells
reviews.title: Pretty good for the kid!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2022
reviews.review: A pretty decent diaper. Comes with a very good amount and the diapers themselves seem soft. The kid doesnt seem to be uncomfortable or anything so thats a plus. She also has a sensitive butt and these haven't aggrevated anything so big plus!

reviews.name: Kari Russell
reviews.title: Good natural Diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2022
reviews.review: These are great diapers. They are non scented and naturally made of bamboo. There is nothing fancy about them, however they work really well especially for overnight diapers!

reviews.name: JonAndFamily
reviews.title: Soft.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2022
reviews.review: I like this brand and have been using it for awhile. It seems to run larger than the more popular brands. It feels soft and plush and doesn't irritate my child's skin. However, the only downside is that when you remove it, you can still feel dampness on the top. Not a lot of dampness but a bit, so you won't want to leave it on for prolonged periods. Haven't had any blow outs with this brand yet.

reviews.name: Booknerd28
reviews.title: Expensive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2022

reviews.name: LoveBooks
reviews.title: Expect blowouts
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2022
reviews.review:
pros: these diapers are soft! I just took one off my son and it held a lot without leaking and I like how it fits. They’re better than parents choice in my opinion! Bonus for being clean and earth friendly!
cons: However these are for chubby babies, he’s in size ones but they still don’t fit around the waist without it fitting weird and he always blew out so easy, even if it was just pee. I would say these fit more like a size 1.5 than a size 1! I will save them for when he is bigger and see if its better.

These are SO Expensive. I wouldn’t purchase them again due to that fact alone knowing I will be using twice the amount of a cheaper name brand

reviews.name: LoveBooks
reviews.title: Expect blowouts
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2022
reviews.review:
pros: these diapers are soft! I just took one off my son and it held a lot without leaking and I like how it fits. They’re better than parents choice in my opinion! Bonus for being clean and earth friendly!
cons: However these are for chubby babies, he’s in size ones but they still don’t fit around the waist without it fitting weird and he always blew out so easy, even if it was just pee. I would say these fit more like a size 1.5 than a size 1! I will save them for when he is bigger and see if its better.

These are SO Expensive. I wouldn’t purchase them again due to that fact alone knowing I will be using twice the amount of a cheaper name brand

reviews.name: Chris H.
reviews.title: Something changed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2024
reviews.review: I've been using these diapers for a year on both my boys. Originally I loved them and they really helped us overnight where the cloth diapers just couldn't cut it. Then Dyper made their black charcoal diapers. We bought those and could not use them because they caused rashes. We came back to these and they're different. They fall off all the time where they didn't used to before. They do not have the same absorbency and they rarely last overnight anymore. Extremely disappointed because of all the diapers we've ever used these were the best. Unfortunately I'll have to try to find a different brand now

reviews.name: Taylor
reviews.title: Massive Shift in Quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2023
reviews.review:
I used Dyper exclusively with my daughter several years ago. Loved that they were soft, never caused rashes, biodegradable and the monthly subscription included emergency shipments. Raved about them to everyone, “my kid has never had diaper rash!” “No blow outs, ever!”

Ordered these for my newest addition and it’s clear that they have changed their manufacturing practices. The material is thinner
and has the absorbency of Kleenex. The line doesn’t consistently change color, but his clothes are soaked. Half of these lead to wet clothing and Mom. Then at least 5 - 10% of the box were unusable because the tabs were broken / missing.

I’m insanely disappointed in Dyper. Inferior materials + increased costs = lost customer.

reviews.name: Pedro
reviews.title: Fall apart
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2024
reviews.review: They will fall apart even after only an hour of wear. The inside beads spill out and stick to the skin. Multiple diapers broke on us. Too expensive for the lack of durability.

reviews.name: chelseybhenney
reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2023
reviews.review: I really wanted to love these diapers. I wanted to buy a diaper that was made of quality materials and contribute less to our landfills. We couldn’t make it through our first box of these. Our daughter, who was 1-3 months old while wearing these, would leak urine or blow out in them, every single day. We would take a break from them for a day or two, do some Pampers or Huggies, have no issues, and when we’d try these again, the same thing happened. At first we thought maybe the fit was off, but now that we’ve tried them over a span of time that fits the recommended weight for the size, we know the diapers are the problem. Such a shame!

reviews.name: nick
reviews.title: Very rough and irritating
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2024
reviews.review: These fit good and so far have kept I everything dry and no blowouts . However they are very rough and irritating to even my skin. They feel like rough polyester or something. Will not purchase again.

reviews.name: Jo
reviews.title: They bust often, beware.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2023
reviews.review: I’ve been using Dyper for a while (almost a year), but within the last month or so the diapers have busted, releasing the water absorbing beads. These really irritate my son’s bum and crotch area. I don’t know if they started to cut cost in the production of these, but I’m absolutely switching brands. These diapers are too expensive to bust every other day, and causing my son too much grief in the process.

reviews.name: Kay
reviews.title: Not TCF
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2022
reviews.review: I have been using these diapers for my son for 6 months, but I just found out that they stopped being totally chlorine free (TCF) last year. :( So furious. I feel totally misled. These contain toxic chemicals from chlorine, as they are only free of elemental chlorine. This whole time I thought that I had been using TCF diapers for my little one. They should have to publish an ingredient change like this - instead, it's like they hooked consumers by saying that their diapers were TCF, then quietly started using non-elemental chlorine without notifying consumers.

reviews.name: Anna
reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2023
reviews.review: This is the worst when it comes to leakage. Every time my child wears this and happens to poop and pee especially simultaneously … the diaper will overflow and leak. I’ve had to change bedsheets and clothes and other items repeatedly throughout the day because of how bad these diapers will leak through. Never had this issue with the other diapers. Will never purchase these again!

reviews.name: cas
reviews.title: Wanted to love these…
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2022
reviews.review: The first time I ordered these it was worth it to me because it was the only thing that kept my daughter from getting a rash. I’ve tried every diaper, even cloth. She’s just so sensitive. My second and third box was absolutely terrible. They didn’t keep her dry. They fell apart. And they leaked constantly - as soon as she relieved herself she was leaking…

reviews.name: Oksana Davyd
reviews.title: Decreased quality/ thickness of the product
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2022
reviews.review: I was purchasing this dippers for entire year. Now the quality decreased and price increased. What a difference in thinkers from before and now . This is SHAME!! Fix it!!! Go back to the same thickness to the same quality to provided before ! Stand behind the product you do ! Why charge more and give less ???

reviews.name: Crystal
reviews.title: Soaked through diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2023
reviews.review: My 1 year old just leaked through the diaper, fully wetting the bed.. and I mean through the actual diaper (not the sides). That said, I’ll never buy these again. I’m disappointed!

reviews.name: jgreeson
reviews.title: These diapers blow. Literally
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2023
reviews.review: Had these for a week. Almost every #2 has been a blowout. Do not recommend

reviews.name: Allison
reviews.title: Like the Bengals offensive line
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2023
reviews.review: These diapers let everything through. Poop, pee it all gets out. Pampers, Huggies and Kirkland signature all better leak protection. 4 am covered in poop is officially my line for trying to help the environment.

reviews.name: Lauren Gines
reviews.title: Constant Blowouts
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2023
reviews.review: Do not buy these! We have multiple blowouts every. single. day with these diapers. They're also more expensive than average diapers. They're not worth it. Buy anything else.

reviews.name: Tatyana Goncharov
reviews.title: Not worth the price or hype
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2024
reviews.review:
I am disappointed in these. They leak, They break off easily and fall off when the baby is on the move.
After 2 hour wear, my baby was covered in beads! Not worth at all. This is my experience at least.

reviews.name: Emily Riani
reviews.title: I hate these diapers! Walmart brand at luxury prices.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.review: I got these because they were running a special for $24 for 120 diapers. Honestly $24 is too much too be paying for these and the fact that they are regularly close to $100 is laughable. They are awful. My son is 15 months not a heavy wetter and typically does not need to be changed in the middle of the night with other brands of diapers. These diapers leak like crazy, I have to get up to change him in the middle of the night. The tabs are super weak and rip off when he's running and playing. I hate them with a passion. There are so many other brands that are "clean" and not $100.

reviews.name: Britanny O’Brien
reviews.title: I hate these diapers.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.review: We’re not a 1 diaper brand kind of household. Whatever we have, whatever we get is fine. But these are not fine. They suck. My daughter doesn’t regularly have blow outs and has had 3 in week while using these. They’re completely plain and that makes it hard to tell the front from the back. The yellow stripe is hard to see.

reviews.name: salvatore
reviews.title: Leak immediately
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2023
reviews.review: Unfortunately following a pee the diapers were leaking for our 2 week old not sure on the time but I believe I fought it early. We changed her and then had a wet bowel movement and the same thing as soon as she had the movement from the time I stood up and walked to the changing table the diaper started leaking. Not sure in what case these would be suitable.

reviews.name: Andrew Medina
reviews.title: Worst rash ever.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.review: I would upload a picture of what my son’s butt, and private area looks like. But we all know that’s inappropriate. The point I am making here is that these diapers are suppose to be good. And for the price they should be good right? WRONG. I have never seen a rash like this before. BLISTERED. My niece used them too and she got a rash on her hoo hoo. VERY disappointing. I feel sorry for my baby for us using these diapers on him. 😭 0 star!

reviews.name: M D
reviews.title: Absolute trash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2023
reviews.review:
Everything from this scam of a brand is "sustainable" garbage that barely works a tenth as well as the real deal.

Wipes dry as the Sahara.

Diapers less absorbent than a rock, falls off constantly.

May as well just wipe your kid's ass with a leaf and wrap them in a towel.

reviews.name: Brianna DeBruin
reviews.title: Instant rash!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2023
reviews.review: Didn’t absorb well, baby who had been in Huggies no issues instantly got a super red mad bottom! Will not be using these again.

reviews.name: very chilly
reviews.title: Leak and smell
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2022
reviews.review: It’s 4 am and I just had to change a soaking wet diaper that couldn’t keep the absorbency for more than 6 hours. And they do smell. Premium priced diapers, but quality not so much

reviews.name: Jenine
reviews.title: What's the whole picture?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2022
reviews.review: I'm almost certain these are produced in China. Nothing against the coal-loving Chinese but... eco-friendly they are not. And I'm sure the cargo ship traveling across the ocean to bring these to the States is cranking out all kinds of pollution. I don't know if Dypers is being deceptive or if they really think the entire value chain isn't important when we talk about taking care of the Earth.

products.product_name: DYPER Charcoal Enhanced Diapers | Baby Diapers from Plant-Based* & Honest Materials | Day & Overnight Diapers | Disposable Diapers for Sensitive Skin (Size 4, 44, Count)

reviews.name: C. + A. Rising
reviews.title: Fantastic diapers!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2025
reviews.review: These diapers are great. I love how neutral they are and they haven't given my daughter any diaper rash! Perfect size for her age as well. They are quite expensive unfortunately.. but I love the design!!

reviews.name: Danielle edwards
reviews.title: Best diaper I’ve ever used on my babies!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2025
reviews.review: I love how absorbent these are. I also love that you don’t have to change the diaper every 2 hours because it’s so absorbent. It’s more cost effective and the diapers are so soft. My daughter has sensitive skin and these helps so much. My daughter can sleep through the night in one diapers with no leakage. Amazing quality.

reviews.name: Jessica
reviews.title: Best diapers around!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2024

reviews.name: Loraine
reviews.title: Two thumbs up
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2024
reviews.review:
I love these Dryper charcoal diapers. They are soft and not bulky allowing my baby a more natural stance and simple balance while she strengthens her muscles bouncing and standing and doing the walking motion.

We are in a size 3 at 3 months with an excellent fit. There was a one week of being between size 2 in another brand and 3 with this brand but thankfully it was only a week! My daughter now fits the diaper like a panty.

The design of the back creates a barrier for breastfed baby poop not to escape. The extract material after the barrier is nice to have in case something escapes. Although that part is not super absorbent trust me it’s saved us a few times. My daughter is a pooper expert sitting up during or immediately after feeding so back runs are common - the barrier really helps.

I don’t like I can’t see when she has peed, but she is changed or checked regularly anyway so it’s not so much of an issue for us.

The material is soft and the black is stylish but most importantly the comfort and ease of use for our baby is fantastic.

Highly recommend this diaper size 3

The regular Dryers are not part of this review. I do not like them. We tried those at size 1 - no go for us.

Dryper wipes - we like as well (recommended)

reviews.name: Polly
reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2024
reviews.review: I should have not bought these! I got them on sale on prime day. They are awesome! They put other diapers to shame. They are super absorbent and we can use them as night diapers and no matter how huge it got it never leaked. It’s better as a night diaper than the night diapers by Huggies, pampers, honest, parents choice. Their texture is also very sturdy and cloth like. If they weren’t so expensive these would be the only diaper we would use. Now that I know how great these are they will haunt me and remind me how crummy the diapers we use now are at every diaper change. :p It’s like getting to drive a brand new luxury SUV for a month and then going back to driving a 2002 dodge caravan. Sure they get the same job done but you know which one you’d pick if the cost weren’t an issue :D The picture is a used diaper after kiddo was playing outside on the farm sliding his butt around on rocks for a few hours. It’s amazing how they hold up! Like how!?

reviews.name: Darwin
reviews.title: Excelente producto
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2025
reviews.review: Mi bebe esta feliz con este producto

reviews.name: lb
reviews.title: Love them!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2024
reviews.review: Ever since I heard of DYPER from Go Diaper Free, I KNEW that DYPER was the only brand I wanted to use. We use Simply Kind diapers and the REDYPER service to cut down on plastics in the landfill. I’ve been wanting to try these ones for a while and finally ordered them. Absolutely love them! And they are REDYPER eligible 🙌

reviews.name: katie Davis
reviews.title: The absolute best
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are the absolute best for my son. The only ones that do not break him out, or leak! The only diapers I will buy for him.

reviews.name: Meaghan Furnari
reviews.title: Love these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are by far my favorite. I’ve tried multiple different brands nontoxic, organic, and these by far superseded my expectations. My baby never smells of urine, and very rarely does he soil through the diaper. It’s made really well, not irritating at all. Love the quality of these diapers and will only use these diapers

reviews.name: Karina cay
reviews.title: Best dypers ever
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2024
reviews.review: The only DYPER I use with my son. They are the best. They are super absorvent.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Soft, fits great, and better than regular dypers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2024
reviews.review:
I’ve been purchasing the regularly dypers for quite some time, my baby is now 9 months and I’ve been using dyper diapers for about 6 months. The quality of the regular dypers in size 4 seemed to not preform as well as the 2 & 3, and were leaving behind strings of bamboo viscose which seemed to irritate him, that I could only remover with bathing or vaseline; and they could no longer get him through the night without leaking. Overall the white dypers still were better than other diapers so when I saw the black dypers I decided to take a chance and see how they matched up.

I was not disappointed. The black diapers are soft, the fit is more snug, design in general is better, no bamboo viscose is left behind causing irritation, and they’re keeping him dry overnight. He’s been having better night sleeps, which means momma has a better night sleep. I’m happy I took the chance and tried these out. If you’re using the other dypers and are thinking of trying these, do it; you won’t be disappointed.

They’re also fun, his papa calls him a ninja now that he’s sporting a black dyper diaper.

reviews.name: Melissa
reviews.title: I love these diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2024
reviews.review: I love these diapers. They are soft and don't have all the nasty chemicals other diapers have. I have noticed a difference in my baby's skin since switching.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Was unsure, but they are the favorite currently
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2024
reviews.review: Oh the endless wading through diaper options. We have tried probably every single "eco friendly" "safe non toxic" diaper on the market. For a while we were using honest which we still like, but they kind of fit my baby weird and he kept having front pee leaks (and not because the faucet was facing up). We have been using these for a couple days now and they are the best fitting diapers we have used so far. They have a wider hip hugging part which secured him more, they look cooler, and they absorb A LOT. No leaks so far even though they run a little big. He is a size 3 in all diapers and the size 3 definitely runs a tad bigger than other diapers and even still no leaks or blow outs. I dont care about a wet indicator strip if you cant tell you baby has a dirty diaper without a blue line thats on you.

reviews.name: J. Monty
reviews.title: The best diapers on the market - hands down!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2024
reviews.review:
Absolutely fantastic diapers! These diapers are the only thing that stopped my daughter from getting severe diaper rash! We had an ongoing issue (even using other top-brand diapers) which would sometimes land my daughter in the doctors office (with a fever). We thought she was being bitten by spiders at first but it turned out to be a nasty diaper rash.
These diapers by "Dyper" are incredibly well made, the carbon really works and these diapers are definitely worth the money. If you are a parent with a child that suffers from recurrent diaper rash - give theses a try, you won't regret it.
Fit is excellent, no leaks - and I love the stylish black colorway (unique for a diaper). We love them and have found our brand of diapers from here on out! I just ordered another case yesterday. 5-stars all day!

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2024
reviews.review:
I absolutely love these cool looking diapers.
At first, I thought the "charcoal" was infused with the top layer of the inside of the diaper.
These diapers are soft and clean, but the sleek "black/charcoal" is so different and cool.
I ordered these for my toddler grandson (size 5) and they are perfect for him (21 months, 25.6 Lbs.). I sure hope they have charcoal pull ups for when he is ready to toilet train.
They HOLD so much liquid.
So far no blow outs and when I say they hold a lot of liquid, I mean A Lot! But, the wetness is not on the baby/toddler skin.
I highly recommend these.
The price is not on the cheaper side, but affordable. I actually bought just to try out and I'm glad that I did.

Been using the original white versions for years for all the reasons you're probably on this page: pretty good for the environment, pretty good on chemicals, and pretty good on butts.

When I realized we were running low on the white ones, I saw that these would be delivered sooner so gave them a shot. They're really good. Can't say I noticed a ton of difference regarding the smell, but I did get a kick out of how bizarrely cool my son looked wearing them. Highly recommend for the amusement alone.

reviews.title: Really good; charcoal is a nice touch?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2024
reviews.review:
These diapers are great. I think they are my favorite non-'national' brand. They feel natural and soft. And it's super hard to tell about the charcoal but I feel like things might be filtered by the charcoal and there could be weaker smells etc. So that's pretty interesting.

They also work well for overnight use. I don't think my daughter wet through any of these overnight. On the other hand she generally doesn't but I know that there are some brands that she'll regularly wet through overnight.

Anyway, the natural based materials and high quality of these make these a really cool diaper that *should be* better for the environment than other larger brands.

This review was written for: DYPER Charcoal Enhanced Diapers | Baby Diapers from Plant-Based* & Honest Materials | Day & Overnight Diapers | Disposable Diapers for Sensitive Skin (Size 5, 36, Count)

reviews.name: ktshabatie
reviews.title: Gentle on Baby and the Planet: A Review of DYPER Charcoal Enhanced Diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2024
reviews.review:
As a first-time mom committed to reducing my environmental impact, finding eco-friendly baby products that prioritize sustainability without sacrificing performance is a top priority. That's why I was excited to try DYPER Charcoal Enhanced Diapers, and let me tell you, they have exceeded my expectations in every way.

First and foremost, I appreciate DYPER's commitment to using plant-based and honest materials in their diapers. Made with bamboo fibers and enhanced with charcoal, these diapers offer a gentle and natural alternative to traditional disposable diapers, which often contain harsh chemicals and synthetic materials. As a result, I can feel confident knowing that I'm choosing a product that is safe and gentle on my baby's sensitive skin.

But what truly sets DYPER diapers apart is their eco-friendly design. Unlike conventional diapers that can take hundreds of years to decompose in landfills, DYPER diapers are biodegradable and compostable, meaning they break down quickly and harmlessly, leaving behind minimal environmental impact. As an eco-conscious parent, this is incredibly important to me, as I strive to leave a healthier planet for my child to inherit.

In addition to their eco-friendly credentials, DYPER diapers also offer excellent performance. With their superior absorbency and leak-proof design, they keep my baby dry and comfortable day and night, giving me peace of mind knowing that she's protected from leaks and accidents. Plus, the breathable materials help to prevent diaper rash and irritation, keeping her skin happy and healthy.

I also appreciate the convenience of DYPER's subscription service. With automatic deliveries right to my doorstep, I never have to worry about running out of diapers, and I can feel good knowing that each delivery is helping to support sustainable practices and reduce waste.

In conclusion, if you're a first-time mom looking for an eco-friendly diaper option that is safe, gentle, and effective, look no further than DYPER Charcoal Enhanced Diapers. With their plant-based materials, biodegradable design, and superior performance, they're the perfect choice for environmentally conscious parents who want the best for their baby and the planet. Say goodbye to compromise and hello to gentle, eco-friendly diapering with DYPER.

reviews.name: Taylor
reviews.title: Excellent!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2024
reviews.review: I have never used Dyper before but these are excellent diapers, and I would absolutely order them again. I don’t know if the charcoal truly does anything, but these are high quality. They are a good thickness without being bulky, and cover all of my squishy baby. We haven’t had any leaking or blowouts during the day. I wouldn’t necessarily use them overnight again (at least for a boy), since my baby sleeps on his front and a little bit of his front ended up damp in the morning. For another kiddo they may work depending on how they sleep. We also haven’t had any rashes so in my experience they’d work for those with sensitive skin.

reviews.name: KG
reviews.title: Charcoal Magic !!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2024
reviews.review:
These charcoal-enhanced diapers have revolutionized my parenting journey, offering a reliable and eco-friendly solution for my little one. Crafted from plant-based and honest materials, these diapers present a conscientious choice for parents prioritizing sustainability. The incorporation of charcoal enhances their absorbent capabilities, making them ideal for both day and overnight use.

What distinguishes these diapers is the use of viscose from bamboo, providing a super soft, high-end, and gentle touch on my baby's sensitive skin. The exceptional absorbency guarantees my baby stays dry and comfortable, reducing the chances of irritation throughout the day and night. The eco-friendly approach, using bamboo-sourced materials, aligns with my commitment to making environmentally conscious choices for my family. These diapers also serve as a natural odor absorber, enhancing the overall diapering experience. Additionally, they absorbed and held well at the edges with no leaks, providing peace of mind and reliability. While the initial investment in these diapers may be slightly higher than conventional options, the super soft feel, high-end quality, natural odor-absorbing properties, and leak-proof performance make them well worth it. The diapers are easy to put on and take off, allowing my baby to move freely and comfortably.

In conclusion, DYPER Charcoal Enhanced Diapers have become my preferred choice for a reliable, eco-friendly, and baby-friendly diapering solution. If you're seeking diapers that prioritize your baby's comfort, the environment, and offer exceptional performance, these are an excellent investment.

reviews.name: Shorty_77
reviews.title: They keep the stink at bay.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2024
reviews.review: Love these diapers! I really prefer the charcoal dyper diapers over their original kind. They seem to fit better and definitely seem softer. They keep the smell down as well. They have decent absorbency, not the best over ever seen in a diaper but all in all, I’d say my top 3 diaper I’ve used on my grandson to date (he’s 2).

reviews.name: Adam
reviews.title: Matches or beats any name-brand diaper out there
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2024
reviews.review:
I’m a big fan of these diapers and wish I found them earlier. They’re as nice or nicer than any mainstream diaper I’ve used, and I’ve tried pretty much all of them.

The manufacturing of these is very nice and uniform. They’re all cut to the exact same size with great QC. The fit is true to size. They go on securely, stay on, and are comfortable to wear (according to my kid). They absorb as well as any diaper brand I’ve tried, and we’ve had zero issues with leakage.

Overall, these are very high quality diapers and a great value for the money. Plus they look cool. Recommended.

reviews.name: WME
reviews.title: STURDY diapers, run a bit large
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are unlike any other brand we have ever tried, in a good way. If you are willing to pay a premium for a high quality, soft, highly absorbent, but also eco-friendly diaper, this is a great option. They feel super thick but are also soft to the touch - unlike some other plant-based diapers I have tried in the past. We have had no issues with overnight leaks and have used these almost exclusively for overnights since receiving them. I noticed no odor - chemical or otherwise from these diapers. The black color is unique - not the greatest option if you are dressing your child in light colored pants and do not want it to show through, but otherwise, not a problem. If it is a concern for you - these are manufactured in China, something to be aware of if you prefer to not purchase imported diapers. We tried size 4, and they seem to run a tiny bit bigger than some of the common brand size 4s.

reviews.name: L Wang
reviews.title: solid product, easy to use
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2024
reviews.review:
We've been using the same name brand the hospital used for the whole time. We switched to this and went off without a hitch. Kiddo adapted well and didn't seem to mind. There was one leakout (not blowout) but he's also had some leakouts with the name brand one. There was probably an element of me not putting it on properly since it was the second time I used them.

The biggest differences is that the straps/velcro thing is a bar that goes across the front middle of the diaper, and that there is no wetness indication that the name brand had. But if your kiddo is only wearing the diaper while sleeping, it's not a huge deal since they just remove the diaper when they get up.

Absorbancy is fine for overnight, and I didn't run any testing on it. If the kiddo is wearing this during the daytime it might be more tricky in terms of figuring out when to swap it out, so I think the best use case is someone who's only using this when sleeping. All that said, I'm sure it'll work for normal 100% duty as well, but just with a few disadvantages mentioned earlier.

Overall, works well for us. Not having a wetness gauge is certainly a disadvantage, but a 0.5 star deduction still gives this a solid 5 stars for us. Happy with this and would certainly consider using this over the bigger brand if it requires less resources. 4.5 rounded to 5 stars

reviews.name: B. Bender
reviews.title: remained dry when testing
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2024
reviews.review:
I didn't have a baby available to test these on, next one is still a few months out :) So I poured 3.25 oz of water in the Dyper and it absorbed it quickly and the diaper was very dry on the inside. I couldn't feel the water and I even used a paper towel and pushed it against where I'd poured the water and the paper towel remained dry.. I did the test two more times and the Dyper never leaked but I could feel the wet inside. I let it sit a while and the water never came out even when I twisted it a bit.
The elastic feels soft but it should hold everything in without binding. The diapers are very soft. I love the side closer, like Velcro but softer and you can readjust them as many times and you want. The only negative I found was the looks, I just don't care for black on a baby.

reviews.name: FabulousFinds
reviews.title: Great Addition to the Baby Bag
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2024
reviews.review:
The DYPER Charcoal Enhanced Diapers are an absolute must for any new parents. The infusion of charcoal not only combats odors effectively but also adds a sleek look to these essential items. It's been a relief finding diapers that are so gentle on my baby's delicate skin, suitable even from newborn stages through to toddlerhood. The softness and absorbency are unmatched, feeling more like cozy yoga pants than a traditional diaper, and they fit almost like underwear, providing peace of mind against leaks.

What really sets these diapers apart for me is their safety and environmental responsibility. Knowing they're clinically tested and dermatologist-approved, free from a long list of harmful chemicals, and cruelty-free, gives me confidence that I'm making a wise choice for my baby's health and our planet. The fact that they're soft and help with smell is just the cherry on top.

For any new parent navigating the vast choices of baby products, DYPER's Charcoal Enhanced Diapers offer comfort, performance, and the added bonus of being eco-conscious. They've certainly earned a five-star review from this grateful parent.

reviews.name: Joseph R
reviews.title: Great diapers for your little one
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.review: Like most parents, you will go through about a million diapers. My wife swears by a certain brand but I just buy what is usually the cheapest. We love these because they are soft, they absorb the same as my wife's favorite brand, and you can tell that these are much softer and nicer than the super cheap ones that I usually go for. Plus these diapers are also really stylish, and are a stealthy looking black.
