The fabric and material they use is top notch and the added feature of charcoal as an odor controlling element is a nice touch. Just be aware that the charcoal odor control works better for the liquid filled diapers than the stinky solids. The fit is about what you would expect in sizes compared to other brands, and the elastic bands on the legs and waist are nice and soft and should help to reduce any chafing or rubbing. I give them 5 stars and I can't complain about them other than the fact they are pricier than most of the other ones so if you can live with that, then this is the brand for you.

reviews.name: Ashleigh
reviews.title: Excellent, absorbent, stink-free diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.review:
I have been using these for a couple weeks now as overnight diapers for my 22 month old daughter. I cloth diaper pretty exclusively during the day with disposables at night and babysitters. I’m very sensitive to the awful chemical smells that she’ll usually wake up with from most other disposables. These don’t have any of that stink, even after 12+ hours! She’s not a terribly heavy wetter but depending on the night can saturate a diaper and we’ve had no issues with leaks. The overall diaper fit is really great and while she doesn’t usually poop at night, the leg seals are excellent!

They run true to size when compared to other brands. She’s 32+ lbs and the 6s fit her great, except I do feel like the tabs are a little short compared to other brands. I can fasten the diaper fine but if you had a super round baby you may be totally at the limits of the fasteners.

Occasionally I do notice a little black along where the edge of the diaper lies, though the majority of the inner is white. The black is kind of a cool look compared to the usual white printed diapers!

Not a cheap disposable by any means but it’s comparable to other “clean” brands when you figure out cost per diaper.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Great natural diaper! Best overnight diaper for newborns!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.review:
Overall this is a great, natural, diaper. The Dyper logo on the front is Velcro-like so you can adjust the tabs for the best fit. There is support around the legs, and elastic the whole way across the back so it moves with your baby, fits well, and helps prevent leaks. The diaper is thin. The fabric isn’t overly soft, but it doesn’t feel like plastic either. For testing/review purposes, I poured 16oz of water into the diaper in the last picture. The diaper expanded and was able to hold the amount without leaking. However, I did remove 1 star because the water pooled up in the legs and was slow to absorb. After all the water was absorbed, the diaper was still wet to the touch, so if you’re using this overnight, the moisture would be up against your little one’s skin. Since the price is almost double that of any other size 2 diaper, I’d like to think it could stay dry to the touch and quickly absorb without pooling first.

Edit - The above test and review was written while I was pregnant. Now that my son is here, I’ve updated my review from 4 to 5 stars. I’ve been using these diapers at night due to the cost, and because diapers specially made for nighttime are not available until a size 3. My son wears a size 1 in regular diapers, but I sized up to a size 2 for nights. These diapers have not leaked at all!!! The Pampers Baby Dry I was previously using usually leaked by the early morning. The Charcoal Dypers have not leaked at all! He wears them for about 12 hours without any issues. When I change him in the morning, his bottom is still baby smooth and doesn’t have any redness or imprints on it. I definitely recommend these diapers for nights!

reviews.name: Laura H
reviews.title: Different but effective
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.review:
I'm more impressed by these diapers than I expected to be. They really do feel more like fabric instead of plastic, they fit well, they hold a lot, and given the choice my kid reaches for these instead of our regular white ones. Plus when my kid is having a tantrum I can laugh to myself about my "emo baby" wearing black and complaining that parents just don't get it.

Depending on how much water gets drunk before bedtime we sometimes have a problem with diaper leaks overnight but so far have not had that problem with these. I also love that they don't contain dyes or perfumes or anything since I'm allergic to some of those. There isn't any sort of wetness indicator stripe on these so you kinda have to just know about how long your kids goes between diaper changes so you know when a clean one is needed.

While these are significantly more expensive than the daytime diapers I normally get they are similar in price to the overnight diapers I've been using but are a lot more environmentally friendly so it's a pretty good deal overall. I might just end up sticking with those for nighttime moving forward since my kid seems to like then so much. I would recommend them.

reviews.name: Samantha Martinez
reviews.title: Diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2024
reviews.review: Good quality and good absorption. No leakage and seemed to fit comfortably on my child.

reviews.name: Robert
reviews.title: Great!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2024
reviews.review: These were great for our baby girl! She has sensitive skin and these did not cause any kind of irritation to her skin. The smelly diapers were not an issue with these either. Must have

reviews.name: R.P.
reviews.title: Stylish Odor-Fighting (but Expensive) Diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.review:
I never thought I'd refer to diapers as stylish, but these Dyper Charcoal Enhanced Diapers proved me wrong. My baby looks like like the baby version of one of those Calvin Klein underwear ads with these on!

But looks aren't really the important part of diapers. The baby normally wears Huggies Little Snugglers Size 1 and we tried Dyper Charcoal Enhanced Size 1. Recently we've been having some blow out issues with those (not size related) so this was a great time to try something new. These Dyper diapers seem to fit her a little better. We've had no blow outs in the Dypers when we were having ~1 every other day in the Huggies.

I was skeptical that "charcoal enhanced" diapers were going to do anything about odor, but the baby's poops were definitely less noticeable with these diapers.

There's no color-changing strip on these to tell you when they're wet, but they seem to puff up a bit as they absorb moisture, so you can generally tell whether the diaper is dry or not without checking.

The biggest con with these diapers is the price. They're about 50-60% more expensive per diaper than a similarly sized box of Huggies diapers (and spot checking the larger quantities shows similar price differences). I'm not convinced that these are 50-60% better, though that may depend on whether the Dypers continue to avoid blow outs better than our other diapers!

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Great diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2024
reviews.review:
These diapers are so soft and gentle on my son's skin. We use cloth diapers at home and regular diapers at daycare. We are interested in being more environmentally friendly, so these were a great alternative for our daycare that would not allow cloth diapers.

We really liked these because they don't break him out after being wet. The daycare did have concerns about not being able to tell if he was wet. So, he was either in an extremely full diaper or being changed when he was barely wet. That is one of the few downsides to these diapers. They look cool, but lack some of the typical features like the wetness indicator line. The bonus is they do hold a lot of liquid without leaking.

They do run a little larger. I felt like the size 2 diapers fit more like a 3 in other brands. I have a tiny baby, but these could work really well if your baby has chunkier legs. The velcro was strong enough to wrap him tight and we didn't have any leaking around the legs.

Overall, these are great!

reviews.name: K
reviews.title: Great diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.review:
These are wonderful diapers. I simply love the look of something different from the typical white diaper. It is a nice switch up. While this doesn't have wet indicators like some other brands, which is nice to have, this has other benefits that outweigh that blue line.
These diapers have great absorbency. I changed one that was filled with moisture and not a drop had even threatened to escape. They fit wonderfully and the tape adheres very well. These do, in the short time I've been using them, seem to be helping keep baby's bottom less red and irritated, which makes for a happy baby and a happy mama.

Overall, these are just great. They look great and function wonderfully. Anything that can help alleviate diaper rash and pains is worth its weight. These are pricey, but you get a lot of diapers for way you pay. I definitely recommend these, especially if your baby might be having issues with diaper rash in his/her regular diapers.

reviews.name: Julio Carpio
reviews.title: Nice texture
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2024
reviews.review: Good material and absorption. Comfortable on baby’s thighs. Hides smell just like any other diapers. Stretchy and soft. Easy to put on and take off. Good value for your money

reviews.name: Adri Bee
reviews.title: Charcoal diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers have a unique look to them since they are black, which I have never seen before. They fit great, they come in a large quantity so this box set will last a while. The diapers work great, are absorbant, and really help to control odor.

reviews.name: lifegetsbetter
reviews.title: Classy Designer Diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.review:
These are Fantastic Diapers! You can see by the photo of the diaper with the logo that these look like classy diapers and they really are classy diapers! They are made very well. They are extraordinarily absorbent but keep moisture away from baby.
The diaper really is black as seen in these photos. My phone camera would not see the black color and instead made the black appear gray. So, I simply upped the contrast when I moved the photos to my iPad so that you can see their true black color.
The velcro works well. I didn’t even realize that it was velcro at first because it is so soft to the touch! As you can see by the photos, the entire bamd where the logo is, is one super soft velcro strip. This makes these diapers incredibly adjustable. You can see in the one photo where I almost completely covered the entire logo while attaching the velcro. And it is easy to unattach, and reattach the velcro as needed.
I put these diapers up to my nose and I could barely smell anything. Charcoal is a great ingredient for these kinds of things.
I did some measurements here on a couple of photos so that you can get a better idea if these diapers will fit your baby or a friends’ or family’s baby. We all know that diapers are a Great Baby Shower Present!
I highly recommend this product! I hope that these photos and information have helped you on your search!

reviews.name: Az Customer
reviews.title: Lux diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2024
reviews.review:
I really love the natural and allergy sensitive approach with these diapers. I think they have an absorbent bottom, with little sides that come out to keep solids and liquids inside the diaper. The most unique thing I noticed is that it has little velcro like tabs instead of glue tabs on the side. I'm not sure if this is standard these days or unique to these diapers. I tugged on the sides and I don't think they would come open either as they were very strong.

I bought these in anticipation of having a baby. But am really impressed with them so far. They do have an expiration date. Mine wasn't until 2026, which will be plenty of time for me to use them. I did not factor in price in my review as I'm not sure how expensive diapers are these days.

The size 2 does seem true to size and would likely fit a chunky newborn-few months old, but way too big for a preemie.

reviews.name: Adrienne
reviews.title: So fun
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2024
reviews.review: It’s so fun to have the black diaper look…very different from anything else available. I’m not sure that the odor control is that much better than other diapers, but it’s definitely not worse. As far as function, they seem to hold as much if not more than a standard Huggies/Pampers/Kirkland. We only tried the size 1 so far and they seem to fit maybe a tad smaller than a Pampers size 1. Seems a little pricey for my taste, but at least seems to be a decent product.

reviews.name: Jacquelyn Preiss
reviews.title: Quality and Safety has a price
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.review:
Like other reviews, I agree that these charcoal diapers raise the quality standards several notches. Just the black diaper, alone, sets this in a fashion category of its own.

But, there's more to this diaper than a fashion statement. They are well-made with ample stretch-elastic for form-fitting coverage. Along with the odor-fighting charcoal, the diapers are designed with an elastic leak guard. The ingredients list charcoal, corn starch and other plant-based material and are free of latex, alcohol, PVC, perfumes or phthalates.

But that's not the reason why these diapers come in at twice the price of big-box stores. I researched the company and was extremely impressed with their global website. While these diapers are made in China, they are distributed by an American Company and certified through several global organizations. First, the diapers are Oeko-Tex certified -- tested for 350 toxic chemicals. Also, these diapers are "Dermatest" certified -- a global "seal of approval" which ensures excellent skin tolerance and safety for the user. For me, those are important certifications that are much appreciated. There's a lot of quality tucked within this diaper. The company's transparency is also appreciated.

Again, they are expensive -- almost double the cost of other big-box store diapers. But, compared to other "plant'based" socially-responsible companies, they are comparably close in price.

reviews.name: SAM
reviews.title: Level Up for the Environment
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2024
reviews.review: These charcoal based diapers take the use of disposable diapers to a new level of elegance. The look, design and even smell is superior. Clearly quality in the way they perform in absorbency. They are soft, fit well and look very posh. They are eco-friendly and will not fill our landfills for hundreds of years like others. Unfortunately, having all the bells and whistles comes at a price. Are they worth it - yes. I would highly recommend for those that can afford the difference, however for most it just is not feasible. For us, we will use these diapers for special dress up occasions and for nighttime use because they are so much better. For us, they will not be every diaper change, but we will use them sparingly and order more as we can because the benefits are so significant in multiple levels.

reviews.name: Aaron Brisendine
reviews.title: Great diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2024
reviews.review: This was our first go around with this type of diaper and I was honestly surprised. They are excellent for sensitive skin and the first diaper we have tried without diaper rash. Love the fit also as they have stopped any leaks that we had seen with other brands. I think these diapers provide excellent value for the money and they just work like a diaper should. Excellent!

reviews.name: waehrik
reviews.title: Very sturdy, absorbant, and good looking. Packaging is a bit wasteful
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.review:
These look really classy. Which is an odd thing to say of a diaper but it makes one think that aside from features and effectiveness they all look generally the same to a casual observer. Except these. The black exterior (presumably that's the part that's loaded with charcoal) gives a very different impression. And it looks nice which is almost unfortunate considering they'll be covered up a majority of the time. So far zero blowouts which is always a good thing. There isn't a pee indicator but I've never really relied on that anyways since it's immediately evident by how much they've swelled up if they need to be changed.

Maybe it's in line with their premium pricing and branding, but the packaging is a bit excessive and wasteful. The outer cardboard box is thick with a lot of black ink and contains two sleeves of diapers in the thickest plastic wrapping I've ever seen for a diaper. The sleeves are also printed black. Since these are sold as a box, and not a large one at that, it would be better if they minimized the interior packaging a bit to conserve resources.

reviews.name: L. Hill
reviews.title: Excellent, super impressed!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2024
reviews.review: I never realized that I'd have such intense opinions about diapers- but these diapers are by far the best I've ever found. The quality of the materials, the ability to get a perfect fit (no leaks), the odor reducing properties- these tick every single box and make me annoyed at other diapers. These are outside of my budget for frequent repeat purchases, but when I do get these, I absolutely love them. I didn't know there would ever be a diaper I considered sort of "luxury" but these are SO NICE. One use and I became a diaper snob and I'm not sure how I feel about that new part of myself. 😆

reviews.name: Y. Chiu
reviews.title: Plant Based Diapers without Harsh Materials
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.review:
These DYPER brand diapers are a breed of their own. To start with, they are infused with Charcoal, known for its odor absorbing qualities and are actually black rather than the conventional white color. They are primarily made from plant based materials. Additionally, they are non-toxic and are free from chlorine, latex, alcohol, perfumes, PVC, lotions, TBT, parabens, sulphates, & phthalates. They do not have any imprint, scent and are hypoallergenic so that there is no issue for babies with sensitive skin. In lieu of conventional adhesive strips, these have extra soft Velcro-like closure which are less likely to come accidentally undone.

As these are size 1, there are two sealed bundles of 30 diapers each for a total of 60.

These are definitely a high quality diaper.

I will be gifting these to new Parents-To-Be. I do recommend these.

reviews.name: Captain & Miss America
reviews.title: Diapers for goth babies or formal events
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2024
reviews.review:
Black box - these are definitely for a fancy night out or the Addams Family. I like their smart packaging: 1 case with 4 boxes and 2 packs of 56 diapers in each box. This ought to last a week or two.

I was worried that they’d be black all of the way through but the interior is just like other diapers. The interior texture is good, not as smooth as some but very soft. The tabs are wide and easy to use.

Our boy has had zero blow-outs, but at size 2 he’s not very active yet. I get the impression that these would be effective at the larger sizes - hopefully we have some time before he starts crawling and we find out.

Skin reaction seems normal - when he’s dry he’s fine. Nothing to indicate that the lotions in the diaper are reactive. Good to know.

Being black sets them apart, and these are fancy. They’re nice diapers, the comments we get about them are positive (I mean, they’re kind of cool), and they can hold their “stuff.”

reviews.name: Christine Giles
reviews.title: great diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2024
reviews.review: These are great diapers. I love that they come in such a large quantity. They work well and they're free of many harmful toxins.

reviews.name: Cyclegreen
reviews.title: Work great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2024
reviews.review: I usually use Sam's club diapers but frequently have issues with blow outs. I got these to see if I would have better results with my little one, and I have not been disappointed! Although pricey, they work great and I love that they are more natural and ethical. I have had no issues with blowouts or leakage with these. The black color looks sleek too. I don't think I will switch to these entirely just do to cost but I might start using them overnight more frequently to prevent leaks.

reviews.name: Jeff
reviews.title: Soft, no leak, no rash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2024
reviews.review: When it comes to diaper, my top 3 desires are: soft on the skin, no leak, and not causing rash. Dyper meets all with additional advantages of being “clean” . We have been using Huggies special delivery, which is very soft, and Dyper is even softer! The size is about the same to Huggies special delivery and good for fat babies

reviews.name: Robert H
reviews.title: Super Absorbent and Stylish
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.review:
Wow! These diapers are quite impressive! The first thing that struck me was the color. Black diapers were something to see initially, but they are unique and add a modern style that has never been seen before.

The diapers have incredible absorbency that rivals and surpasses industry-leading diapers!

They are also very soft. From the pictures, they look like they would feel scratches, but they are very soft on a baby's skin!

reviews.name: M. Ross
reviews.title: Stylish, well-made, and effective disposable diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.review:
These Dyper diapers are top-notch disposables, infused with charcoal to help with odors and cleanliness. They come with no perfumes or other chemicals or irritants, making them hypoallergenic and safe for your baby's skin. They're well-constructed and look good with their black outside color. Plant materials are used for key parts of the diaper, making them more planet-friendly.

The leg openings are elasticized to help retain the "deposits" your child makes, and are lined with a generous amount of soft white absorbent material. They come with built-in tabs (each corner) with velcro-like tape to allow plenty of adjustment room for a custom fit.

With this jumbo box, we will have plenty of diapers on hand for when we keep our great grandson, and these will do the job well and with style. 5 stars.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Great diapers and like the color!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2024
reviews.review: First off, these diapers are black which is a fun change from traditional white. Honestly could be used to make some interesting diaper cakes for baby showers. In terms of use, my LO had no blowouts in these so functionally they were great. The diapers also felt super nice. Very glad we got to try these!

reviews.name: Leon
reviews.title: Really premium diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2024
reviews.review: I used to just default to Huggies or Pampers because they are the incumbents and I figured they knew what they were doing. Now this "DYPER" brand comes along with black diapers, which looks pretty cool. But I didn't know if they could produce a better diaper than the main brands. Well I was wrong. The DYPERs are very good. They cinch really snug and I haven't had a leak yet. I've been using them for a few weeks and I would say they perform better than the main name brands. The charcoal, I thought might have been a gimmick, but they do filter out odors really well! Highly recommended!

reviews.name: Brendan
reviews.title: Crazy comfortable!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.review:
I almost feel guilty throwing these diapers out when dirty. The material feels like cloth, they look awesome, and they do a fantastic job when it comes to containing your little one’s “business”. The charcoal material does a great job of keeping in the stink.

My biggest complaint is the lack of that coveted “blue line”, but as a parent, I’ve never needed a blue line to tell me it’s time to change a diaper. These are expensive, but man are they nice. If money is no object, I highly recommend what are the nicest diapers I’ve ever seen!

reviews.name: Bona Fide
reviews.title: Great Diaper Choice- Absorbent, Comfortable, Stays on Well, Sturdy Tabs
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.review: These DYPER Charcoal Enhanced Diapers are great! They are excellent fragrance free diapers. They have a cool look to them, fit my little one well, and haven't caused any irritation or chafing issues. They are comfortable and soft. I have used softer diapers, but they are soft enough. The absorbency level is excellent and the elastic around the legs keeps things in very well. The tabs are very sturdy... I definitely don't think any will pull off as has happened to me many times with other brands. They stick and keep the diaper secure. I really appreciate this brand overall. I haven't noticed the charcoal doing anything to keep smells in or less noticeable, but I didn't really expect it to. I love the natural makeup[ of these diapers and don't have any fears putting these on my baby!

reviews.name: Elena
reviews.title: Nice, good quality diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.review:
These diapers are very nice quality. They have a curved top to fit a baby’s body more comfortable around their legs. The outside feels a little more rough than big name brand diapers, but still a little soft texture. The inside is soft and feels like a regular diaper. It holds my baby’s pee.

The down side is it does not have a wet indicator so I have had to feel inside the diaper to feel if she had peed in one of the diaper checks. Other than that they’re nice diapers.

reviews.name: Stephenie F.
reviews.title: Wonderful!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2024
reviews.review: I am always very picky with the quality of diapers that I purchase so believe me when I say, these diapers are everything! The color is what attracted me at first and then I was pleasantly surprised to see that they are not just aesthetically pleasing but also made of comfortable material for my baby's body. Very absorbent. Fair price. Highly recommend!

reviews.name: Joe P.
reviews.title: Absorbent and don't irritate sensitive newborn skin.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.review:
First thing when I got these is I was wondering if the charcoal would rub off on clothes and blankets. I didn't notice it being a problem in use with a few of the diapers.

They are absorbent and hold a good amount of liquid. They hold up well during sleep and we've had no leaks in the few days we've used them. They are also soft and don't irritate sensitive skin.

I can't say that I feel the charcoal is helping any to reduce odor because with newborns in our experience you really don't ever smell when a diaper needs to be changed anyway. It's only when you take the diaper off that you smell anything. At that point the diaper isn't stopping odors from getting out. Maybe with older children the charcoal will play a bigger factor.

In the end they are good diapers which work and keep your child from making a mess everywhere.

reviews.name: Hope
reviews.title: Nicely different than other diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers were unusual in that that are a cloth versus a plastic one. The outside is a soft fabric. These ran large compared to Hug diapers. My toddler wears a 6 in them and this one was a size 3 that fit but would be a bit snug. But not by much! The tapes fit good and it really wasn’t too tight. This was absorbent after urination. I like that they are made with natural ingredients versus chemicals like other diapers.

reviews.name: Dtim
reviews.title: honestly they did smell a bit weird
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2024
reviews.review: The diapers look like any other brand, just with a slight charcoal color. It did have a weird smell at first but goes away quickly. The diapers haven't had any leakage yet and performs well enough on par with other name brands. I did notice that the smell doesn't penetrate as easily as other brands so maybe that's the charcoal doing the work. The good thing is that these diapers are compostable so if you want to put it in your compost bin it should work due to it's plant base material.

reviews.name: winampplayer
reviews.title: Soft without any fragrance and help up well
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.review: These charcoal enhanced diapers felt really soft and had no fragrance. They are made with high quality materials and you can tell when you feel it. There is no blue indicator line like other diapers that show when the diaper is full, but if you've been changing diapers for awhile you should be able to visually tell when a diaper is full. The diaper fits really well on my 2 year old and held up for 5-6 hours without any issues. His skin tends to be sensitive and there was no allergic reaction when wearing these diapers. There's an expiration date on the box, which I'm guessing it's because of the charcoal ingredient. The 128 diapers came in 4 medium sized boxes, 2 packages per box, 16 diapers per package.

reviews.name: Microcap
reviews.title: Great diapers but they are expensive!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.review:
These are nice diapers that fit well and don't leave a weird odor. Very soft on the inside and we've not had any issues with any leakage going through the diaper. The white liner is thick and does a great job of holding any fluids.

Definitely feels like a premium product and it's better that it is made using good material for the environment.

It's expensive, though! Huggies is about 1/3rd the price so I can't justify the price paid when it's ultimately a disposable product. It would make a nice gift for a baby if you want to stand out, though.

reviews.name: Deemama
reviews.title: Different but better!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2024
reviews.review: I really liked that these diapers were in black. They are super soft and feels like it’s better quality than others that are on the shelves. They worked and fit well on my toddler and held its messes in without leaking. I’m very happy about that. It does seem to absorb smells better too. Overall, these are great quality and I liked that there’s no harmful chemicals being used and didn’t irritate my son’s skin.

reviews.name: M.C.
reviews.title: Exceptional diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.review:
Now that we’re grandparents, we’re in the market for things we haven’t shopped for in years, diapers being one of those things. My son and daughter-in-law have tried several different brands, and report Dyper is about the best they’ve found. They’re made with plant-based materials so are better for the environment. They are very absorbent and fit well. The other Dyper diapers they’ve used have been the more traditional white, so these black diapers are extra fun. Such a change from the usual white and pastel-printed diapers, these make a bold statement! The addition of charcoal seems to held control odors.
Wonderful product!

reviews.name: Pickle for a nickle
reviews.title: Resilient and chemical free diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.review: DYPER charcoal enhanced diapers plant based 60 count. Free from dyes, sulphates, lotions, PVC, latex or other chemicals. Hypoallergenic and unscented. These diapers are surprisingly solid. I’m not a subscriber to the “let’s put charcoal in everything” hype. I don’t know if that part actually does much. (For reference I’ve tried charcoal toothbrushes and toothpaste products etc.) That said, yes, I would recommend this brand. They’re well-made, better for the planet, and better for baby. They might not be the most cost-effective option but if you can afford them they are worth it.

reviews.name: The Reviewer
reviews.title: Such fancy and trendsetting diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.review:
Everyone is familiar with plain white or some small pattern for diapers but black? Definitely a change here and definitely well received to us! Definitely adds some style.

The charcoal diapers were new for us as well but anything help with the odor is a plus. The diapers are made very well and held up without issue. No issues (yet) with how they fit and stay. No issues or complaints from us so we’d recommend these for sure. The black outer covering definitely makes these more fun.

reviews.name: Mary
reviews.title: Absorbant and thick
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are thick but soft, my niece often gets rashes with diapers and she didn't develop any skin sensitivities with these. I really appreciate that they are non-toxic, free of chlorine, latex, alcohol, perfumes, PVC, lotions, TBT, parabens, sulphates, phthalates, are unscented, hypoallergenic, and cruelty-free. It makes us feel a little better about the amount of waste produced from children's diapers. The sizes are on par with the name brand diapers and the black color of the diapers are so unique!

reviews.name: Joe P.
reviews.title: Absorbent and don't irritate sensitive newborn skin.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.review:
First thing when I got these is I was wondering if the charcoal would rub off on clothes and blankets. I didn't notice it being a problem in use with a few of the diapers.

They are absorbent and hold a good amount of liquid. They hold up well during sleep and we've had no leaks in the few days we've used them. They are also soft and don't irritate sensitive skin.

I can't say that I feel the charcoal is helping any to reduce odor because with newborns in our experience you really don't ever smell when a diaper needs to be changed anyway. It's only when you take the diaper off that you smell anything. At that point the diaper isn't stopping odors from getting out. Maybe with older children the charcoal will play a bigger factor.

In the end they are good diapers which work and keep your child from making a mess everywhere.

reviews.name: Jb
reviews.title: Love these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2024
reviews.review: We use coterie and healthy baby but really like these as a more readily available option! They fit well and no leaks. Less toxic too which is important to us.

reviews.name: DANIELLE GREEN
reviews.title: Worst diaper rash ever but great diaper whaaattt
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2024
reviews.review: We use regular Dyper brand regularly. When they had supply issues we ordered a box of these thinking they would be great for overnight. Which they are GREAT for OVERNIGHT. But our poor sensitive butt baby. She smelt great the morning pee smell covered but oh the rash. We went back to our regular Dyper diapers and all it well. Yes not as great overnight or covering the smells but no more rash. I would use again with another kids though.

reviews.name: Season Marsh
reviews.title: New favorite diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are absolutely great. When I started looking for a nontoxic diaper brand, I felt overwhelmed, but once I found these, I felt so much peace with my decisions. I feel like I’m making a great decision for my child. There’s no leaking, no rash and the quality is great. The fit is great and I would recommend these to any of my friends for their children.

reviews.name: Dustin H.
reviews.title: Runs smaller than standard dyper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2024
reviews.review: Just a heads up that the size 1 in the charcoal dyper does run a bit smaller than the standard version dyper. It’s almost like it’s a size 3/4. Other than that they work great and we haven’t had any blowouts even though our little one sure has tried a couple of times. Can’t attest much to the odor mitigation as our little one’s backend blasts still don’t have much of an odor.

reviews.name: Pita
reviews.title: Not for us
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2024
reviews.review: Leaks though the middle so cloths get wet. Rough so they are itchy. They look cute but I won't buy them again.

reviews.name: Amz Customer
reviews.title: Nice, soft diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2024
reviews.review:
+ These are really nice and soft diapers.
+ The plain black design is a refreshing change from all the other typical diapers with different prints.
- There is no blue line for parents who rely on the wetness indicator, but honestly you should be able to tell when baby needs a diaper change by just feeling for fullness.
- No size number. I have 2 kiddos and it can be hard to tell the difference between their diapers at a glance. Even with identifying animal prints, my husband and I have accidentally gotten diapers mixed up at times. These plain black Dypers with no numbers would make identifying the sizes that much harder if you have multiple packs open.
- Not sure how much the charcoal helps with smell, but it’s no match for my baby. Poops definitely still stink.

reviews.name: Dianne L.
reviews.title: Looks like underwear, some small issues
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.review:
We tried these for our 1.5 year old and 3.5 year old, size 3/4 and size 5/6 respectively. They work just as well as the name brand diapers and the look is fun and different. It's more expensive than other more popular brands though because of the materials used. The fit is true to size and they aren't overly bulky and they look pretty cool! Underwear looking actually. Because of the material it doesn't have much stretch as other name brands so it fits "tighter". Size up if you are in the higher end of the weight recommendation if you want a looser fit.

It's a plant based material diaper, but it feels just as comfortable and holds overnight just as well as any premium diaper brand. I would recommend these if you're into plant based materials.

I am giving it a 4 (4.5 if I can) star because of tiny little details. These do not detract from the diaper's performance but are things I consider/prefer as a parent. 1. The black bag packaging (2 black bags in a small box, 4 small boxes in a big black box) has perforation on top but it opens to the diaper's waistband side. I prefer pulling diapers on their folded side so I know I am grabbing only 1 out of the bag. If you are like me, open the bag from the bottom. 2. No size markers - I have 2 kids and its hard to differentiate one size from another, especially if its 1 size difference. I've had it where the kids pooled diapers on the floor "accidentally" and having size labels on the diaper makes it easier for me to separate them out. Without a size marker, make sure to keep both diapers' location distinct and avoid pooling accidents (where diapers get mixed on floor). 3. No usage marker - most diapers have that yellow line that turns green to help you visualize pee use. These do not have those so you need to do a feel test or just change more often. 4. My daughter tends to get rashes with these more, probably due to material than brand. Again, just need to replace more frequently (adding to cost).

If you do not care for the issues I raised above and can afford these, add a star.

reviews.name: Nick E
reviews.title: Good, functional diaper, but near 5x the cost of other options
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2024
reviews.review:
Charcoal Enhanced Diapers: $29.99 for a 32-count box at the time of review

It may surprise you to learn, as I am currently writing a diaper review, that my wife and I don't actually have children. What we do have are friends and family who have children. And well most of the time they come prepared, there are the occasional instances of being caught with their literal and figurative pants down. So my wife and I like to make sure that we keep a good stock of baby supplies at our house for just such occasions.

*What I liked*:

The thing that appealed to us about these diapers first and foremost is the environmentally responsible sourcing of materials. We like to make sure that we purchase responsibly and these diapers seem to fit into that category.

The next thing that I will say is that, according to the family, these diapers do work well. Are they that much better than other less expensive options? I couldn't tell you for sure, but I suspect not.

*What I didn't like*:

The one glaring, blaring out of a trumpet, downside to these diapers is the fact that they are nearly 5 times the cost per diaper then similar alternatives. If you have a budget that allows you the luxury of paying that premium, then these are a great option. But many people don't.

*The Bottom Line:*

Ultimately, I think these diapers are great for people who are looking to purchase responsibly and have a large enough income to accommodate the very high price. And since I don't have any other real complaints about these, I'll only deduct one star for the (lack of) value proposition. My final score will be four stars out of five. We likely won't order these over again though, as the kids in our lives will likely outgrow these before we use them all.

reviews.name: Amazon Jane
reviews.title: OK diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2024
reviews.review:
These diapers are not as absorbent as Huggies, but as absorbent as any other major brand. And they are better than the off brand/discount diapers that don’t absorb anything.

To me the most important thing about diapers is the absorbency, so these other following factors don’t mean much to me. I would not order the Dyper black diapers regularly because they are not as absorbent as Huggies, but they are almost as absorbent as Huggies. A low price in exchange for absorbency with diapers is just not worth the extra headache a bad diaper can cause.

These diapers are black, like a black paint painted on the outside, which gave me a lot of concern about the black ‘charcoal’ paint rubbing off on clothes, getting stuck into the baby’s fingers, etc. The black coating however did not rub off!

I think the charcoal thing is a gimmick. When I ordered these I thought they meant that charcoal was incorporated into the diaper lining. A charcoal component doesn’t have to be a dark black paint. I don’t think the charcoal paint is doing anything for helping odor.

The styling is cute I guess. It’s a little weird though because it looks like an adult man’s trendy boxer briefs you would buy for $72 off tik tok. Since they anre absorbent I don’t care how they look.

It is a very large box of Dypers. It is so heavy I am glad the mailman brought it upstairs for me. I wouldn’t order any kind of new brand of diaper in this quantity without first knowing I think the absorbency and material is Ok.

Overall this product is good, just not as good as Huggies. It’s better than other diapers I have gotten from amazon

reviews.name: Aaron B.
reviews.title: Once you go black…
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2024
reviews.review: I recently got these Charcoal Dypers for the little one as the previous brand we used leaked a lot. So far I have been please with these. There have been far less leaking than the other ones, but not completely perfect. Unfortunately it may just be our baby! First of all these diapers are quite noticeably different as they are black on the outside. The absorbency is very good and they easily last through the night. The diapers are very soft and seem to be the most comfortable diapers I’ve used for my babies. The elasticity is great and the diaper easily conforms to the baby without being too tight to cause rubbing. The diapers seem to hold smells quite well, I would say at least superior to other brands but maybe not exceptional. Finally regarding the value of these diapers, they seem to be a bit overpriced, definitely quite a bit more than other brands I’ve used, and I do not really think the features make up for the price. Do not get me wrong, I really like these Dypers but not sure if I will be getting them again. They may be right for you, so worth the try!

reviews.name: Jay
reviews.title: Comfortable for baby!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2024
reviews.review:
We like how soft the bamboo viscose is in these diapers. It's nice to know someone is working towards caring about the environment, too, given how may disposable diapers go through our house every day. We do like these! We haven't had any issues with blowouts, but we have had a couple leaks when the diaper gets really saturated. I think these are a little looser around the legs than the "other" brand we use. But, we've even had leaks with those, so...

As far as the charcoal goes, we're honestly not sure what it's for. It doesn't help with smell (our daughter can still clear the room) and it doesn't seem to soak up any more than a normal diaper? We have seen a little black transfer to the skin with wet diapers, but it washes off easily.

In a nutshell, we like them and what they represent, but we aren't sure about the charcoal aspect. If we get this brand again, we'll skip the charcoal.

reviews.name: Gigi Carabina
reviews.title: Better absorbancy that Pampers or Huggies. No wet sensing line
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.review:
So far we are happy with these diapers, they are way more absorbent that even the night time Pampers and seem to last longer between changes. They don't get saturated as fast and don't seem to hold moisture in as much as the competition.
On the downside they seem less smooth than the Pampers and there is no wet indicator (yellow line that turns blue when the diaper is wet). That's not a big issue but it makes it more difficult to gauge when they're too wet. I usually go by feel, once the gel inside is obviously close to being saturated they get replaced.
In terms of comfort they're lagging a bit behind Pampers and even huggies but baby got used to them after a few days. It seemed like they were slightly more restrictive at first (baby was moving less and kept tapping the leg area) because they don't have the stretchiness of their peers.
The #3 seems to be wider overall.
The look is different, we like it and so is the packaging. They are the most stylish "Dypers" we've seen.
Price-wise they are a good buy for the #3 at $99 for 200 diapers, pretty much in the same ballpark as the competition.

reviews.name: Izamar
reviews.title: Very nice diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2024
reviews.review:
I thought these diapers were going to be
Black in the inside but i was wrong. They are very soft, resistant and domt leak. I really liked these diapers but they are way over my diaper budget. I believe these are only for people who can have the luxury to buy them. Other than that these are great i would buy them again if they weren't so expensive.

reviews.name: Hallie
reviews.title: Charcoal Enhanced Diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2024
reviews.review: Firstly, I really appreciate and love the Dyper brand’s extra steps to be a better corporation, part of that being that the diapers are made without a a lot of the harmful chemicals and products used today in other leasing diaper brands. They are hypoallergenic, which is great for sensitive skin, and the outside is especially soft. I also appreciate how durable and reliable the tape for strapping it on is. Overall, I can tell that the diapers are of high quality, that they are reliable, and I appreciate what they’re made out of, and with the company that makes them stand for.

reviews.name: Happiness with Hailey
reviews.title: So soft and seems to be extremely high quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2024
reviews.review: There’s no wetness indicator on these (strips that’s change color) but you can easily tell when they need to be changed. The charcoal for the coloring (plus all the added benefits along with it) is really nice! These look so nice and I just can’t get over how incredibly soft they are! For the price it’s is a little more expensive but it’s also a higher quality and better for the kid and the environment overall. I’m a fan!

reviews.name: B. R.
reviews.title: Large capacity but very expensive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.review:
These are a bit wider than other common diaper brands and seemed to hold a lot more pee. Unfortunately, there is no indicator line to tell you when they are wet but if you're a new parent, you'll learn you can judge by feel alone anyway. The charcoal enhancement of the diapers did not prevent us from smelling poops.

These aren't blow out proof but generally performed about the same as other diapers. We didn't notice any diaper rash with these but also we haven't had too many issues with this anyhow.

Occasionally, we noticed a few pieces of black lint on our babies.

Overall, these are very nice diapers but quite expensive compared to other brands.

reviews.name: Lorlo
reviews.title: Fancy Pants
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.review: These DYPER Charcoal Enhanced Diapers are the 'tuxedo' of diaper fashion. Fancy duds for special occasions or when you want your baby to make a fashion statement, especially if odor absorption is needed. While these have all the bells and whistles of being eco-friendly, they seem to be a bit bulky IMO. They are super absorbent, almost to a fault because you never notice any foul odor or leakage. I took one star off because these are really high priced compared to what you get for the big box brands.

reviews.name: TAG REVIEWS
reviews.title: It's a good product but... so are most of the other premium diapers out there.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2024
reviews.review: These are good diapers like most of the other brand name diapers out there. I didn't have any problems but I also wasn't particularly impressed. If you really want plant based diapers, these work great! I just can't really suggest you buy them over the normal name brand diapers. They are a good product but I didn't find anything exceptional about them that would merit 5 stars.

reviews.name: Yodenie S
reviews.title: Plant based diapers free of chlorine and other harmful chemicals
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.review:
I ordered these Dyper Charcoal Enhanced diapers for my granddaughter. The best thing about this brand, is that the diapers are free of chlorine, latex, alcohol, perfumes, PVC, parabens, sulphates, and phthalates. I don’t understand why these toxic chemicals are even used in baby diapers, and so many other products we use. I’m glad to see a brand that cares about baby’s health, and our environment. They are responsibly sourced, and healthier for the planet.
These diapers are soft, and don’t irritate her skin. They’re also very absorbent, and keep moisture away from her skin. They don’t have a wetness indicator line, but I’ve been able to tell how wet they are by feel. It’s not a big deal, but would be more convenient to have an indicator. The velcro works well, and the soft velcro strip across the whole front of the diaper, makes them very adjustable to baby/toddler’s size. There’s an inner elastic layer, and elastic across the back to prevent leaks and blowouts.
When I opened the diapers along the perforated line, at the top of the bag, the top of the diaper was facing up. It’s so much easier to pull the diapers out by their bottoms, so I will open the second bag from the bottom.
Overall, these are high quality, well made diapers, that work just as well as the name brands, and they’re so much healthier for babies and toddlers. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: SurfinVeggie
reviews.title: Black!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.review: We used to have a Dyper subscription, so we were familiar with the brand before trying these charcoal ones. First of all- they're black! I don't know why this makes me happy, but I think it just looks so much nicer sticking out of the tops of baby pants. Especially for older kids who maybe "should" be in underwear, I think the black is an awesome option. Anyhow, functionally they perform well. The velcro is fantastic to provide a good fit. We haven't had any issues with leaks or blowouts, even with a few days of baby diarrhea. I don't know the point of the charcoal infusion, but they sure do look cool. Only problem is there is no size on them and no way to write a size on them.

reviews.name: kara
reviews.title: adorable plant based diapers, black looks fashionable.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.review: I just received the DYPER Charcoal Enhanced Diapers in both size 1 and 2 and I am impressed. First, they are true to size which is important and the black color looks super cute. I was so used to using white diapers that the black made it look more fashionable if that is possible from a diaper. They did not sag. They are also super soft and actually feel high end, almost feels like a material.I believe that is from the plant bamboo which is used for the exterior. I babysit and one of the kids get terrible irritation from some brands of diapers so I immediately thought of him when deciding to try this product. At this point, he is doing great with this brand, no marks. I did see a few back fuzzies that easily wiped off when cleaning with wipes. These are made with plant based ingredients and no perfumes. The charcoal is a natural odor absorber and the diapers absorbed and held well at the edges with no leaks. These are on the high side in price but they are a step above regular diapers in their natural properties and this multipack made it more cost effective for this quality. A solid product and I recommend and I am glad I have the next size for him to grow into.

reviews.name: Roasted coffee
reviews.title: Great quality.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2024
reviews.review: Great quality diapers, no rash or allergic reactions in my son sensitive skin, no leaking after using itr for more than 7 hours during night. I just wish there was more colors options, I didn't like the black color .

reviews.name: JustJelly
reviews.title: Soft and chic!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.review: These have a nice look and are soft, but my 4 year old was not impressed. She said she would never, ever wear them and would rather keep wearing the itchy ones with owls!! Once our old ones ran out, we used these, and she only wears diapers at night time because she is a very heavy sleeper. She's used them a few nights already, and no leaks!! She weighs 40-44# and these feel like that flaps don't have much stretch but they haven't popped off and she's kind of wild. Overall, these are quite expensive for a diaper, but they do seem to be high quality.

reviews.name: Nancy
reviews.title: Nice eco brand
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2024
reviews.review: These are a bit on the bulky side. However, no blowout or leakage issues. These are a good fit for babies with thicker thighs. I did not notice any difference in smell from the charcoal, which was a bit of a bummer. If you’re used to a wetness indicator stripe, these can be difficult to adjust to, as the color makes visual checks difficult. They don’t irritate my baby’s skin and I feel good about their sustainability.

reviews.name: AlpacaPenguin
reviews.title: Work well and are soft!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2024
reviews.review:
We like the Dyper brand but have never tried the Charcoal ones. Kinda of strange to see a black diaper but definitely different. They are soft and did not cause any irritation on my daughter. The fit is good and it seems to hold a good amount of liquid.
Because they are black, there's no moisture indicator so if you're hoping for that, there is none. Which honestly makes sense, as these are targeted for overnight use.
Overall, they're good and we will reorder!

reviews.name: Sofia
reviews.title: Great Absorbent Diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are of great quality. They fit the baby perfectly and work well to absorb odors. They are also good at absorbing fluids, but we don't use them overnight. The only downside is that, since they are black, there is no blue line indicator to tell if the diaper is wet.

reviews.name: Eric Beaty, Author
reviews.title: Soft but no wet line
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are absorbent and contain smells. Our son has eczema, but these diapers did not aggravate his skin. The only downside is that the black design does not have a wet line, so you have to peek to see if the baby went.

reviews.name: Lisa
reviews.title: Great quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are great quality. We haven’t experienced any leaks or irritation while using this on our child. Diaper stays in place and is harder for my child to try to take them off. This is definitely a better option compared to other diapers on the market. We plan to continue to use these.

reviews.name: Insomnomnomnia
reviews.title: Dyper Charcoal Enhanced Diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2024
reviews.review:
My little guy falls into the weight range for these size 3 diapers, but they definitely don't fit him as well as I'd hoped. He would probably do better in size 4. I would dare say these might run a bit small.

As for the diapers themselves - they are soft and absorbent. We couldn't use them overnight or he'd leak through them, but that might go back to the sizing issue. The black color of the diapers makes them unique compared to your traditional white ones. There's no stripe that shows you if the diaper is wet or dry, but I don't typically rely on that anyway.

They are quite a bit pricier than other diapers, but seeing as they are plant-based they are a good option if you are trying to be more environmentally conscious.

We probably won't use these as our go-to diaper brand, but they are definitely a back up for now. I think we would have better luck if they were the right size.

reviews.name: Kaitlyn C.
reviews.title: A good diaper option
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2024
reviews.review: We primarily use budget diapers, like Costco's Kirkland brand, so it was easy to see the quality difference in these. They are certainly well made and we haven't had any more issues with leakage/absorbency than we have with other diapers. I was super surprised by the weight of the box, as it was much heavier than the boxes for other diapers we buy, I think just because these have a little more material to them. They fit like we expected and didn't cause any irritation. The price per diaper is a little more than we typically like to pay, so I see these as a great option if the diaper will be showing for any reason, since they are absolutely more stylish, or potentially for overnight since they do seem to be a bit more absorbent.

reviews.name: M
reviews.title: Good quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2024
reviews.review: These are some very fancy diapers. Good absorbency no leaks so far. The diapers are soft and have not caused ands rash or irritation and they even have a pleasant sent before use. My biggest complaint is value. I can get 3 times this amount of a national brand that is similar in quality. DYPER offers a diaper recycling service as well.

reviews.name: Mena
reviews.title: Good
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2024
reviews.review:
I like these diapers they seem to absorb pretty well even at night.
My baby did get a little rash after using them for few days, I’m not sure it was from the diapers I will continue to use them and will update.

reviews.name: Happy Mom
reviews.title: Hypoallergenic
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2024
reviews.review: I really like that these diapers are hypoallergenic. They haven't caused my little one any rashes and they are soft on his skin. I also like that these have both charcoal and bamboo in them. These absorb realatively well and we seldom have any problems with blowouts even if we use them overnight. All in all, I am pretty happy with these.

reviews.name: Cam
reviews.title: Love the color
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.review: Love that these diapers are black. It’s a whole different vibe than traditional diapers. This a large box of diapers. They stretch well. The logo is a little obnoxious but they do hold up and don’t leak.

reviews.name: J. A. Welsh
reviews.title: Really fancy!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.review: I got these as a gift for my niece who’s expecting in a few months. These diapers are so posh! Really, they’re black and trim and lightweight. They offer a fair amount of absorbency which is comparable to other brands. The only downfall here is the price point for me. I don’t mind it as a gift but it’s simply not sustainable for most new families. But what a fun treat to give to a new baby!

reviews.name: CH
reviews.title: Eco-friendly diapers that are good at filtering and suppressing bad odors too
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.review: DYPER charcoal enhanced diapers are made with natural disposable and plant based materials. Finally I'm seeing more eco-friendly diapers on the market. Those unique materials also feel very soft and comfortable, and they are good at filtering and suppressing bad odors too.

reviews.name: Muriel
reviews.title: Not very absorbent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are black in color. For me, this color is quite rare. It's soft and it doesn't harm your baby's bottom. It is very stretchy and these diapers fit my baby well. It also removes very well. But one thing that disappoints me about it is that it is not very absorbent and can leak a bit. I hope it will improve in the future.

reviews.name: Dan Yolodart
reviews.title: Fancy, plant based, soft, name brand diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.review: You are paying for the plant based, softness, name brand, high quality diapers. I personally am not the person who invests good money into fancy diapers, but if you are the person looking for those, these are great. I think the charcoal does help hide the smell of a diaper a little bit. But these are fancy, and nice.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Charcoal diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2024
reviews.review: Diapers a nice, do a pretty good job stopping leaks. Don’t like that there is no wetness indicator. There are definitely much more expensive than regular diapers, not really sure if the “charcoal” difference is worth the price.

reviews.name: tara rivera
reviews.title: Good quality,absorbent diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.review: The size is right with other brands I’ve tried , these are very absorbent, very soft , no dyes haven’t had any leaks, and no iratation - price was good for amount of diapers

reviews.name: KG
reviews.title: Absorbent charcoal enhanced diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2024
reviews.review:
There's certainly a coolness factor to these that you don't typically get when it comes to diapers! Due to the black color, you don't get the wetness indicator line like many brands now have, but I don't find those to be a necessity. These are absorbent with liquids, but unfortunately our daughter had a blowout on the very first diaper. She is just getting big enough to wear a size 2, so it could be partially due to to that. Also, I've not found a brande yet that completely prevents blowouts those first few months!
I especially like that these are produced by a certified B corps company. Of course, that also comes with a higher price tag, but if these are in your budget, they're definitely worth a try, especially if you want to have the coolest kid in the nursery ;)

reviews.name: Miztikchik
reviews.title: Wow these are great!!!!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.review: I like to keep diapers on hand when my grandson is over and I thought we would try these. He’s been using pampers but still occasionally has leaks overnight with them and when he was over we tried these. These are very absorbent and he had no leaks. I really like they are plant based and are healthier to use but best part work better!! I guess the charcoal may help with smell but they look really nice in black either way. I will definitely buy these again

reviews.name: Aileen&Henry
reviews.title: Good diapers for sensitive baby skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers not only look sleek, but they're both environmentally friendly and gentle on baby's skin. These diapers run slightly small compared to the branded diapers that we use. We also still prefer to use our branded diapers overnight as they're able to hold up for longer, but these diapers work out for shorter duration uses. Another downside to these diapers is that they don't have a wetness indicator line, so you'll have to get a feel for when they need to be changed on your own. If you're looking for a diaper that's gentle on your baby's skin without all the extra chemicals, then this diaper may be for you although they are pricier than your average diaper.

reviews.name: JL
reviews.title: Absorbent diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.review: The all black color of this Dyper Charcoal diaper line makes it look like my child is wearing grown up underwear! There is not wetness indicator and no size indicated on the diaper. With light color pants, you can see the shade of black sometimes. It's quite absorbent and has been working well overnight for us. It doesn't sag and keeps its shape. Nice that it is made of plant based materials!

reviews.name: bugeater
reviews.title: Good quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.review: Use these at our house when the grandkid is here. Like them a lot and his parents like them also. The quality is good. Will remove one star from my experience for the cost per unit. It is high.

reviews.name: Michaela M
reviews.title: Super absorbent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.review: We cloth diaper during the day but my almost 2 year old is a heavy wetter and was having issues with his overnight cloth so we switched to these. They're great! Trim, yet super absorbent. Not sure what the "charcoal" does other than make them look different and stand out against competitors, but these fit my child well and work for our family

reviews.name: Liz B

reviews.name: M.S.H.
reviews.title: Nicey, but pricy ...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.review: These really do work well to help dissipate odors when my mom is babysitting from our house and they have thus far been a blessing for my sensitive stomach already. I do wish they were a bit more affordable, but we can also take a bit more liberty paying for them as we do not have babies in the home all the time, just occasionally. The look of these is also really sleek and dare I say rather fashionable as far as diapers go. Perfect for little baby goths as well if that is your style these are definitely for your little one. They hold up well and are easy to put on as well as stay on securely. They would look amazing for doing some really cool black and white photo shoots with a newish born as so many photos of that type have the baby in a standard white diaper. These are definitely the fanciest diapers I have seen in my life.

reviews.name: Rocman
reviews.title: Works well and unique looks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers seem to work just as well as the others we got. I added cost probably comes from the material used. The unique black look is pretty cool. If you want to have something different, this could be worth a look.

reviews.name: Amanda Scarberry
reviews.title: diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.review: These are a lot of diapers! They are new for me with the charcoal, but seem to be decent. They are black and that's interesting.

reviews.name: John Dekker
reviews.title: Work well
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are true to size and work well: they hold everything in, and the tabs stick properly. The black color is unusual but my son likes it. We don't have a problem with "normal" diapers but for some people these may be worth the extra expense.

reviews.name: AmazonReviewer
reviews.title: Soft, absorbent, and eco-friendly diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.review: They are made from bamboo and charcoal, which are natural and gentle on the skin. They are also very absorbent and prevent leaks, even overnight. They fit well and have a stylish black color. The best part is that they are compostable and do not harm the environment. I would recommend these diapers to anyone looking for a quality and sustainable option. But they are a bit pricey for the counts!

reviews.name: Amanda
reviews.title: Smaller than pampers

reviews.review: I like the design of this diaper. The black color looks really cool on my boy. It looks like he is wearing a black underwear. The quality seems good too, soft and soak well. However, got size 2, it is smaller than pampers that we were using. So my baby boy could not use it long. Probably need size 3 soon. The big box came with 4 small boxes inside and each small box has 2 bags. That is a lot of diapers.

reviews.name: Amzn addict
reviews.title: Holding up
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.review: These held up well throughout the night. My daughter tends to pee a lot and these lasted without needing to be changed. They don't stretch as much as I'm used to but they're a decent diaper.

reviews.name: Trelakopela
reviews.title: Borderline 5 stars. Need some future tweaks

I feel they are comparable to leading brand as far as holding up- need to be changed before the diaper feels wet within about 2-3hrs depending on your child. These fit pretty well in 14 month old. Arrived sealed.

reviews.name: Monty

reviews.name: Sunny Bee

Overall, very nice diapers that are chemical free.

reviews.name: Nicole

reviews.name: Amanda Scarberry

reviews.name: lisa

reviews.name: Jax Beltran

I only used about 10 diapers and 3 of the 10 I had instant leakage and blowouts through the back. My heart breaks because I REALLY wanted these to be my new diaper. Otherwise they’re super adorable!

reviews.name: Syndra
reviews.title: Diaper rash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2025
reviews.review: This black diaper always gives my baby diaper rash, the white one is better.

reviews.name: S Schultz
reviews.title: Nice different color diaper
