reviews.review: So I heard a lot of the dyper brand and we decided to try it. Needless to say it didn't really excel my expectations as a luxury diaper. Little guy had more leak through than anticipated. The fact it doesn't have a pee strip to tell you is an inconvenience but not a major one as we can tell when he's peed. We get compliments from it being a "cool" black diaper and matches with his outfits but we decided to stick with millie moons instead.

reviews.name: Kristen Brooke
reviews.title: I really wanted to like these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2024
reviews.review: I really wanted to like these. They are rough, my baby was OK with them, but we ended up switching to the Millie overnight diapers. I say, give them a try and see how you feel about them yourself, but I don't think we'll be ordering these again. The black diaper was cool though! just a bit pricey And the overall absorption was comparable to most diapers.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: For the price point, these miss the mark
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2024
reviews.review: I don't feel these are worth the price point. There was nothing special/standout about them. Size 2 were 0.45 per diaper, compared to Coterie which is 0.41 per diaper. I will stick with Coterie for overnight - they are much softer and more absorbent in my opinion.

reviews.name: Jason Ricca
reviews.title: Love DYPER, but these diapers not as much
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2024
reviews.review: As always your results may vary.. these charcoal enhanced dypes from Dyper don't breathe like the originals/non-charcoal version and subsequently the baby has a diaper rash. This isn't scientific, and not controlled at all, but seemed correlated - if not strictly causative.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: I wanted to love these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers do prevent blow outs and fit nicely but they do not have a wet indicator. I feel like for the money they should have that.

reviews.name: Rocklyn
reviews.title: No indicator if it full/wet
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2024
reviews.review: I purchase one because my baby is really sensitive. But Unlike an ordinary diaper, I cannot tell if the diaper is wet/full. Which is really important to me. I would expect indicator wetness for this price. Other than that the diaper was soft and ok.

reviews.name: spote shopper
reviews.title: Prefer original Dyper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2024
reviews.review: Ok diaper but no color changing pee line. Going back to original Dyper. Those are great.

reviews.name: EverydayConsumer
reviews.title: Skin reacted
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2024
reviews.review: The sizing was a tad smaller than Parmpers and Costco brands. Unfortunately it triggered some diaper rash so we were mindful to limite the use and time of wearing the Dyper brand. My kid’s school uses the regular material (white ones) and has no skin issues. No leaks for overnight.

reviews.name: Martha
reviews.title: No wetness indicator in 2024?!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2024
reviews.review:
Who makes a diaper in 2024 without a wetness indicator line?! Very disappointed, that’s a deal breaker. Would not have purchased had a realized that. Otherwise these are similar to other Dyper diapers (which we like).

I also find that these fit a bit smaller than the classic white Dyper diapers. At least the size 1 fits smaller.

reviews.name: My 2 Cents
reviews.title: Too masking?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2024
reviews.review: The charcoal diaper was great for absorbing (masking) smells, but for non-verbal littles, that made it more challenging to know when a change was needed (without checking on a regular schedule). Our little one did develop a small diaper rash while wearing these but I am not sure if it was from the diaper per se, or from the less frequent changes due to less obvious smells and more being more absorbant. These are a pricier option for sure, but we didn't have any leaks and they fit well.

reviews.name: Teresa M
reviews.title: Holds well but our baby had to adjust and seemed to irritate skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2024
reviews.review:
I recently tried a set of charcoal diapers for my baby, and my experience has been mixed, leading to a three-star rating.

On the positive side, these diapers are highly absorbent and do a great job of containing leaks. The charcoal lining helps to neutralize odors effectively, which is a significant advantage, especially during longer periods between changes. The fit is generally good, with adjustable snaps that accommodate my baby's growth and provide a snug, comfortable fit. Additionally, the eco-friendly aspect of using reusable charcoal diapers aligns well with our family's sustainability goals.

However, despite these benefits, we encountered an issue with skin irritation. After a few uses, I noticed that my baby's skin became red and irritated in the diaper area. This was concerning, as we have not had this problem with other diaper brands. It seems that the charcoal material, while effective in many ways, may be too harsh for my baby's sensitive skin. We tried different laundering methods and ensured thorough rinsing, but the irritation persisted.

Because of the skin irritation, we've had to limit the use of these diapers, which is disappointing given their other positive attributes. For parents considering charcoal diapers, I would recommend monitoring for any signs of skin sensitivity and being prepared to switch to an alternative if irritation occurs.

Overall, while the charcoal diapers perform well in terms of absorption and odor control, the potential for skin irritation is a significant drawback. For babies with sensitive skin, these may not be the best option.

reviews.name: Kimberly Caudle
reviews.title: Not Impressed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2024
reviews.review: I thought that I would give these diapers a chance to see how they fair against my regular brand. Let me just say that I am not impressed. They do fit well, in all aspects. They allow freedom of movement for your child. But, that is the only positive thing they have going for them. They are not very absorbent and there is zero chance that you could put your child to bed without them waking up because their diaper leaked. I do not recommend these diapers.

reviews.name: Kevin
reviews.title: Goth Dypers for the Rebel Baby, but might give them a rash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.review:
UPDATE: Initially I started using the Dyper brand diapers off and on while still using my normal brand. When I was sporadically using the Dyper brand, I submitted the positive review below. However, I've had to update my findings. After using the Dyper brand diapers exclusively for 2-3 days, my little one developed a bad diaper rash. It appeared to be a urine scald. I switched back to my previous brand and waited for the rash to clear. Once it was healed, I tried the Dyper brand diapers again. Within about 2 days of returning to using the Dyper brand exclusively, a rash had started again. I really don't believe I will want to purchase these again after my personal experience.

These black, Goth diapers appeal to the family who wants to show off their rebel baby. Add a fake tattoo on your baby's arm and baby will be styling! These diapers performed comparably to the big name brands for absorbency. They managed to hold in a major blow out while my little one was in the baby bouncer. Usually an incident in the bouncer involves substances shooting out the back like a rocket! However, the gusset contained the fountain! I have used them overnight and had success for nearly 13 hours with minimal leakage. Nothing can absorb the overnight flood perfectly for that many hours! They are a bit wider and thicker than other brands. Overall, I'm pleased with their quality!

reviews.name: MS
reviews.title: Not very strong adhesive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2024
reviews.review: I was really excited to try these charcoal infused diapers as I have tried the regular diapers from this brand. To my surprise, the adhesive on the diapers (only used a few so far) wasn’t strong enough and very strong and would come off easily. Due to that, we have had a few issues of leakage. I’m hoping that the remaining ones don’t have the similar issue. Other than that, the diapers themselves feel soft, comfortable, and absorbent.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: I wanted to love these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers do prevent blow outs and fit nicely but they do not have a wet indicator. I feel like for the money they should have that.

reviews.name: Rocklyn
reviews.title: No indicator if it full/wet
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2024

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Not a good fit, no stretch
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2024
reviews.review: I have used Dyper for both my babies the last 3 years, my go to diaper for sure, absolutely love them! However, this was my first time purchasing and using the charcoal enhanced, and I’m not happy with them. Besides the black aesthetic look which I do love, that’s about all I like about this diaper. The downfall is the straps, there is absolutely no give, no stretch, even when I make it as loose as possible.. (same issue I had with the Millie Moon brand diapers) the straps cause the diaper to dig into my baby’s belly and legs causing discomfort and red lines on her thighs. Which leads to another downfall, the looser the diaper, the more risk of leaks and blowouts. She fits the original white Dypers size 1 perfectly, so I ordered that in charcoal and they’re so much smaller on her. Now I’m stuck with a box of diapers that don’t fit and I can’t return as I’ve already used a few.. very disappointed and won’t be purchasing the charcoal enhanced again. Definitely stick to the original dypers with the stretchy straps, they allow for a custom fit and won’t dig into your little’s belly like the charcoal ones do.

reviews.name: T-Bird
reviews.title: Awesome!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2024
reviews.review: I purchased these pampers for my grandson. And they’re an amazing product. Keeps him free from rashes and they don’t leak like most pampers.

reviews.name: rcjohnson
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.review: I can’t give these diapers more than one star. They are by far the TOUGHEST diaper I think I’ve ever felt. So scratchy and hard. Almost like a soft cardboard. Yes, they do their job and of course the “black” is super cool. However I will not be purchasing again. My son is 18 months and try’s to rip these off WITH his clothes on. Because they are UNCOMFORTABLE. He never tried this with any diaper. This isn’t my first rodeo I have three kids. Save your money. We are definitely going back to Millie Moons.

reviews.name: Brittany Fraser

reviews.name: Ryan
reviews.title: Terrible product! No pee-line!!!

Almost worse than normal store brand diapers.

products.product_name: DYPER Baby Wipes | 99% Water | 100% Plant-Based | Hypoallergenic for Sensitive Skin | Fragrance Free | Plastic-Free | 12 Pack, 720 Wipes

reviews.name: channegan
reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2025
reviews.review: I have tried an insane amount of baby wipes, and these are definitely the winner! The have a great amount of moisture even at the start of the pack, the texture is great for being gentle while effectively cleaning up messes, and most importantly they’re non-toxic. I initially bought these wipes because they are EWG verified, meaning they meet the EWG's strictest standards for transparency and health. They cannot contain any ingredients on EWG's “Unacceptable” list, which includes ingredients with health, ecotoxicity and/or contamination concerns. I’ve really been trying to swap out toxic products for healthier ones since having a baby and this was a great start for me. Not only do I feel these are healthy for my baby, but they are also gentle on his super sensitive skin!

reviews.name: Lei-lei
reviews.title: Love these wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2025
reviews.review:
We love these wipes. The texture is great for getting things clean. It's also great that it's made of bamboo, and fully biodegradable. We used to use the Seventh Generation wipes, but dislike that they are partially plastic. That doesn't seem to match with their company philosophy.

There are some complaints that the sheets aren't folded together so they pull each other out. It is true that they aren't folded together, and yet we haven't had any issues. Sometimes, the first couple sheets can be a little difficult to get out, because the package is tight. But after that, we find that each sheet does pull the next one out quite reliably, just from the friction of their contact.

reviews.name: kawaii
reviews.title: Better than wet wipes!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2025
reviews.review: Favorite textured wipes. Thick and very moist. Perfect actually. Better than wet wipes

reviews.name: Lo Hatfield
reviews.title: Great wipes and convenient travel size
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2025
reviews.review: We like these wipes because they have little raised dots that help pick up more when cleaning. The travel pack is also super so you don’t have to bring a big batch of wipes or a refillable hard container that takes up a lot of space.

reviews.name: Paul and Brittney Miller
reviews.title: Favorite wipes! Quilted and stretchy!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2025
reviews.review: I tried all of the "clean" diapers and wipes, although I didn't care for their diapers, their wipes are my go to and favorite! I have them on repeat delivery from Amazon.

reviews.name: Jessica P.
reviews.title: Perfect for diaper bag
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2025
reviews.review: These are perfect for my fanny pack! Not heavy. Take up less room & left for the day of diaper changes

reviews.name: JC
reviews.title: Great wipes! Not sure why others have complained
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2024

We love that they can be composted with Dyper’s other products!

Trust me, just buy these over any other brand! :)

reviews.review: Love LOVE LOVE This Product!!!!! Have used this since my baby was born ( he is almost 2 now) !! Amazing and gentle on the skin! Highly recommend!

reviews.name: Brandy

reviews.review: I keep these in my bag for on the go diaper changes. They are much easier to keep around than the huge containers of wipes.

reviews.name: Robin Smith

reviews.name: Daniele

reviews.review: These wipes are very durable. They have never ripped and the little bumps help so much with cleaning.

reviews.name: Rodrigo Landauro
reviews.title: Non toxic is the way to go. Fall Cabal.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2023
reviews.review: I like that people are waking up to the truth and taking actions to protect their children. Thank you for selling this product.

reviews.name: M. H.
reviews.title: Water wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2024
reviews.review: These baby wipes have worked really well for my baby. I fell that the size of these wipes are just a little bigger than others - I haven't measured them, but they seem a little bigger so I don't have to use as many for a dirty diaper. There is no added fragrance, but they do have a slight odor from the natural ingredients. I like that they are water wipes, plant based and hypoallergenic; I am always concerned about sensitivity issues with my baby's skin. My only issue with these wipes is that sometimes they don't come out of the package easily one at a time, especially just using one hand.

reviews.name: Alyssa
reviews.title: No Irritation
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2024
reviews.review: A must have! Seems gentle and haven't had any irritation issues using this wipe. Nice bulk pack and wipes are fairly sturdy and just wet enough. Not much scent on them. Ingredients look good.

reviews.name: CK
reviews.title: Nice wipes, fragrance free!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2024
reviews.review: These wipes have been wonderful, no irritation and no fragrance for sensitive skin! I do wish the opening on the individual packages was a bit easier to close without sticking to other parts but it really isn't that big of a deal, you kind of have to shove the next wipe back in and stick it closed. This comes with 4 packages, each with 60 wipes. The wipes are average sized, similar to Huggies size. They don't really have a texture to them.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.title: Love these wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2024
reviews.review: I have used a variety of wipes before, but these water wipes have been superior than others for my son's sensitive skin. These wipes are great in that they're adequately moist and have a big enough surface area to minimize the number of wipes that you need. I also like that one side has a raised texture which helps cleaning #2s much easier. The only downside is that it's not completely scent free-- the scent resembles a charcoal smell.

reviews.name: ChitownFoodie
reviews.title: Soft
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2024
reviews.review: I am not a baby , but I appreciate the pamper treatment from these wonderful wipes. Easy to wipe after each bathroom use. Feeling refresh every time afterward. Normal sizes and thick enough that it doesn’t rip apart.

reviews.name: Ash S.
reviews.title: Terrific wipes!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2024
reviews.review: These hypoallergenic baby wipes are amazing. I like using them for other purposes besides just bathroom usage. Arms, legs, etc after coming back in from outside, the usual. They're soft, no strong smells, easy to use and leave me feeling cleaner and refreshed. I hadn't used wipes in general in adulthood until recently, but won't be going back to standard means now. These are my new standard. I love them and would absolutely recommend them to others.

reviews.name: SSC
reviews.title: Travel Essential
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2024
reviews.review: I’ve become a fan of Dyper wipes. I like to travel with a pack in my EDC because, on long road trips, I eat in my car a lot. I appreciate how strong and soft these are - one wipe gets a lot of cleaning done. Also, because I’m not using these daily, I’d like to point out how long the reusable peel-top dispenser holds up over time, despite the nature of the product being a wipe. Many wipes I’ve used in the past can’t stay moist because the seal of the reclosable sticker no longer sticks. This makes it even more of a reason why I like this brand for my purpose.

reviews.name: Jay
reviews.title: Great Wipes for Sensitive Skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2024
reviews.review:
If you’re looking for baby wipes that are gentle and effective, DYPER Baby Wipes are worth checking out. They’re 99% water and made from plant-based materials. I found the wipes to be very soft and absorbent, and they don’t have any harsh chemicals or scents.

They come in a convenient, reusable pack that’s easy for on-the-go use. They’re not overly thick, but they do the job well and are sturdy enough for daily cleaning tasks. Plus, they’re compostable, which is great.

Overall, these wipes offer good quality and peace of mind knowing they’re made with safe ingredients. Definitely a solid choice if you’re looking for something gentle and eco-friendly.

reviews.name: Jessie
reviews.title: These Will Work
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024
reviews.review:
OK, I admit it: We have no babies. Not any longer. However, at least one household member (guess which one) still likes baby wipes for their general utility value. Especially when water isn't available. Like in the car. Having 240 of them should keep them busy for a while.

These arrived in four packages of 60 each. Some may get repackaged in smaller quantities using zip-lock bags. But, the 60-packs work just fine as they are.

The material looks similar to most disposable towel-like material. It is strong and is very difficult to tear and seems to be as thick (or thicker) than a quality paper towel.

The wipes are 9" by 7" while the packages are 7.5" by 4" by 2.25" thick and are resealable.

The wipes are nice and moist and have a very slight soap-like odor which I did not find objectionable.

reviews.name: Mari
reviews.title: 99% water base gentle enough for any type of skin.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2024
reviews.review: I really like these wipes! These wipes are 99% water based non toxic that are gentle and soft enough for our delicate baby skin and safe to use on their face and hands as well. It's fragrance free, thick and strong so no need to worry about it ripping easily. These will be my go to item to purchase for my future new mom friends.

reviews.name: Nova
reviews.title: Soft wipes, nice resealable container
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2024
reviews.review:
These wipes are very nice. They're soft and textured on the skin. The container they come in has a resealable top that is super sticky. They're very moist and wet. I noticed a slight scent, but it was more like wet towels. They don't smell bad, just wet.

DYPER Baby Wipes | 99% Water Based Wipes | 100% Plant-Based | Hypoallergenic for Sensitive Skin | Honest Ingredients | Fragrance Free | Plastic-Free | Pack of 4 (240 Count)

reviews.name: Amzn addict
reviews.title: Decent wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2024
reviews.review: These work well on babies and toddlers. The quality is decent and they are free if smells. That seem comfortable on the skin and the packages are easy to toss in your bag and go.

reviews.name: Reviewer
reviews.title: Nice and moist wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024
reviews.review: I wasn't expecting these wipes to be this moist. It more wet than other name brand ones that I have used. They felt well moistened which is good at cleaning up after a nasty diaper change. There is a slight scent to it but it is very subtle and nothing fragrant.

reviews.name: PandaComradeSr
reviews.title: Baby wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2024
reviews.review: The baby wipes by Dyper came as a 4 pack with 60 wipes per pack. They come in a resealable pack, are unscented and work well for cleanups. Overall quite happy with these wipes!

reviews.name: Pockmarked Pariah
reviews.title: Baby wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2024
reviews.review: This is a nice product. I like that they are suitable for sensitive skin and don't have any added fragrance to potentially irritate the little ones (or adults). The wipes have a good level of moisture so I didn't have any issues with drying oit prematurely and they are durable and don't break apart with normal usage

reviews.name: Audra Darlene Ritchie
reviews.title: DYPER Baby Wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024
reviews.review: This Dyper baby wipes works great by cleaning and has a pleasant mild fragrance. They are moist and soft to the skin. I highly recommend!

reviews.name: Dee
reviews.title: LOVE this!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024
reviews.review: I love these wipes! I like that it's plant based and doesn't irritate my son's bottom. Decent price.

reviews.name: 2¢

reviews.review: Cleanses gently and effectively. Perfect!! 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

reviews.name: winampplayer
reviews.title: Good wipes, good durability
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2023
reviews.review: My son has sensitive skin and this worked very well with his skin. The wipes cleaned his bottom well just like other 99% water wipe brands. The wipes are durable and don't rip (unless you deliberately yank on it real hard). They smelled like a clean scent, but also a little bit like an alcohol wipe. You can only smell if you put your nose right up to it so it's not a big deal.

reviews.name: Cait
reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023
reviews.review: These wipes are a vast improvement on the other wipes I was using. They're bigger and wetter than our usual go to. They aren't as soft, but they're crazy strong so they don't leave any shreddy bits behind and are very effective at cleaning poo. Now I'm using less wipes overall!

reviews.name: Mesully01
reviews.title: Compact size and powerful wipe
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2023
reviews.review: I love how wet these wipes are and yet they don’t drip. For some reason these seem to clean more efficiently than my normal Huggies wipes either from the increased moisture or the bumpy texture. These are nice sized wipe and you don’t have to use much. I like throwing these packets in the cars diaper bag and different rooms of the house for quick changes.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.title: Lots of baby wipes!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023
reviews.review:
This is a huge box of baby wipes! There are 12 60-packs which will last a very long time. They are unscented which I like since I also use them for my puppy who dislikes scented wipes.

The wipes are standard size and very moist. The bags reseal with a little sticky flap.

reviews.name: Skip D.
reviews.title: Great value
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.review: Very thick cloth has opening on top to open and close

reviews.name: Lee
reviews.title: Work great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.review: These wipes work great. Moist and good for sensitive skin. Seals well.

reviews.name: Kailynn
reviews.title: Great wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.review: These wipes are great for sensitive skin! I love how thick they are and how efficient they are. The ingredients are great and safe. They are very soft as well.

reviews.name: Jess
reviews.title: Love these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.review: I love that these don’t use a ton of chemicals. They are sturdy too! Perfect for the diaper bag.

reviews.name: Summer
reviews.title: Great, Gentle Wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023
reviews.review:
Reviewing Dyper Baby Wipes. Let me start by being honest: I don’t have a baby. But I do have sensitive skin and various things that I like to wipe off without harsh cleansers, such as a cpap mask and a facial interface for a VR system, both used daily. I need wipes that I can use that won’t damage my cpap mask or my VR facial interface, as well as use to wipe down my face after working out or sweating, or at the end of the day, if I’m too tired to wash my face before bed.

When I saw these, I liked that they were made of 99% water with the 1% being natural plant material. Of course, plants can be harsh also but after using them on my face, I’ve had no reaction or issues. My face feels clean and has no residue. I do see dirt on the wipe, so it’s definitely cleaning well. The smell is very faint and pleasant.

I also like that you get so many, so I can go longer without having to buy more. There’s 60 per packet and 12 packets total. They work very well for me. Highly recommend.

reviews.name: MF
reviews.title: This was a score
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.review: This is a great purchase. We use wipes for everything.

reviews.name: S. H.
reviews.title: Great wipes that seem gentler for baby's skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.review:
These baby wipes do the trick! Our baby doesn’t have especially sensitive skin, but she does get diaper rashes if she isn’t cleaned thoroughly at changing time. We haven’t seen anything major since we started using these. The plastic-free construction is more eco-friendly, which is a priority for us, and the slightly textured surface did seem to do a more thorough job of cleaning.

The wipe packaging threads very well. We’ve used several other brands and have had issues with multiple wipes clumping and pulling out together; while it has happened once or twice with every pack, the overall number of issues is less than with most other wipes.

reviews.name: L
reviews.title: Work Fine
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.review: These are good for travel. You can throw a pack in the diaper bag, one in your purse, one in the car, etc. They worked fine, good texture and size. Easy to get out of the pack.

reviews.name: Intrigued and Intriguing
reviews.title: Small packages
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2023
reviews.review: This is a set of 6 packs of 10 wipes each. I like this because they will always be fresh this way. They work great as expected.

reviews.name: José
reviews.title: Wipes that don't cause a rash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2023
reviews.review:
What I liked:
Well packaged and the wipes have no chemical smell to them. These did not cause any type of rash on babies bottom, as others we had tested. One box should last us about a month or more, so the price point is good for what you get. The baby wipes also didn't tear up when being used, as others we had tested.

What I didn't like:
It states they are plant based, but no way of knowing what if any of that is true.

Overall we are pleased with these wipes. They did not cause any rash, feel good to the hand and don't come apart when being used. You get a good amount in a box that should last weeks to over a month or more. Overall I would recommend these to others!

reviews.name: Kaleidoscope
reviews.title: Great portable wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.review:
The wipes are nice and thick. They are larger than other brands so you don't need a many to do the job. I'm not a huge fan of the smell- they kind of smell like alcohol to me. I wouldn't call them unscented, just no added scent.

The packages are small and the wipes come out of the package with ease. This makes them a great choice for travel, but there's only 10 in each pack so you have to make sure you have enough each time you leave the house.

reviews.name: Fifties Era
reviews.title: Nice big size
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023
reviews.review: These wipes are bigger than the typical baby wipe and for most needs one wii get the job done. I like that they are smaller packages which are perfect for on the go.

reviews.name: TintheC
reviews.title: Soft, environmentally friendly wipes that smell great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.review:
The first thing I noticed on opening a pack of these wipes is that they have an almost soft, natural scent. They do not smell slightly of cleaning chemicals, which regular baby wipes do.

They're moist and clean feeling without dripping or being overly soaked. And they are nice and soft! They didn't fall apart at all when using them and I find them helpful for lots of things around the house too. Need to wipe of your hands real quick? Grab a wipe! Dusty car dashboard? Quick wipe down with the DYPER Baby Wipes and it's shiny and new looking. They also work fantastic as actually baby wipes too.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.title: Compact and ready for travel
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.review: I specifically ordered these wipes since each pack comes with 10 wet wipes allowing me to tailor how much to pack based on my specific needs. The wipes are incredibly compact, taking up minimal space in my bags. I don't use it as baby wipes but more so for my personal use especially when I'm out and cannot find a restroom to wash my hands. The wipes are larger than standard wipes allowing me to get a decent amount of use out of each one before having to discard it. While the wipes do have a slight smell upon opening the package, the smell does not bother me and does dissipate after use. The wipes have genuinely helped me stay clean while on the go.

reviews.name: Random Amazon Person
reviews.title: Baby wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.review: I picked these up not really as diaper wipes but more for the kids to clean their hands. Nice smaller packages that are easy to throw in a bag or keep in the car. They work well and are nice and soft. I didn't really smell any scent from them, which is actually good.

reviews.name: David865
reviews.title: These are scent free for a baby's tender skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.review: After trying these wipes out for a few days I can say that I'm impressed with their performance as a baby wipe. Fragrance free and hypoallergenic, you can't go wrong. Priced right too. You get lots of moist wipes in this case of 12 packages which can be used for so many other household purposes than just the baby. As they are fragrance free they are perfect for refreshing your face in the morning or after exercise. They work well wiping up spills and cleaning up a work or hobby space. We carry a package with us in the car. Very good product, reasonably priced and I would recommend.

reviews.name: babyanimal
reviews.title: good wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
reviews.review: These wipes works great. They are small but thick and wet. They feel gentle to the skin. They clean very well because one of side of the wipe has embossed texture. The set comes with 6 small resealable packs, there are 10 wipes in each pack, which makes them a good size for a short trip.

reviews.name: Rankin
reviews.title: They work
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2023
reviews.review: These wipes are a good size, they have almost a slight soapy feel to them, no real scent, but they stretch. The stretching can be irritating if they don’t pull out of the package easily but otherwise I don’t find it to be much of an issue. They clean well and haven’t irritated my baby’s skin.

reviews.name: Honest reviews only
reviews.title: Good quality and environmentally friendly wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023
reviews.review: 100% plant based with no chemicals. Good for the bottom of your child. There are so many in the box. I love it. Perfect for someone who has a newborn. There's no added smell to it. If you want something perfumed, this is not it. It doesn't smell good at all. It doesn't smell bad either. But the doodoo you're going to be cleaning is going to overpower any kind of smell any way. It's better to keep the baby's skin healthy and away from chemicals, than to have a little bit of smell.

reviews.name: My Honest Review
reviews.title: big baby wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
reviews.review: these are a great on the go item for a diaper bag, in the car or maybe a suitcase for those unexpected moments when you need a good wipe. i like how the packs are resealable so that you arent forced to use the entire pack at once. they are a good size for big and small wiping needs, including the bottom of my little diaper wearing poop machine. i would recommend!

reviews.name: Bettyhop
reviews.title: These wipes are great!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.review: I love that these wipes are water wipes and plant base. It makes me feel better about using them for my grandchildren's sensitive skin. I think this is a great price at the current price of $49.99 for the 12 packs. I will say I do like wipe packs with a more secure lid but I think the lid these have is more environmentally friendly. The wipes are strong enough to clean up a tough baby mess without breaking.

reviews.name: Kathryn
reviews.title: Love these!

reviews.review: As a parent, I'm always conscious of what's best for my baby. These water wipes are a lifesaver – 99% water and 100% plant-based. Hypoallergenic and fragrance-free, they're perfect for my little one's sensitive skin. Plus, the plastic-free packaging aligns with our eco-friendly lifestyle.

Very pleased with these wipes.

reviews.review: These wipes work well. I like how they're in packs of 10 so I can take them along on trips without having to take a large container. They also last longer that way since the other packs aren't opened. They are good for sensitive skin.

We love these, but they don’t pull through the dispenser in the wipe warmer. Packages are eco-friendly so that’s a bonus…
High quality, soft, durable and perfect amount of moisture.
Only gave 4 stars due to dispenser issue.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Moist thick wipes, but overwhelming scent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2024
reviews.review: The DYPER baby wipes are a great quality option with how thick and soft the wipes are. However, though the wipes say they are fragrance free, they are definitely not! The smell of these wipes is so overwhelming! It is kind of a lotion smell but is so strong and the smell stays behind even after you are done using them.

reviews.name: CustomerReview
reviews.title: Soft wipes. Good value for multi-pack
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2024
reviews.review: Great for life with baby - got to have wipes!

reviews.name: Asjstrm
reviews.title: Great to have around
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2024
reviews.review: These Dyper Baby Wipes have been very handy. They work great of cleaning up baby for diaper changes but also for food messes. I have used them to clean up after art crafts and at work on a construction site. They do not cause any allergic reaction on my sensitive skin.

reviews.name: Trish
reviews.title: Very nice, gental, heavy duty wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024
reviews.review: I like these wipes because they are heavier than a normal wipe, with almost the same feel as a Clorox wipe. They are thick enough that you can wipe down a baby's arms and legs without the edges rolling up on you. Other brands give me an almost burning sensation on my hands, but not these. The wipes don't tear easily, either. I tested moisture longevity by wiping down a series of objects, they didn't dry out as fast as other brands do. However, I don't care for the smell, and when you pull out one wipe, the next wipe is almost completely out of the package as well. So those things need some work. Overall, these are nice wipes.

reviews.name: Rob A.
reviews.title: Geat option for sensitive skin.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2024
reviews.review: Nice thick and effective wipes, on par with big name brand option. Free from perfumes and additives, just simple wet wipes but that work no different than mainstream options. Great for a number uses and a good value. Will be ordering again.

reviews.name: Athene C.
reviews.title: Effective wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2024
reviews.review:
These dyper baby wipes are water based, which I really like. They also are plant based, which is another win.
They are effective, do what they are supposed to do, and are more sustainable than some other brands.
They are pricey. But in some cases, cost savings is not worth it.

reviews.name: Inquisitive Consumer
reviews.title: Gentle, sturdy wet wipes.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2024
reviews.review:
The DYPER Baby Wipes are close to unscented. There is a light neutral scent.
The wet wipe has a textured side and a gentler soft side on the other.
It cleans and lightly moisturizes the skin. Though it does take a little time to dry (as there is no alcohol), it does not leave lots of residue, only a light moisturizing barrier.
The wipe is sturdy and did not break or tear apart.

reviews.name: JL
reviews.title: Great for wiping needs
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.review: I like that these wipes are very soft and lighter, though probably to most folks they won’t notice the difference. I also like that the seal is a stock seal as opposed to some other brands where they use a plastic snap opening. The first thing beyond how soft they are is how thin these are. I was a bit hesitant in that perhaps they wouldn’t clean the worst of messes but it does. The other thing I was hesitant about is for big messes, if it would get on my hands due to how thin they are and I did get them on my hands a few times but I would still recommend them.

reviews.name: Ruth
reviews.title: 👍
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2023
reviews.review:
These baby wipes are an excellent choice for parents looking for a gentle and eco-friendly option to keep their little one clean. They're made with 99% water, ensuring a mild and safe cleaning solution for sensitive skin. The use of plant-based materials makes them a more sustainable choice for environmentally conscious families.

One notable feature of these wipes is their hypoallergenic nature, which means they are less likely to cause skin irritation or allergies, making them ideal for babies with sensitive skin. They are free from harsh chemicals and fragrances, reducing the risk of any skin reactions.

The fact that these wipes are plastic-free adds to their environmental appeal, making them an excellent choice for parents who want to reduce their carbon footprint. This multi-pack of 60 travel wipes (with a total of 6 packs) ensures that you'll have a convenient and easily transportable solution for staying clean on the go.

Overall, these baby wipes provide peace of mind for parents. They prioritize the use of honest ingredients, are gentle on delicate skin, and offer an environmentally friendly option that can be used while traveling or as a daily essential for your baby.

reviews.name: JM
reviews.title: Great wipes, overpriced for travel packs
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.review:
These wipes work so well! I was previously using the textured version of water wipes but they were still slippery. The Dyper wipes clean up messes very well. They’re gentle on my baby’s skin, the wipes are large and thick. No odd smells. Does the job and I love how convenient the travel packs are to put inside my fanny pack style bag on quick outings where I don’t need the full size diaper bag.

However, I feel the travel packs are severely overpriced for the amount of wipes included. There are 60 wipes total separated in packs of ten. This is less than the equivalent of a full size pack of wipes. For $15, this is just too much. Paying for the packaging. I would also love a better solid wipe lid vs the plastic resealable flap. The wipes are going to dry out with the flap if they’re not used right away.

reviews.name: Hallie
reviews.title: Good quality wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
reviews.review:
I love the message behind this brand, they do definitely deliver quality product, and these wipes are no different. They are very thick wipes, and come out of the package super easily, they are not abrasive it all on the skin, and the ingredients make me feel much better about using these than other brands that contain harmful ingredients.
I did notice that it says plastic free, but the actual packaging of the wipes seems to be plastic-based, it is just the wipes that are plastic free. I can definitely tell that these are good quality wise, but I did notice a really weird scent. He kind of reminded me of a clean shoe store, it doesn’t smell bad, but it definitely doesn’t smell good either. That doesn’t really determined from using the waves because of the ingredients being so safe, but I definitely think that they could smell better.

reviews.name: PineapplePizza
reviews.title: Strong wipe with no strong scent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.review: I have sensitive skin and try to stick to natural products when possible, which is why I ordered these wipes. Though we no longer have any babies in our house, we use wipes in the bathroom anyway for you-know-what, as well as for wiping dirty hands on my six-year-old boy. These wipes are up to the job. We recently tried another brand of flushable wipes, but they always stuck together and tore very easily. These wipes are a great improvement. The travel pack is perfect for stowing in the car, my purse, or various rooms of the house as needed. I love that they don't use plastic and are plant-based. I only downgraded the rating to four stars because the package didn't stay sealed once open. I tried drying off the seal, but the stickiness was just gone. This is not a big deal when stored in the bathroom, but would be a problem in a purse or diaper bag.

reviews.name: ABCB
reviews.title: Hard to get out
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.review: Overall, I really like these wipes. I love the travel size to keep in our car caddy’s, diaper bag, etc, instead of a huge chunky pack. These wipes feel soft but are very Hardy. I like the texture on them and feels like that helps get baby cleaner than other brands with smooth wipes. I love that these are plant based and not full of chemicals but still does its job. That being said, these are hard to get out of the pouch even with two hands and impossible to do with 1. Even then I end up pulling out more than I need trying to grab them and with such small amount it’s a shame to waste them

reviews.name: Kelsey Mlnarik
reviews.title: Nice, soft, convenient, just a little pricey
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.review: My kids are potty trained, but they're still young enough that messy situations seem to happen everywhere. These are a great alternative to carrying a giant pack of wipes. They're a good size, sturdy and don't tear when they're being used, and they were nice and damp with cleaning solution when I opened the pack. They reseal pretty well. I appreciate that they're soft and made with clean ingredients so I can use them on my kiddos' hands and faces.

reviews.name: Devlin
reviews.title: As I am finding out, I love bamboo
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.review:
Bamboo is seeming to find it's way into a lot of different facets of my life lately and these baby wipes are no exception. These are some super soft wipes that do remind me of my favorite bamboo sheets...except these are made to be used and abused to clean stuff up, I won't try the same with my sheets lol. The scent is great, the packages seal well and keep them from drying out, the wipes are versatile (most are), they are very strong and don't come apart easily, and they don't overpower me with scents.

Pros:

Strong
Scent is good and not overpowering
Package seals well and prevents drying out
Made from bamboo (renewable)

Cons:

Could be a slightly better value

reviews.name: FL Reviewer
reviews.title: Dyper baby wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2023
reviews.review: This is a nice pack of travel baby wipes. The quality of the travel packs is nice and the opening actually seems pretty durable. Some travel wipes come with kind of a flimsy opening and they easily become dried out. This has a little more of a plastic and a solid covering on it which seems to be pretty good. The wipes do not have any kind of scent to them really and they are durable. They have a nice amount of wetness to them and did not harm my skin as I used them on myself and I had no negative reactions from using them. They are soft and good quality wipes. They do not rip while using them and are a good size.

reviews.name: Shelby D.
reviews.title: Mind twister
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.review:
These wipes are very nice. They are moist, they have no scent, they are strong, and thick.
The only reason I'm giving four stars is because of the design of the wipe itself. Being someone that uses cleaning wipes a lot, it's very similar to texture in that.

reviews.name: Reviewer
reviews.title: Love these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.review:
These wipes are sturdy and can stand up to a bit of scrubbing without ripping and tearing.

I don’t have a baby anymore but these work great for wiping off gas pump handles, and wiping my hands after. They leave my hands clean and perfect for that purpose.

reviews.name: Laura P.
reviews.title: Work really well, but they tear easily
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023

These are not my preferred brand of water wipes, but only because they tear more easily than the brand that I am currently using.

No irritation, cleans the baby very well… I just don’t need poo fingers when cleaning up heavier messes.

I would consider getting these again if my preferred brand was out of stock or if heavily discounted and cheaper.

reviews.name: its_bray_den

These wipes do a fine job of cleaning my son. These are basically as thick as most other baby wipes out there. The packaging is entirely fine. I will say they have a different smell to them, maybe it’s the plant based ingredients. They seem to have a very good product and a business model to appreciate if their approach to sustainability resonates with you.

reviews.name: Laura P.
reviews.title: Work really well, but they tear easily

reviews.review:
These are not my preferred brand of water wipes, but only because they tear more easily than the brand that I am currently using.

No irritation, cleans the baby very well… I just don’t need poo fingers when cleaning up heavier messes.

I would consider getting these again if my preferred brand was out of stock or if heavily discounted and cheaper.

reviews.name: Julie C.
reviews.title: Used for 18 months. Quality control issues. Honest opinion.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2024
reviews.review:
This is a modal window.

No compatible source was found for this media.
We have been using Dyper wipes and diapers almost exclusively for the first 18 months of our baby’s life. Here are the pros and cons:

Pros
1- compostability. If you’re looking for something more environmentally friendly, this is the diaper for you. You need to sign up for their service (additional monthly fee) and buy diapers direct from them.
2- our baby was generally able to sleep through the night in these diapers. If you get blowouts or leaks, size up and see if that fixes the issues.

Cons
There were two major quality issues that we experienced recently, and along with the customer service response, will be the reason why I never go back to Dyper brands.
1- we used a recent package of Dyper wipes (ordered August 2024) and halfway through the package, we discovered red masking tape inside the package. When we reached out to Dyper customer support, this was their response
“ Thank you for the email. Oh no! Rest assured that is just a pack that was the last at the end of the line during manufacturing. I will send you a new order of wipes out! :-) “
I did not want more of their wipes. I wanted to understand how they planned to rectify their quality control issues. The red tape bled to multiple wipes around it which likely contaminated the whole package. See picture attached.
2- used a Dyper diaper (ordered July 2024). When I went to change our baby today, I discovered small gel pellets all over her genital area. The seams of the diaper separated on both side and the pellets came out. See video attached. Our baby was in the diaper for about 4 hours. I have not reached out to Dyper customer service.

I’ve been using the wipes and diapers on our baby’s most sensitive areas and if you can’t trust the company to deliver quality products and acknowledge and fix quality control issues, then you shouldn’t be buying their products. I will not be returning as a customer. I am cross posting my review for the diapers and wipes. Videos of the quality control issues are uploaded under each product’s respective review.

reviews.name: fryh1n
reviews.title: Very disappointed with the new scents on this fragrance-free wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2024
reviews.review:
Have been using these wipes from Dyper for 4+ years, and they have gone through a few different package designs and what not.
Some of the the major changes were the reduction in number of wipes per pack, and then the flimsy plastic cover instead of a hard cover.

BUT with the latest update, the wipes actually smell now. Fragrance free... maybe? non-scented... no more!!!
Nobody in our household like the new scent, and we will have to look for alternative. I am sure there are other families who will be switching too due to this latest "improvement".

reviews.name: joe
reviews.title: I do not recommend!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2024
reviews.review: I was thinking my son’s skin was just irritated but after his mother used a wipe to clean her face she immediately got a rash and was extremely irritated. I do not recommend. I feel so bad for my 6 month old. I’m thinking spend the extra money on something natural and safe. I would rather use pampers wipes at this point.

reviews.name: R.B
reviews.title: They burn!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2024
reviews.review: Alright, long review. DON'T BUY THESE! So I wiped my 5 year olds face with one of these wipes and she broke out in a huge rash. She has sensitive skin so I just didn't have her use them. Next kid. I wiped my 4 year olds face with one a week or so later. Huge rash! He has sensitive skin too. So I've just been using them on my poor little 6 month old for diaper changes. Then I wiped his face with one, HUGE RASH! So my husband and I both took a wipe and wiped our faces. And what do you know? We both broke out in rashes! It felt like a hot stinging sunburn. Chemical burn? I don't know. 5 out of 5 of us broke out in rashes. Don't buy them.

reviews.name: Jason
reviews.title: Bad smell
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2024
reviews.review: I should have read more reviews prior to purchasing but the variety of sizes and my previous experience with the brand made me not think twice before purchasing. I purchased the 6 pack of 10 thin packs packs for travel and they all smelled terrible!! I love Dyper brand diapers and have never had issues so I was super disappointed. I’m not sure if it was close to expiration or something happened while shipping in the heat but I will not be buying these again. I love the thin packs for sling bags and travel and was hoping these would be my go to but I’ll be looking for an alternative as this seems to a consistent issue. Had I not already packed these and found out while on our trip I would have returned immediately.

reviews.name: Kimberly

reviews.review: We use to love this product. Have ordered this brand of wipes since our now 2 year old was born. This batch smells heavily of lotion and gave her terrible diaper rash. Will be switching brands.

After comparing it with an older package, i even noticed that some of the ingredients are different and it might be why they smell really bad. My son hates them now, doesn’t even want me to wipe his tush with them. What happened to they’re pledge of sustainability and clean products? I am really upset if there is a lack of transparency on this now. The older version had no smell at all! I am having to discontinue its use be ause my son just completely hates it! (The first picture is the new version)

reviews.name: Amazon Customer

reviews.name: Camz R

And I still have a lot because I've been avoiding it due to the smell. I just hope they're not all like that, but I'm not sure I will ever buy these again

reviews.name: Amazon customer

reviews.name: Amazon Customer

reviews.review: I have been using these wipes for years and they have been great. However, the one's I got in my latest order REEK. The smell is really intense and unbearable. The smell even lingers on my hands after they are used. I compared the ingredients to the ones I already had and it looks like they changes slightly. I do not know what changed, but I am really disappointed and am probably going to return all of them.

reviews.name: Jon Anthony

reviews.review: Have used these and loved them since October of 23. Last shipment arrived and noticed the packaging was a different color - no big deal and didn't think much of it. If the wipes burn my face this bad, can't imagine what they will do to my son. Sad because I used to love them. Wish they would have kept producing them the same way.

I'm so tired of companies acting like they're so healthy when they really use an unnecessary amount of ingredients, and ingredients that should not be put on human skin, ESPECIALLY BABY SKIN!

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.review: We've done cloth diapers during the day, but for night, they always leak. We tried several brands of diapers. Dyper brand is so soft, and we've never had a night or nap leak in them. That wasn't true of the other brands we tried. Now that we're potty training (also he's a big boy so his size outgrew the diapers. He's got too much junk in the truck and the diapers were too slim) it just made sense to stick with Dyper training pants. I'm very happy with them. They fit great, are still soft, and don't leak at night. I only wish the charcoal ones came in training pants.

reviews.review: Fine

reviews.name: Emilie
reviews.title: I like these briefs style more than "normal" diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2022
reviews.review:
I like these training pants / briefs style of diapers. We're actually not using these as potty training pants yet and have just been using it as a normal diaper. I really like these! My little one knows to lift his legs up now when I tell him we're putting pants on, and he did the same for me with these. These diapers are soft and plush. This definitely feels better than some of the other cheap, plastic-y type of diapers. These definitely have a good amount of stuffing, and is way better than some of the drugstore brands I purchased - talk about paper thin on those diapers! I'm not trying to compare these with the "cheap" brands, just pointing out the obvious physical difference in the material and stuffing. All that said, the softness does not matter all that much though, as long as the overall quality is good - and these are.

At first I got these 2T-3T thinking I would save them for when my baby is ready for this size. He is still wearing 12M clothes and I believe we're still using size 4 or 5 diapers! I was surprised when I opened these and they look to be about my son's size. When I put these on him I was surprised that this fits. It does have the stretchy band, so it can stretch quite a bit. I can't say if these run big or small but it seems like most people are saying it runs big, so I am very pleasantly surprised my little one can wear these already. Although these are pretty "clean", they do have a bit of a smell to it. I recommend to take these out of the packaging and let it air out for a little bit. Once you let it air out it is fine. We usually take out all the diapers from its packaging and dump it inside a box, regardless of brand. I like to mix and match different ones on a daily basis.

I appreciate the indicator line on these, and that is the one thing about diapers that are non negotiable for me. That's a feature I need to have on my diapers as I often rely on that line. There is a the Dyper giraffe logo on the front, which makes it easier for you to tell which is the front and back. The diapers looks very simple, clean, and straightforward.

These diapers are advertised as plant based and eco friendly but I didn't see any information about how well these disintegrate in the landfill. I don't know if these do or if they just sit in the landfill for decades. I wish they provided more information from an eco conscious perspective, as that would have been something that would make me support this particular brand of diapers and make these diapers stand out from its competitors.

Overall I would say give these DYPER(s) a try. Diapers seem to be a personal thing that works differently for every baby, this might just be your new favorite. The diapers seem pretty "clean" and if that type of thing is important to you, definitely check this brand out.

Last thing I'll add is I would like to urge the company to hi-light the eco aspect of these, as that will be one of the things that will help you stand out from major big name brands. As of now, all I know is these are made from bamboo, but I'm not being convinced as to why I should make the switch to this material over some of the other "clean", plant based materials.

reviews.name: UCSDsoccer
reviews.title: Better than you expect in every way
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2022
reviews.review:
Absolutely love these training pants! Our toddler has just started potty training, so this is new territory to us... but these have been awesome so far. She is able to take them off and pull them back up by herself with ease - and they are still nice and snug without leaking. I've read about bamboo vicose before, but this is the first time actually getting something made from this. I was skeptical because my initial, unlearned opinion was that bamboo cannot become something soft?! However these are actually more soft and plush than our usual diapers! It is super absorbent and comfy.
SIZING
Our LO was wearing size 4T diapers and I was worried these might be too small. However, when I lay them flat on top of each other, these Dypers are actually about 1/2" wider and 1" longer than the 4T diapers. So these are great if you usually use 4T, but may be too big if you normally buy 3T.

reviews.name: asterisk
reviews.title: Stretchy, comfortable waist. Very soft
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2022
reviews.review:
These training pants have a very stretchy and comfortable waistband. It fits snugly, and moves with baby. It stretches out easily to go on or off. It fits well for the size, and feels just a tad bigger than other brands. The material is very soft, both inside and outside. It absorbs well for daytime accidents..

The wetness indicator is on both the front and back. So I couldn't figure out at first, which side was which. The giraffe goes on the front - it's printed small on the package. I wish they had just printed the word "back" on the back like other brands.

I love that this brand doesn't use chlorine, fragrances, or other toxins.

reviews.name: Tim
reviews.title: Thick training pants
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2022
reviews.review:
These are very absorbent and soft training pants. They are also fairly thick. They don’t feel cheap and thin like some store brand ones I have tried. My daughter said they made her sweaty but I’m not sure if she just isn’t used to them. They are plain in style so I think that can be good and bad. My daughter does seem to be motivated by the characters or print ones. But a basic plain white like this is gender neutral and crisp looking. They have the wetness indicator on them. Also most of the printed training pants are pretty obvious for front versus back. These have a subtle mark so I had to show my daughter which was which as she likes to put them on herself. It took some practice. Size wise, I went by weight versus age and actually went up a size so they wouldn’t be too tight or binding. That worked out fine for us.

I appreciate the fact they are made without the chemicals. They have caused no irritation and have been gentle on her skin while being absorbent when needed.

Pleased with these overall and I would buy them again.

reviews.name: Nicocallie
reviews.title: Great For My Daughter With Super Sensitive Skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2022
reviews.review: My 3 year old is in the middle of potty training and she has really sensitive skin. I have tried lots of diapers over the last couple years. I knew I was going to have a struggle finding her training pants that would work for her. I had tried Dyper's diapers and they worked for her so I was hoping the training pants would too. I know the price on these is really high but I hate seeing her suffer so I am willing to pay what I need to, to ensure she doesn't get a rash. These training pants are great. She never gets a rash with them. They are very soft. She can easily pull them up and down on her own. She still has trouble telling the front from the back but that isn't a big deal. I love that they are using bamboo as the resource. Overall I do wish they were slightly cheaper but you get what you pay for and these are great.

reviews.name: Trelakopela
reviews.title: I like this brand for my son
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2022
reviews.review:
Hopefully he’s digging these too. No real fuss when wearing. Both diapers are by Dyper. One training pant and the other is basic diaper. I was stumped with the training diaper as I really didn’t know which side was the back or front - but does it really matter in the end.!? According to the package it’s giraffe yellow side to the front.
Good absorption. Holds quite a bit for descent about of hours.
I got these in size 3t 4t & 4t-5T & so far the 3r-4t seem pretty ideal since they run a little big. He’s prob like 25-26lbs 31”-32” inches long.

reviews.name: Zü
reviews.title: nice
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2022
reviews.review:
DYPER Bamboo Toddler Potty Training Pants are super soft and absorbent. There's no tape or tabs, but the sides are stretchy and would allow your toddler to move around freely. There's no harsh dyes, bleach, scents or other chemicals, and no brightly colored graphics - the pants are white with a giraffe on the front.
We are almost done with potty training, so are only using these for long car trips or overnight, and haven't had any problems - no leaks, blowouts or irritation.
These are a bit pricy, but are a good choice for eco-conscious mama.

reviews.name: Denise
reviews.title: Good pull-up but pricey
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2022
reviews.review: My toddler did great with these pull ups , but very pricy

reviews.name: D.T.
reviews.title: Better than other name brand training pants.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2022
reviews.review: I have tried various training pants on the market. The biggest complain of training pants my son had was the scratchy seams so he keeps tugging at them and after a couple of tugs, they tear on the side. We currently use a named brand pull up and was pleasantly surprised by the dyper version that is very similar, just as soft with a stretchy seamless band and as absorbent. Happy to switch to Dyper from now on. They do run a little big, see comparison of pull up and dyper.

reviews.name: Lilbear
reviews.title: Soft, absorbent and true to size
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2022
reviews.review:
My 17 months old normally wears diaper size 5 or training pants 2t - 3t. This DYPER Bamboo Toddler Potty Training Pants Girls & Boys Size 2T-3T fits him nicely. I was a bit hesitant to order as the DYPER diapers run large on him but this training pants is a perfect fit!
The absorbency is great during the day. Never leaked so far. It is also a lot softer than many other similar products, especially on the waist. My LO moves comfortably while wearing this. Highly recommended!

reviews.name: FSUmommy
reviews.title: Soooo soft!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2022
reviews.review:
I absolutely love these training pants by Dyper. I was concerned about the level of absorbency since a lot of the “clean” brands just don’t make the cut (as much as I try and make them work). These pull ups actually do work well and I’m happy to report we’ve had no leaks middle of the night. These also get a 10/10 for softness- they are literally the softest training pants I’ve ever purchased and my son said they are comfortable. We have a little diaper rash now and I feel good about him wearing these versus some with chemicals.

Overall highly recommend. We went with 2T-3T for my 25 lb 3 year old and it’s a perfect fit!

reviews.name: 🌟Shemira🌙☀️
reviews.title: Very soft and good for sensitive skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2022
reviews.review:
Size is running big compared to huggies or pampers.
My 18 months old wear size 3-4T from both pampers and huggies. 2-3T from this brand fits him nicely.
They are very soft and fits well. No are not leaking. Both front and back were well designed with thick and soft cotton for better absorbing. These honestly are very nice pull-ups but they are pricey.
My son has quite of sensitive skin type, and this pull up not causing any discomfort or redness.

reviews.name: ga9
reviews.title: super impressed!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2022
reviews.review:
We snagged a box of these bamboo training underpants as part of the Amazon Vine review program. I normally wouldn't pay nearly $100 for diapers or pull-ups, but the price is right when they're free.

I really wasn't expecting much at all. I figured these would be an overpriced junk quality pull-up made to be overpriced because they're made of "bamboo."

I was wrong.

The quality and absorbency is far superior to any other diaper or pull-up we have tried before. Yes, this training underpants has BETTER absorbency than an actual diaper. For a point of reference, our 3 year old usually uses Huggies diapers and pull-ups. These are way better than those. This box lasted us far longer than a box of regular diapers or pull-ups last us. And our son started calling these his "giraffe undies" versus the other pull-ups which he thinks are still diapers.

Now, am I going to go and spend $100 on another box of them? Yeah, I actually am.

reviews.name: @@@Bruins@@@
reviews.title: good potty training pants
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2022
reviews.review: These are soft and snug, and the long elastic-like material on the side has a good grip but doesn't bother my child at all. These training pants are made from plants and are environmentally friendly. They claim to be made of 100% bamboo vicose. They are non-toxic and do not contain chlorine, latex, alcohol, perfumes, PVC, lotions, TBT, parabens, sulfates, or phthalates. To protect the next generation, they are unprinted, unscented, hypoallergenic, and cruelty-free. There is a small giraffe on the pull up. That will be sewn onto the front of the training pants.

reviews.name: Amavon
reviews.title: So soft!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2022
reviews.review: You will not believe how soft these diapers feel! They are very lightweight and work superbly! I love that these are made from bamboo, a renewable resource. Very happy with these and will purchase more!

reviews.name: Chad
reviews.title: The perfect training diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2022
reviews.review: These are an amazing substitute for my cloth diapers. I have been using cloth diapers with my todler for the past 2 years but after second baby I wanted to use disposable diapers to help with the transition to 2 kids and I am extremely happy with these. I have used their regular diapers and now that we are potty training these pull ups make it so easy for my toddler to pull them down to use the potty and they can even pull them back up, great practice for real underwear. They also are perfect for an on the go toddler that refuses to lay down for a diaper change, you can change them standing up!! These are a little more pricey the other options but their great for the Earth and hold so much liquid so you don't have to chang them as often so I believe they are 100% worth the extra money.

reviews.name: Shasta daisy
reviews.title: Perfect for overnight!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2022
reviews.review: These Dyper bamboo pull ups are the best I’ve tried! I was super impressed they are soft, extremely absorbent, and stretch and move with your toddler! We had no leaks throughout the night with these! My nephew also has sensitive skin and these didn’t cause any irritation or rashes! Definitely recommend

reviews.name: Danice
reviews.title: Good quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2022
reviews.review: They fit perfect and are quite absorbent

reviews.name: Amyrose2019
reviews.title: Works out great for us
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2022
reviews.review: The dyper bamboo pull ups have worked well for us. I feel comfortable knowing my daughter is in a safe product. No leaks for us! She only wears them at night as she is trained during the day. The size is accurate as others have mentioned maybe slightly a tad big compared to honest but not much, yes a bit on the pricey side but you will always pay more for a “clean” product. My daughter has extremely sensitive skin and we’ve had no breakouts. For that I would continue to pay the price.

reviews.name: Max
reviews.title: Premium Brand, Better for the Environment and Your Baby's Butt
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2022
reviews.review: With Dyper, you'll be paying a little more than 2x competitor brands, but what you get is softer, all-natural, eco-friendly diapers. If you're loyal to their brand, you'll know their stuff usually runs large; this one is no exception. If you care about the perfect fit, get one size smaller, but if oversized diapers don't bother you, then this will be fine. The larger diaper allows it to contain blowouts better and absorb more liquid. These training briefs are perfect on the go and when you start potty training. Best of all, these will leave your baby's butt dry. Like other diapers, there's no front or back indicator for these. At least, they include the blue wet line indicator.

reviews.name: Josh/Emily
reviews.title: Thick!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2022
reviews.review: These pull up training pants are very nice and thick quality! Almost too thick! They do fit a little big, but that’s generally a good thing holds lots. The elastic seems pretty nice and fits tight! My son does a good job of getting them up and down easily, he’s had trouble with some of the other brands!

reviews.name: Kimberly Whitney
reviews.title: Organic pullups
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2022
reviews.review: These are super plain pull ups with no designs, but they are pretty awesome and super absorbent. My toddler wears them to bed and wakes up still feeling dry. They fit true to size but have a good stretch to them on the sides and waistband. I wanted to try a brand that didn't have characters slapped all over them so my toddler will transition to cool underwear and ditch the pullups faster.

reviews.name: M. Smith
reviews.title: Baby’s Potty Training Made Easy!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2022
reviews.review: These bamboo briefs for toddlers are designed for softness, comfort and functionality! They are not only plant-based, but being eco-friendly they are right up my alley. They are also hypoallergenic, which is just a pampering benefits for my toddler’s sensitive skin. And thanks to the ultra absorbency it offers her, she feels comfortably dry even when technically, she isn’t. These potty briefs are a godsend!

reviews.name: THERESA
reviews.title: Great brand for all ages
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2022
reviews.review: We have some Dyper Bamboo for the infant in our house and when I saw the had pull ups, decided to give those a try as well. Fit very well and made it through the night. Right now, this is the only time we need a pull up as the rest of potty training is complete with the older kids. These are soft and comfortable for them to sleep in, I heard no complaints. Easy up and easy down plus a little better for the environment. Overall, we are pretty happy with these!

reviews.name: LiquidSteam
reviews.title: So incredibly soft and comfortable
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2022

reviews.name: Alice W.

reviews.review: Better than I thought. The Dyper brand is super soft, has great absorbency and is environmentally friendly. It’s a high end diaper with a price that matches but it lives up to its hype.

reviews.name: Emily J. Morris

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2022
reviews.review: While these are slightly on the pricier side, these are a line of pull-ups that are certainly worth the cost, and I believe in paying within reason for good diapers. These potty-training briefs are plenty cozy and quite in line with the quality I expect from the diapers (which are also fantastic, by the way). These have a good, tight fit that moves with the baby, so leaks are prevented. They're wonderfully absorbent and don't get all disturbingly bulgy if you go too long between changes. The material is perfect for sensitive skin.

reviews.name: Dinosaurs and Mermaids, mom of both

Yes, I recommend this product

These are soft and snug and the long elastic like stuff on the side has a nice grip, but doesnt seem to bother my kiddo at all. She really does like them as they make her feel like a big girl.

reviews.name: SA
reviews.title: comfortable and easy to pull down

reviews.review:

When it is wet, it turns blue to let you know baby has soiled the diaper. They have about as much absorbancy as a diaper, but without the velcro waist tags that would make it hard for a toddler to remove themselves.
Even though the elastics on the legs are secure, they are very stretchy, and can fit almost any body type. They are also easy for my little one to pull down himself. I'm happy with these training pants.

reviews.name: Oceania

reviews.name: Kari Russell
