reviews.name: Lindsay
reviews.title: Maybe run a tad small but they’re really great quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2022
reviews.review:
I currently have a 3 year old who isn’t interested in potty training yet. We had a bunch of size 2T and 3T pull ups left over from my first son but those are already too small. He is about 39lbs and wears size 3T and 4T clothing and size 6 in most diapers. I tried the size 6 in this brand for him and they ran too small for him to wear comfortably. I decided to try these as a slightly larger size option. These actually fit him really well and comfortably. Considering these are supposed to be 4T-5T I would say they definitely run on the small side if you compare to other diapers and toddler clothing. The smaller sizes did fit my daughter accurately though. I think my son just has a little more junk in his trunk and around the sides lol.
These briefs have almost all the same features of this same brand of diapers that I really love. They are super soft, have the yellow wetness indicator, and when they get liquid in them they stay pretty firm/solid instead of feeling mushy. What’s even better about these is the elastic between the front and back. It’s super soft and stretchy and comfortable for him to wear and feels more secure than just the little strips most diapers have. What really blew me away is the extra elastic/stretchy pieces down around the leg opening too. It really makes for a much more realistic brief type fit and feeling and far superior to the big name brands of pull ups. My son may be a little bummed about no fun characters but he will get over it. I will mention I did notice a slight smell to them when opening though. It’s not a chemical smell per se but its definitely not a fresh/natural smell. It’s very very faint though.
Even though my son still isn’t quite ready for potty training I may have him start wearing these regularly anyway just because they fit so nicely on him. They are easy to tear down the sides as well in case you do have to clean them up more like a diaper.
Overall I really like this training pants/briefs and will definitely continue to use this box. If you have the extra money to spend since they are pretty pricey, I would definitely recommend these. Considering usually training pants aren’t worn for near as long, one box might be enough and might just be worth it to have this nice quality.

reviews.name: Angry Face
reviews.title: The best disposable training pants I've ever used, BUT...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2022
reviews.review:
These are probably the best disposable training pants I've ever used. The elastic is good and stretchy and my 2 year old doesn't hate them. He's able to pull them up and down by himself. They don't leak. They're actually absorbent enough to use as diapers. The material is soft, and doesn't irritate his skin.

I asked the manufacturer if these were biodegradable. There's no mention of it on the packaging or on Dyper's website, and I received no response to my query. To me, that means that no, they are not biodegradeable. I like that they're made of bamboo and that the manufacturing process has less of an impact on the planet, but hate that they're not biodegradeable. That's the big thing. Diapers take at least 500 years to break down. Five. Hundred. Years. Basically, my child's great great great great grandchildren will be gone before these training pants fully degrade, and that's just a guess. The first disposable diapers are still solidly full of poo in a landfill somewhere, and won't be degraded for another 450 years.

Better for the planet, but not best for the planet. Though effective, convenient and the best at keeping my carpet / furniture clean, once they're done I'm going to stick with our cloth training pants for a clean consience.

reviews.name: CM
reviews.title: Soft and absorbent but expensive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2022
reviews.review:
These DYPER disposable training pants are very soft and super absorbent. They were great for my son for nighttime (he’s daytime trained). The sides are very stretchy and they don’t sag.

Overall I’m very pleased with them. Unfortunately we can’t buy again because of the higher price. If you can afford them, they’re great. Much softer and less paper like than other brands at the store, although the other brands function just as well. I’d like to see more data from the company about their eco friendliness, because the packaging states their ingredients which contains plastic materials. I’m sure they’re much less plastic than other brands, I’d just like more info about this. They are also eligible for the REDYPER program, where you send used ones back to DYPER for a price to be composted. How much of it gets composted since it has plastic materials? I don’t know.

But anyway, if you want a soft and absorbent disposable training pant and cost isn’t an issue, these are perfect.

reviews.name: A.L
reviews.title: They are really quality, but a little pricey
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2022
reviews.review: Things I like about these pull-ups: they work for nighttime use, they are really really organic and go over the top for the environment, and they are easy to put on. What I don't like? The price point. For 17 diapers, this is $23, so over a dollar a diaper. To me, an avid Luvs user, this is pretty high of a price point for something my 3 year old toddler wears only at night to catch any leaks. I do like knowing that the material is very safe and clean for wearing for over 12 hrs., but I'm not sure if I would regularly buy these. The packaging is really nice and these make me feel really good about buying, but at the end of the day, it's an overnight diaper for my use and I'm just being honest in saying that I will go back to the Luvs brand instead when these are gone.

reviews.name: Jenna H
reviews.title: Works great overnight even with a toddler who drinks alot at night.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2022
reviews.review: Was sent a size 5-6 and they were the same size as Pampers Pull-ups 4-5t for size comparison. Thankfully they fit my daughter just fine, they stretch and it looks like there is some room in these. The fit is nice; my daughter is very active and these allow her to be. They don’t hinder her. These diapers had no decorative aspects but honestly this didn’t bother me; I am used to more color on the diapers. I would have liked some sort of front/back guidance because we never really were sure if we put them on right. Thankfully no accidents at night; they have been very absorbent and made it through the whole night no problem. My daughter drinks a lot at night and so we put the pullups to the test with how much they can hold.

reviews.name: LSK
reviews.title: A Soft, Comfortable Diaper (Seem to Run a Bit Big)
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2022
reviews.review:

These diapers are surprisingly soft (bamboo never ceases to amaze me) and seemed to be comfortable for my granddaughter. They’re roomy and absorbent, as well. My granddaughter is 2 (3 in July) and usually wears a size 5/6 and the 5/6 were just a tad too roomy - so keep that in mind when ordering, as they seem to run a bit big.

My only critique would be that they’re not always amazing at keeping everything “contained” during messier situations, but that's probably because they’re a too big for my granddaughter.

When comparing Dryper brand to similar items, they are spot on as far as price point. I never found that comparing apples to oranges works out very well! So apples to apples, Dryper brand for the win.

I’ve been much happier with the Rascal pull-ups and will be going back to using those.

reviews.review: Love the idea, execution is just okay

reviews.name: A. Nicole
reviews.title: Pros and Cons
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2022
reviews.review:
I have mixed opinions on these pull up pants. Overall, I don't hate them, but am not sure I'd order them again until my daughter is actually ready for potty training (so it's more of a backup, rather than a primary diaper).

Pros
- no patterns (this is nice under light color outfits or summer dresses)
- soft and comfortable (my little one seems perfectly happy in these)
- no irritants, fragrances etc
- large pack will last a while
- supposedly better for the environment (I haven't really done any research into this, just taking the brand at face value)

Cons
- it was unclear which side was the front vs the back. apparently the giraffes are meant to be on the front.
- the size isn't printed on the diaper anywhere I can see
- these aren't the most absorbent diapers so don't really work for overnight for us
- the fit is OK, but not super secure. We had a big blowout in the car, and had to take the whole car seat apart to clean the poop out!!!
- the price (at almost $1 each, these are some of the priciest diapers I've seen)
- there is no tab to secure the diaper once you've taken it off and rolled it up. The pull ups we were previously using had a sticky tab, which was appreciated.

reviews.name: Heather C

reviews.name: Raphael Coloma
reviews.title: Nice material but way too narrow
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2023
reviews.review: I've been a fan of Dyper's diapers for babies but these bamboo briefs did not work out. I had seen other reviews saying they were too narrow and figured it'd be perfect for my extra skinny toddler. But I was wrong! Now the material is fine, similar feel to their diapers but the kiddo does not want to wear them because they always slip into the butt crack and end up being very uncomfortable. I tried hooking my finger in the gussets to make sure they are on the outer butt cheeks but it did not work out. Cannot buy again until they redesign the width in the bottom and crotch area. (Waist sizing is fine, stretch is nice. Absorbance worked for overnight!)

reviews.name: Joanie Sala
reviews.title: Toddler Peed Through Diaper in 5 minutes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2023
reviews.review: I’m so disappointed because I really wanted to like these but I was using them for overnights with my potty training toddler and every morning he woke up with pajamas that smelled like pee. I decided to stop using them overnight and just used them for temporary use during the day when he briefly wears training pants to go #2. Within 5 minutes he had peed through the diaper. This has never happened with any other brand. I literally found a puddle on the floor beneath him.

reviews.name: Lissette
reviews.title: Great quality but leak at night
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2023
reviews.review: I was so excited about the quality and performance through the day. However, today in the morning when I was taking out the sleepsack from my toddler I noticed he was wet, hasnt happened in a long long time, exactly just now that I changed from Pampers 360 cruisers to these ones. I’m going to try Coterie now….

reviews.name: Cristina Cascaval
reviews.title: The quality is very Good But first try was failed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2023
reviews.review: My baby wore during the nap and woke up with his wet cloth😞 2 star just to soft quality

reviews.name: Jennifer Kaup
reviews.title: Fibers could have caused us a big problem
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2022
reviews.review: I wanted to like these pull on training diapers so much, but they definitely didn't work for us. My 3 yo is a 5T and working on potty training. Automatically, we didn't like the fit. They were like a sumo diaper fit, riding up on the sides and his butt. This made it really easy for leaks to occur. BUT our biggest concern was that there were fibers that shed, and we found them around the head of his ____. They were wrapped around and needed to be carefully removed as he complained that his ____ hurt. Thank goodness that we found it when we did because that could have become much worse. Especially for the price, I would not recommend these at all.

reviews.name: Somalia
reviews.title: The a little heavy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.review: The are not light and seem really thick for potty training

reviews.name: Henderson78
reviews.title: Ok for naps, leaks overnight
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2024
reviews.review: I quite liked these at first, no smell and safer for my little one/the environment. However, we quickly discovered they are not up to the output my little guy has to offer. We have had quite a few leaks/wet beds. Using up what we have for nap time. Do not recommend.

reviews.name: Ben
reviews.title: Leaks for almost every nap and nighttime
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2022
reviews.review: We used Dyper brand diapers for our 2 year old son when he was a baby up until we potty trained him a few weeks ago. While we generally loved the diapers and found them to be absorbent enough for most occasions (usually had to use a more absorbent night diaper as he got older unfortunately), these training pants have been a huge disappointment. We only use them for naps and nights, but our son has woken up wet almost every day. They don't even seem to cut it for his 1 hr naps--often the front will have absorbed some liquid while the back will be totally dry (our son is a stomach sleeper). It seems like the absorbent pad does not soak up or redistribute liquid while the stretch material surrounding it does nothing to contain the mess. Luckily we haven't had any poop in these yet but I can't imagine them doing anything to contain the mess. Agree with other reviewers that these seem more like a maxi pad with stretchy diaper material surrounding it. I thought these would perform better being a training pant specifically designed for older children but I guess we should have known better given the high failure rate of Dyper's regular diapers for overnight use as our son got older.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Elastic lining bunches up
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.review: These are awful. I don’t know how a manufacturer messes up this bad on a basic design… But the inner elastic linings aren’t spaced out far enough, and within a few minutes of wearing the pull up and walking around in it, they bunch together and create the worst toddler wedgie ever. My daughter hates them and is visibly annoyed when she wears these. I’ve never seen a pull up do this. On any other brand, the elastic lining on either side of the main pad always is spaced out enough that it sits on the buttcheeks, NOT wadded up right in the crotch. I don’t know how it would even catch any poop with how bad the lining bunches up on these. Terrible awful bad. Especially for a low tox expensive product. They really need to fix it.

reviews.name: Bfree
reviews.title: The worst pull up ever!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2024
reviews.review: They soak all the way through. Even the outside of the pull up is soaked. They are like a thick pair of underwear they don’t protect or hold the potty in. Woke up several nights completely soaked, clothes, bedding everything! These are literally the worst!!! What a joke!! Parents do not buy these!

reviews.name: lesa
reviews.title: WAY TOO BIG
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.review: these things were MASSIVE and way off in sizing. They were completely unusable. I went by the weight just like I have for other brands and they was practically falling off. I was really disappointed because I bought them right before a roadtrip and had to make an emergency stop elsewhere to get a different brand. Do yourself a favor and skip these.

reviews.name: Glenda
reviews.title: RASH
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2024
reviews.review: I usually use Pampers never once had a rash before but my boyfriend has been wanting our daughter to use better quality organic bamboo diapers and first time using these and they gave her a horrible rash.

reviews.name: amcamc
reviews.title: LEAKS
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2024
reviews.review: I have used these for over 3 months every night. Each time they were full, they leaked. The outside of the pull-up was wet which wet the pajamas, sheets and blanket. I just thought my son had peed a lot, but I tried another brand (Bamboo Dreams) yesterday, same amount of pee, but no leaking whatsoever.

reviews.name: Stephanie
reviews.title: Expensive, leaky diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2023
reviews.review: My kid has incredibly sensitive skin so this is one of the only brands he can tolerate. Unfortunately they have a major issue and it seems like 1 in 3 diapers leaks completely through soaking my son (and anyone who may be holding him) entirely. I’m on vacation now and having to carry multiple pairs of backup shorts around for the next accident. Isn’t the first time and when I contact customer service I get the run around. Don’t waste your money.

reviews.name: Norland20
reviews.title: NOT for Sensitive Skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2022
reviews.review: I had high hopes for these but I was disappointed. My son has sensitive skin and mild eczema and these caused him to tear his skin apart from all the scratching near the diaper area. I even ordered directly from the website just in case I received a bad batch from Amazon, but it was the same result. So much so that I accidentally left one in the bottom of the diaper bag and a month later his grandmother used it and couldn’t figure out why he was scratching so much. Sadly, these were the culprit.

reviews.name: Roxanne Saunders
reviews.title: Awful!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2023
reviews.review:
These diapers are awful! They leak so bad just after one pee! And even after taken off to change my son is soaked in his own urine. They rip around the diaper so my daughter and son is waking up with the diaper half off.
I WILL NEVER BYE AGAIN!

reviews.name: Hailey Lampa
reviews.title: Leaked
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2023
reviews.review: My son wears a size 4 in pampers 360. I tried using the 3t ones but they leaked every time for a week straight. Was so disappointed. Love how soft they are but I couldn’t get them to hold overnight.

reviews.review: These wipes are our favorite and we have tried dozens of wipes. They are strong, moist, and soft. They are also made with healthier ingredients. We call these luxury wipes in our house because they feel so nice!

reviews.review: The only wipes I have ever purchased for my now 2 month old. Love the ingredients, quality, moisture, and softness. They’re a bit pricey but worth it in my opinion.

reviews.name: Frantzcesse
reviews.title: Clean and good
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2024
reviews.review: I like this wipe for my daughter tush. It cleans well and I’m happy I can invest in clean ingredients for her skin. It doesn’t smell good or bad. It’s fragrance free which is a plus for me.

reviews.name: The Castle Family

reviews.review: These work great. They work well in a wipe warmer.

reviews.name: customer
reviews.title: Really good wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.review:
This review is for: DYPER Newborn Baby Wipes, 99.9% Water, 100% Plant-Based, Hypoallergenic for Sensitive Newborn Skin, 4 Pack, 224 Wipes

I was impressed with these! I'm often hesitant with new brands of wipes. I like that these have very limited ingredients, or hypoallergenic and are for sensitive skin which is definitely an issue in my house.

The wipes are the perfect level of wetness. They are designed to definitely clean well and last as long as you need them to last, but they are not dripping wet, either.

I didn't pick up any discernible scent from them.

The size is good for newborns, and while they are fairly thin, they do hold up well and don't fall apart.

reviews.name: michele
reviews.title: The wipes smell clean, more of soap than anything else.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
reviews.review:
DYPER Newborn Baby Wipes | 99.9% Water Wipes | 100% Plant-Based | Hypoallergenic for Sensitive Newborn Skin | Honest Ingredients | Fragrance Free | Plastic-Free | Unscented | 4 Pack, 224 Wipes

First impressions: Nice box full of 4 individual packs of wet wipes to clean baby messes. The wipes smell clean, more of soap than anything else.

Installation/setup: Open pack and use to clean.

Final thoughts: Nice package of wet wipes. The wipes come out cleanly and easily and are plenty wet. They are soft to the skin and I didn’t have any reaction to the wipes.

⭐️1 star - I don't recommend it at all, poor quality.
⭐️⭐️ 2 stars - I don't recommend it, it has multiple faults, or a very high price.
⭐️⭐️⭐️ 3 stars - It's passable, It has some faults but the quality is ok for what it is.
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ 4 stars - Product quite acceptable, it does what it promises.
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ 5 stars - Product that I totally recommend.

They have stayed fresh throughout the use but I am not a big fan of the cover which is kept fresh with by the adhesive which opens and closes but loses it stick after a while. Clean and natural wipes for a great clean feel

reviews.name: STxHippie
reviews.title: Great wipes!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.review: These wipes are soft and absorbent. They have a nice light scent. They work very well for babies and general use as needed. I’ve been very happy with this bulk package!

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023

These have a great sticky tab on the top to keep the baby wipes fresh, which I like. Overall, they do well, but I think I’ll stick to my usual brand of wipes for now.

reviews.name: Sunflowery
reviews.title: Good moisture and size
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2023
reviews.review:
These wipes have good moisture and size. They are pretty wet and clean up well. The big size makes cleanup less messy.
There’s no fragrance and therefore does not irritate my baby’s skin. The texture is soft and gentle. I’m liking this brand more and more ! I have used both the charcoal and the normal one. I prefer the charcoal wipes, but they are equally great in how they clean and for sensitive skin. The charcoal just keeps the smells better contained. I would use either of them again! I love dyper wipes.

reviews.title: Strong and durable wipes

reviews.review: My son has sensitive skin and this worked very well with his skin. The wipes cleaned his bottom well just like other 99% water wipe brands. The wipes are durable and don't rip (unless you deliberately yank on it real hard). They smelled like a clean scent, but also a little bit like an alcohol wipe. You can only smell if you put your nose right up to it so it's not a big deal.

reviews.name: Sha
reviews.title: Get these!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2023
reviews.review: The wipes are very durable and strong. They are unscented but even unscented things have a smell to me and the “scent” on these is not strong or chemical smelling. The packs are a great size to fit into wipe carriers, warmers, or just to take by themselves. The opening in the package has a great seal that seems it will last through the use of the product. Great ingredients and environmentally friendly are bonuses.

reviews.name: Teknologik
reviews.title: Great wipes! Very durable!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.review: These are great wipes! I love it because it doesn't have those crazy additives that baby wipes have now a days such as perfumes and such which can be harmful to a child. These wipes are pretty big themselves and rugged if that makes sense. Won't rip in your hand or anything while using. Remember these are not flushable!! Trash them! Great wipes! 5/5!

reviews.title: Got for a baby shower

reviews.name: $earching 4 deals
reviews.title: Plant based, hypoallergenic, plastic free,….awesome combo for baby wipes.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023
reviews.review: These DYPER Newborn Baby Wipes | 99.9% Water Wipes | 100% Plant-Based came in a box with 4 packs inside. Each pack has 56 wipes that are made with a plant based plastic free fiber while being hypoallergenic and free from alcohol, parabens, and fragrance. The wipes are strong and durable yet safe to use on delicate baby skin. This large bundle of wipes would make a great shower gift along with some Dypers diapers. Or you could divide the packs up into smaller gifts with other needed baby items.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2023
reviews.review: I am pleased with these wipes. No unnecessary chemicals for fragrance, sturdy suitably sized cloths, in a durable resealable package. Work great for sensitive baby bottoms, and for older kids grimy sticky faces and hands too!

reviews.name: K. Chan
reviews.title: Excellent Wipes, Gentle on the Skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.review: The Dyper Newborn Baby Wipes are a great set of wipes to have in your diaper bag or change table to get your little ones clean and comfortable. The wipes are durable, have enough moisture to clean skin without soaking it, and are gentle on the skin. Although they are listed as "unscented", there is still a very mild scent to them but is definitely nothing that would be irritating. The packs are easy to open and they close securely when not in use, and they are small enough to easily stow in a diaper bag or purse without adding a lot of weight. These are good-quality wipes that are gentle on the skin and something I would purchase again.

The wipes are a good size, come in resealable packages, and are great for packing in diaper bags, makeup bags, and to keep wherever you might need them. Great wipes from a great brand. Highly recommended!

reviews.name: Kimreviewerfuntime
reviews.title: Very good wipes!!!! You don’t need four for one cleaning.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023
reviews.review:
The best thing about these wipes is that they are over 99% water only! This is an absolute must for delicate baby skin. Wipes that are made with this much water (most are not) are the very best for avoiding diaper rash.
The scent of this is minimal. They are not overly sopping wet which I like. The wipe is very strong unlike even leading brand names! These don’t rip like others do! The size is very good and offers a complete wipe and then you can use less wipes that other competitor brands. For dirty diaper changes I find that I use four wipes when using competitors brands. I used two of these wipes for the same dirty diaper changes!
I also like how the packaging has a good closure which keeps the wipes fresh and moist!

reviews.name: Amazon_customer_k
reviews.title: Decent wipes.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2023
reviews.review: We typically don’t use disposable wipes or diapers but I’m pregnant and tired so I grabbed these to knock off some diaper laundry. Normally anything like this breaks my son out in rashes but these did not which show to me that they’re actually gentle on the skin. That’s a win in my book. However, I do feel like they’re a bit expensive but if I were a strictly disposable user, I would pay it since I know they don’t cause issues. They’re decent as far as durability. They’re a bit thinner than I like but they’re not as thin as others at Walmart that we have tried.

reviews.name: nini
reviews.title: recommend

These wipes also don't have any smell, which is good because some babies don't like smells. And they are made without plastic, which is better for the environment.
The wipes are soft and strong, and they clean baby's skin well. But they can dry out quickly if you don't close the package tightly after using.

reviews.name: JT
reviews.title: Baby Wipes W/ Charcoal
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2024
reviews.review: This set of baby wipes arrived quickly and well packaged. There are 4 resealable packs that come inside a clearly labeled product packaging box. Each of the packs contain 56 XL wipes, giving you a grand total of 224 wipes. The wipes are made of bamboo and enhanced with charcoal making them great for sensitive skin. The wipes are good sized and surprisingly, they are black! I’m not sure if the color is a positive or a negative just because it makes it hard to identify anything on the wipes especially if your tracking changes in bowel habits and such. The wipes have a great texture making them ideal for cleaning delicate skin, yet they are plenty soft enough that they wont cause irritation. The charcoal can be identified by smell and not everyone will like that because these are deemed “unscented” and most prefer fragrance free wipes to smell as neutral as possible. These did not cause any irritation or reactions on sensitive skin or private parts when using to clean up. They hold up very well so you don’t have to worry about them shedding or tearing while wiping. They do seem to dry out a little quicker once opened than other wipes, even the normal version of this brand but you can add a small amount of water to keep them moist. The price point for the set is comparable to other hypoallergenic baby wipe sets. Overall this is a cool looking durable and soft baby wipe that does well on sensitive skin but the color makes it a bit hard to identify things if you need to monitor your child’s bowel habits. Would recommend.

reviews.name: Catus
reviews.title: Charcoal Baby Wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.review: Never seen a black baby wipe before this one, and I'm skeptical on how much adding charcoal actually benefits it, I actually kind of like the color change. Wipes themselves are nice on the skin, they're not overly "wet" feeling but still has great moisture to the skin with each swipe, while still being soft and gentle. I do like that it's made with plant materials, with nothing harsh like added scents. Seem to be slightly thicker then other wipes as well. Only thing I don't like about them is the packaging. It's difficult to pull just 1 wipe out of the package, they seem to want to come out in pairs.

reviews.name: gadgetlady
reviews.title: Black wipes?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.review:
I did not expect these wipes to be black. I mean, I guess it makes sense because they have charcoal in them, but still - wiping a baby's bottom with a black wipe is just weird. You can't see any color on it like you can with the white ones, to see if everything has been removed. I have always said "wipe until it comes away clean" but you can't do that if you can't see colors. Big chunks are obvious, of course, but it's the residue that's harder to see.

Other than the color, I do like the quality, texture, and of course the products used to make them. SO just as long as people know what they're getting (a black wipe), these will work fine.

reviews.name: Emilie
reviews.title: I like these briefs style more than "normal" diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2022
reviews.review:
I like these training pants / briefs style of diapers. We're actually not using these as potty training pants yet and have just been using it as a normal diaper. I really like these! My little one knows to lift his legs up now when I tell him we're putting pants on, and he did the same for me with these. These diapers are soft and plush. This definitely feels better than some of the other cheap, plastic-y type of diapers. These definitely have a good amount of stuffing, and is way better than some of the drugstore brands I purchased - talk about paper thin on those diapers! I'm not trying to compare these with the "cheap" brands, just pointing out the obvious physical difference in the material and stuffing. All that said, the softness does not matter all that much though, as long as the overall quality is good - and these are.

At first I got these 2T-3T thinking I would save them for when my baby is ready for this size. He is still wearing 12M clothes and I believe we're still using size 4 or 5 diapers! I was surprised when I opened these and they look to be about my son's size. When I put these on him I was surprised that this fits. It does have the stretchy band, so it can stretch quite a bit. I can't say if these run big or small but it seems like most people are saying it runs big, so I am very pleasantly surprised my little one can wear these already. Although these are pretty "clean", they do have a bit of a smell to it. I recommend to take these out of the packaging and let it air out for a little bit. Once you let it air out it is fine. We usually take out all the diapers from its packaging and dump it inside a box, regardless of brand. I like to mix and match different ones on a daily basis.

I appreciate the indicator line on these, and that is the one thing about diapers that are non negotiable for me. That's a feature I need to have on my diapers as I often rely on that line. There is a the Dyper giraffe logo on the front, which makes it easier for you to tell which is the front and back. The diapers looks very simple, clean, and straightforward.

These diapers are advertised as plant based and eco friendly but I didn't see any information about how well these disintegrate in the landfill. I don't know if these do or if they just sit in the landfill for decades. I wish they provided more information from an eco conscious perspective, as that would have been something that would make me support this particular brand of diapers and make these diapers stand out from its competitors.

Overall I would say give these DYPER(s) a try. Diapers seem to be a personal thing that works differently for every baby, this might just be your new favorite. The diapers seem pretty "clean" and if that type of thing is important to you, definitely check this brand out.

Last thing I'll add is I would like to urge the company to hi-light the eco aspect of these, as that will be one of the things that will help you stand out from major big name brands. As of now, all I know is these are made from bamboo, but I'm not being convinced as to why I should make the switch to this material over some of the other "clean", plant based materials.

reviews.name: UCSDsoccer
reviews.title: Better than you expect in every way
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2022
reviews.review:
Absolutely love these training pants! Our toddler has just started potty training, so this is new territory to us... but these have been awesome so far. She is able to take them off and pull them back up by herself with ease - and they are still nice and snug without leaking. I've read about bamboo vicose before, but this is the first time actually getting something made from this. I was skeptical because my initial, unlearned opinion was that bamboo cannot become something soft?! However these are actually more soft and plush than our usual diapers! It is super absorbent and comfy.
SIZING
Our LO was wearing size 4T diapers and I was worried these might be too small. However, when I lay them flat on top of each other, these Dypers are actually about 1/2" wider and 1" longer than the 4T diapers. So these are great if you usually use 4T, but may be too big if you normally buy 3T.

reviews.name: asterisk
reviews.title: Stretchy, comfortable waist. Very soft
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2022
reviews.review:
These training pants have a very stretchy and comfortable waistband. It fits snugly, and moves with baby. It stretches out easily to go on or off. It fits well for the size, and feels just a tad bigger than other brands. The material is very soft, both inside and outside. It absorbs well for daytime accidents..

The wetness indicator is on both the front and back. So I couldn't figure out at first, which side was which. The giraffe goes on the front - it's printed small on the package. I wish they had just printed the word "back" on the back like other brands.

I love that this brand doesn't use chlorine, fragrances, or other toxins.

reviews.title: Thick training pants
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2022
reviews.review:
These are very absorbent and soft training pants. They are also fairly thick. They don’t feel cheap and thin like some store brand ones I have tried. My daughter said they made her sweaty but I’m not sure if she just isn’t used to them. They are plain in style so I think that can be good and bad. My daughter does seem to be motivated by the characters or print ones. But a basic plain white like this is gender neutral and crisp looking. They have the wetness indicator on them. Also most of the printed training pants are pretty obvious for front versus back. These have a subtle mark so I had to show my daughter which was which as she likes to put them on herself. It took some practice. Size wise, I went by weight versus age and actually went up a size so they wouldn’t be too tight or binding. That worked out fine for us.

I appreciate the fact they are made without the chemicals. They have caused no irritation and have been gentle on her skin while being absorbent when needed.

Pleased with these overall and I would buy them again.

reviews.name: Nicocallie
reviews.title: Great For My Daughter With Super Sensitive Skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2022
reviews.review: My 3 year old is in the middle of potty training and she has really sensitive skin. I have tried lots of diapers over the last couple years. I knew I was going to have a struggle finding her training pants that would work for her. I had tried Dyper's diapers and they worked for her so I was hoping the training pants would too. I know the price on these is really high but I hate seeing her suffer so I am willing to pay what I need to, to ensure she doesn't get a rash. These training pants are great. She never gets a rash with them. They are very soft. She can easily pull them up and down on her own. She still has trouble telling the front from the back but that isn't a big deal. I love that they are using bamboo as the resource. Overall I do wish they were slightly cheaper but you get what you pay for and these are great.

reviews.name: Trelakopela
reviews.title: I like this brand for my son
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2022
reviews.review:
Hopefully he’s digging these too. No real fuss when wearing. Both diapers are by Dyper. One training pant and the other is basic diaper. I was stumped with the training diaper as I really didn’t know which side was the back or front - but does it really matter in the end.!? According to the package it’s giraffe yellow side to the front.
Good absorption. Holds quite a bit for descent about of hours.
I got these in size 3t 4t & 4t-5T & so far the 3r-4t seem pretty ideal since they run a little big. He’s prob like 25-26lbs 31”-32” inches long.

reviews.name: Zü
reviews.title: nice
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2022
reviews.review:
DYPER Bamboo Toddler Potty Training Pants are super soft and absorbent. There's no tape or tabs, but the sides are stretchy and would allow your toddler to move around freely. There's no harsh dyes, bleach, scents or other chemicals, and no brightly colored graphics - the pants are white with a giraffe on the front.
We are almost done with potty training, so are only using these for long car trips or overnight, and haven't had any problems - no leaks, blowouts or irritation.
These are a bit pricy, but are a good choice for eco-conscious mama.

reviews.name: Denise
reviews.title: Good pull-up but pricey

reviews.review: I have tried various training pants on the market. We currently use a named brand pull up and was pleasantly surprised by the dyper version that is very similar, just as soft with a stretchy seamless band and as absorbent. Happy to switch to Dyper from now on. They do run a little big, see comparison of pull up and dyper.

The absorbency is great during the day. Never leaked so far. It is also a lot softer than many other similar products, especially on the waist. My LO moves comfortably while wearing this. Highly recommended!

reviews.name: FSUmommy
reviews.title: Soooo soft!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2022
reviews.review:
I absolutely love these training pants by Dyper. I was concerned about the level of absorbency since a lot of the “clean” brands just don’t make the cut (as much as I try and make them work). These pull ups actually do work well and I’m happy to report we’ve had no leaks middle of the night. These also get a 10/10 for softness- they are literally the softest training pants I’ve ever purchased and my son said they are comfortable. We have a little diaper rash now and I feel good about him wearing these versus some with chemicals.

Overall highly recommend. We went with 2T-3T for my 25 lb 3 year old and it’s a perfect fit!

reviews.name: 🌟Shemira🌙☀️

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2022

They are very soft and fits well. No are not leaking. Both front and back were well designed with thick and soft cotton for better absorbing. These honestly are very nice pull-ups but they are pricey.
My son has quite of sensitive skin type, and this pull up not causing any discomfort or redness.

reviews.name: ga9
reviews.title: super impressed!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2022
reviews.review:
We snagged a box of these bamboo training underpants as part of the Amazon Vine review program. I normally wouldn't pay nearly $100 for diapers or pull-ups, but the price is right when they're free.

I really wasn't expecting much at all. I figured these would be an overpriced junk quality pull-up made to be overpriced because they're made of "bamboo."

I was wrong.

The quality and absorbency is far superior to any other diaper or pull-up we have tried before. Yes, this training underpants has BETTER absorbency than an actual diaper. For a point of reference, our 3 year old usually uses Huggies diapers and pull-ups. These are way better than those. This box lasted us far longer than a box of regular diapers or pull-ups last us. And our son started calling these his "giraffe undies" versus the other pull-ups which he thinks are still diapers.

Now, am I going to go and spend $100 on another box of them? Yeah, I actually am.

reviews.name: @@@Bruins@@@
reviews.title: good potty training pants
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2022
reviews.review: These are soft and snug, and the long elastic-like material on the side has a good grip but doesn't bother my child at all. These training pants are made from plants and are environmentally friendly. They claim to be made of 100% bamboo vicose. They are non-toxic and do not contain chlorine, latex, alcohol, perfumes, PVC, lotions, TBT, parabens, sulfates, or phthalates. To protect the next generation, they are unprinted, unscented, hypoallergenic, and cruelty-free. There is a small giraffe on the pull up. That will be sewn onto the front of the training pants.

I have used their regular diapers and now that we are potty training these pull ups make it so easy for my toddler to pull them down to use the potty and they can even pull them back up, great practice for real underwear. They also are perfect for an on the go toddler that refuses to lay down for a diaper change, you can change them standing up!! These are a little more pricey the other options but their great for the Earth and hold so much liquid so you don't have to chang them as often so I believe they are 100% worth the extra money.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2022

If you care about the perfect fit, get one size smaller, but if oversized diapers don't bother you, then this will be fine. The larger diaper allows it to contain blowouts better and absorb more liquid. These training briefs are perfect on the go and when you start potty training. Best of all, these will leave your baby's butt dry. Like other diapers, there's no front or back indicator for these. At least, they include the blue wet line indicator.

reviews.title: Good fit, some shedding
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2023

reviews.name: Susanna D’Addazio
reviews.title: Dyper's Training Pants Fall Apart
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2025
reviews.review:
Dyper's training pants fall apart at the waistband, leaving a hole right in front. I have tried my two-year-old son in these for a few weeks now, and they come apart after only a couple hours of use. It has happened about a dozen times.

I did reach out to customer service via email, but received no reply.

To be fair the diapers work well, it's just the training pants that are unreliable.

reviews.name: Antonio
reviews.title: You can find better
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2025
reviews.review: I think they were too expensive for the actual quality of the product. You can definitely find a better quality for cheaper

reviews.name: Jacob Litton
reviews.title: Beads everywhere.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2024
reviews.review: I had three diapers explode and release the chemical beads all over my toddler after only a few hours of her sleeping. It’s a very unsafe design. I was under the impression that this brand didn’t use the beads, but sadly I was wrong. Regardless, they should be able to last more than a few hours.

reviews.name: Raphael Coloma
reviews.title: Nice material but way too narrow
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2023
reviews.review: I've been a fan of Dyper's diapers for babies but these bamboo briefs did not work out. I had seen other reviews saying they were too narrow and figured it'd be perfect for my extra skinny toddler. But I was wrong! Now the material is fine, similar feel to their diapers but the kiddo does not want to wear them because they always slip into the butt crack and end up being very uncomfortable. I tried hooking my finger in the gussets to make sure they are on the outer butt cheeks but it did not work out. Cannot buy again until they redesign the width in the bottom and crotch area. (Waist sizing is fine, stretch is nice. Absorbance worked for overnight!)

reviews.name: Joanie Sala
reviews.title: Toddler Peed Through Diaper in 5 minutes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2023
reviews.review: I’m so disappointed because I really wanted to like these but I was using them for overnights with my potty training toddler and every morning he woke up with pajamas that smelled like pee. I decided to stop using them overnight and just used them for temporary use during the day when he briefly wears training pants to go #2. Within 5 minutes he had peed through the diaper. This has never happened with any other brand. I literally found a puddle on the floor beneath him.

reviews.name: Lissette
reviews.title: Great quality but leak at night
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2023
reviews.review: I was so excited about the quality and performance through the day. However, today in the morning when I was taking out the sleepsack from my toddler I noticed he was wet, hasnt happened in a long long time, exactly just now that I changed from Pampers 360 cruisers to these ones. I’m going to try Coterie now….

reviews.name: Cristina Cascaval
reviews.title: The quality is very Good But first try was failed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2023
reviews.review: My baby wore during the nap and woke up with his wet cloth😞 2 star just to soft quality

reviews.name: Jennifer Kaup
reviews.title: Fibers could have caused us a big problem
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2022
reviews.review: I wanted to like these pull on training diapers so much, but they definitely didn't work for us. My 3 yo is a 5T and working on potty training. Automatically, we didn't like the fit. They were like a sumo diaper fit, riding up on the sides and his butt. This made it really easy for leaks to occur. BUT our biggest concern was that there were fibers that shed, and we found them around the head of his ____. They were wrapped around and needed to be carefully removed as he complained that his ____ hurt. Thank goodness that we found it when we did because that could have become much worse. Especially for the price, I would not recommend these at all.

reviews.name: Somalia
reviews.title: The a little heavy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.review: The are not light and seem really thick for potty training

reviews.name: Henderson78
reviews.title: Ok for naps, leaks overnight
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2024
reviews.review: I quite liked these at first, no smell and safer for my little one/the environment. However, we quickly discovered they are not up to the output my little guy has to offer. We have had quite a few leaks/wet beds. Using up what we have for nap time. Do not recommend.

reviews.name: Ben
reviews.title: Leaks for almost every nap and nighttime
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2022
reviews.review: We used Dyper brand diapers for our 2 year old son when he was a baby up until we potty trained him a few weeks ago. While we generally loved the diapers and found them to be absorbent enough for most occasions (usually had to use a more absorbent night diaper as he got older unfortunately), these training pants have been a huge disappointment. We only use them for naps and nights, but our son has woken up wet almost every day. They don't even seem to cut it for his 1 hr naps--often the front will have absorbed some liquid while the back will be totally dry (our son is a stomach sleeper). It seems like the absorbent pad does not soak up or redistribute liquid while the stretch material surrounding it does nothing to contain the mess. Luckily we haven't had any poop in these yet but I can't imagine them doing anything to contain the mess. Agree with other reviewers that these seem more like a maxi pad with stretchy diaper material surrounding it. I thought these would perform better being a training pant specifically designed for older children but I guess we should have known better given the high failure rate of Dyper's regular diapers for overnight use as our son got older.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Elastic lining bunches up
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.review: These are awful. I don’t know how a manufacturer messes up this bad on a basic design… But the inner elastic linings aren’t spaced out far enough, and within a few minutes of wearing the pull up and walking around in it, they bunch together and create the worst toddler wedgie ever. My daughter hates them and is visibly annoyed when she wears these. I’ve never seen a pull up do this. On any other brand, the elastic lining on either side of the main pad always is spaced out enough that it sits on the buttcheeks, NOT wadded up right in the crotch. I don’t know how it would even catch any poop with how bad the lining bunches up on these. Terrible awful bad. Especially for a low tox expensive product. They really need to fix it.

reviews.name: Bfree
reviews.title: The worst pull up ever!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2024
reviews.review: They soak all the way through. Even the outside of the pull up is soaked. They are like a thick pair of underwear they don’t protect or hold the potty in. Woke up several nights completely soaked, clothes, bedding everything! These are literally the worst!!! What a joke!! Parents do not buy these!

reviews.name: lesa
reviews.title: WAY TOO BIG
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.review: these things were MASSIVE and way off in sizing. They were completely unusable. I went by the weight just like I have for other brands and they was practically falling off. I was really disappointed because I bought them right before a roadtrip and had to make an emergency stop elsewhere to get a different brand. Do yourself a favor and skip these.

reviews.name: Glenda
reviews.title: RASH
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2024
reviews.review: I usually use Pampers never once had a rash before but my boyfriend has been wanting our daughter to use better quality organic bamboo diapers and first time using these and they gave her a horrible rash.

reviews.name: amcamc
reviews.title: LEAKS
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2024
reviews.review: I have used these for over 3 months every night. Each time they were full, they leaked. The outside of the pull-up was wet which wet the pajamas, sheets and blanket. I just thought my son had peed a lot, but I tried another brand (Bamboo Dreams) yesterday, same amount of pee, but no leaking whatsoever.

reviews.name: Stephanie
reviews.title: Expensive, leaky diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2023
reviews.review: My kid has incredibly sensitive skin so this is one of the only brands he can tolerate. Unfortunately they have a major issue and it seems like 1 in 3 diapers leaks completely through soaking my son (and anyone who may be holding him) entirely. I’m on vacation now and having to carry multiple pairs of backup shorts around for the next accident. Isn’t the first time and when I contact customer service I get the run around. Don’t waste your money.

reviews.name: Norland20
reviews.title: NOT for Sensitive Skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2022
reviews.review: I had high hopes for these but I was disappointed. My son has sensitive skin and mild eczema and these caused him to tear his skin apart from all the scratching near the diaper area. I even ordered directly from the website just in case I received a bad batch from Amazon, but it was the same result. So much so that I accidentally left one in the bottom of the diaper bag and a month later his grandmother used it and couldn’t figure out why he was scratching so much. Sadly, these were the culprit.

reviews.name: Roxanne Saunders
reviews.title: Awful!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2023
reviews.review:
These diapers are awful! They leak so bad just after one pee! And even after taken off to change my son is soaked in his own urine. They rip around the diaper so my daughter and son is waking up with the diaper half off.
I WILL NEVER BYE AGAIN!

reviews.name: Hailey Lampa
reviews.title: Leaked
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2023
reviews.review: My son wears a size 4 in pampers 360. I tried using the 3t ones but they leaked every time for a week straight. Was so disappointed. Love how soft they are but I couldn’t get them to hold overnight.

reviews.name: Stephanie Jeannett

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2024
reviews.review: Love these wipes. Big and strong and soft on baby. Fit perfectly in my small crossbody diaper bag.

reviews.name: JT
reviews.title: Great XL Wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
reviews.review: This pack of wipes arrived in a timely manner. The product packaging was beat up since it was shipped in a bag instead of a box, but all packs were present and there was no issue with damage to the individual packs from shipping. The set includes 6 travel sized packs, each containing 16 XL wipes. The wipes are notably larger than most others making them ideal for cleaning up bigger messes. These remind me of many other plant and water based wipes that we have tried. These unscented and work well on sensitive skin. The wipes are soft and durable making it easy to clean up you or your child without the wipe falling apart. The price point for the quantity of wipes that you get is on the high end but these are larger than the average wipe and they come in travel sized packs so the value is there for the right person and circumstances. Overall, these are nice wipes that work well for sensitive skin and leave you feeling clean. Would recommend.

reviews.name: Kimreviewerfuntime
reviews.title: 99% water...........helps so much with diaper rash!!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.review:
This grandma is SOLD on these wipes!!! I've already ordered more!
What I like so much is that these wipes help with diaper rash! The fact that they are 99% water is the key to keeping rashes away and to healing rashes.
This particular wipe from this company is HUGE! When they say Extra Large...they really are. You can almost only use one wipe even for dirty diaper changes! These are excellent quality and tough! No fingers busting through the wipe when doing the diaper change.
The package has a strong, sticky, re-sealer so the wipes don't dry out.
I highly suggest and recommend this brand of wipes! I am really happy with them. Likely best baby wipe that I've ever used!

reviews.name: Customer Review
reviews.title: HUGE wipes!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.review: Loved these unscented and textured wipes. The bags are slim which are perfect for on the go, and the wipes are large sized which helps clean faster and with less wipes. I like the sticky tab to close the wipes, feels very sturdy and resistant. High quality overall, am very happy with this pack.

reviews.name: My Honest Review
reviews.title: extra large wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2023
reviews.review: ordered these to have in the car to wipe off the kids faces and hands after they get all dirty from some fun outdoor play. these wipes are an easy addition to our vehicles and have been working out great so far! they are strong enough to remove dirty or sticky messes from little fingers and durable enough for adults too. my little ones have sensitive skin and we havent had any issues with these wipes. i do like the texture of them which is different than traditional baby wipes and they dont have that same distinct scent either so the little ones arent as fiesty when having their faces cleaned with these wipes. i would recommend!

reviews.name: firecat13
reviews.title: Glad They Are Unscented
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
reviews.review: These wipes are nicely sized, and I appreciate that they are unscented. These are great for on-the-go. So handy for wiping face and hands before (and after) eating out, especially where’s there’s no water handy like picnics or ball games. I like that they only have 16 in a pouch, not as many get dried out if they aren’t used on a regular basis. I’m sure they’d work just fine for tushies too, I’m just blessed that almost of all my littles are past that stage.

reviews.name: Sha

reviews.review: I never would have thought of needing a slightly larger wipe for my older kids but here I am using these and loving the size! One wipe takes care of it all. Definitely recommend!

reviews.review: Wow these wipes are huge. Almost 2x normal size wipes. They’re very thick and soft. The travel sized packs are perfect for me to keep in the car or in my purse and the reseal on the pack is really good and strong so they won’t dry out. They are pretty expensive compared to other similar wipes.

reviews.name: AlpacaPenguin

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.review: Sometimes you just need a larger wipe. Whenever your child has a “blow-out” diaper these XL DYPER Plant Based Wipes really come in handy. The package may not seal back up very well so we store them in a ziploc bag just to make certain they don’t dry out between uses.

reviews.name: Erik
reviews.title: Yas!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023
reviews.review: Love that these wipes come in these small packs, makes it easy to keep in the car. Also love that it has minimal ingredients and of course the large size!

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.title: Very large wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023
reviews.review: These wipes are great for cleaning big messes. I always fold the wipes to get better control and these allow me more folds while cleaning up any mess. Perfect for those unique situations when you really just need a larger wipe.

reviews.name: L
reviews.title: Huge, thick and pretty moist
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
reviews.review: If you like me and have little kids, wipe’s becomes a must have item to clean up everything everywhere every day! This is awesome, these wipes double the size of regular wipes, thick, moist and perfect for pick up and clean up mess. Makes sure to seal it tightly however just so they don’t dry out too fast, but really it perfect to throw in the car, purse, diaper bag etc etc because you know messes are coming and this wipes big and tough enough for any job. Cleaning up apple sauce was a breeze today, from face to car seat, just used 2 wipes. They are great quality, durable and fits perfectly everywhere!

reviews.name: ThePlainOldT
reviews.title: Great for cleaning up more than just dirty baby bums!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023
reviews.review:
These DYPER Plant Based Extra Large Wipes For Toddlers and Babies are great for cleaning up more than just dirty baby bums. They are quite a bit larger than regular baby wipes, so they are wonderful for cleaning up spaghetti and birthday cake faces, necks, and arms, as well as those major blowouts that are always so much fun. 
The wipes are soft, gentle, and do not cause stinging or irritation. They are not only great for baby needs but are helpful for adult needs as well. They come in secure resealable packages, are travel friendly, are made by a great brand, and would make a nice addition to a shower gift basket. Highly recommended!

reviews.name: Michelle’s

reviews.name: kate b.
reviews.title: SO soft, size down if stuck between two
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2023
reviews.review:
I absolutely love these diapers, but I’ve found my daughter falls between sizes 3 and 4 weighing 24lbs. She is long and tall. The size 3 is a very snug fit, but works fantastic. Size 4 seems to fit better with a little room to spare, but then they leak from the thighs.. esp poops which is NO fun. And I make sure to always pull the safe guards out.

I also love how these diapers don’t get wet on the outside like Huggies and I truly feel I need to change her less with these over Huggies because they’re more absorbent, so I go through less!

reviews.name: Charis Katharos
reviews.title: Absorbent!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2022
reviews.review:

These are sooo good! They’re super absorbent & hold everything in exceptionally well so that we had no blowouts (yay!). They’re also very thin when folded (a novelty for me after using bulkier cloth) & so soft.

Planning a month long trip to the UK & will definitely be using these again.

So far they've been worth it for us, given the economy I don't know how long we can afford the extra cost though.

reviews.name: Emilie
reviews.title: great diapers, seem very "clean", more information needed to make the permanent switch
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2022
reviews.review:
These diapers are soft, yes, but not super soft in a memorable way. They definitely feel better than some of the other cheap, plastic-y type of diapers but I wouldn't say it is the softest diapers I've felt. The inside of the diapers do feel a little softer than the outside. The softness does not matter all that much though, as long as the overall quality is good.

Sizing wise these fit about the same as other popular brands. We're currently on size 3 (sometimes 4), and these fit about the same with no issues about it being too tight or loose. The closure works great and seems comfortable on baby.

I appreciate the indicator line on these, and that is the one thing about diapers that are non negotiable for me. That's a feature I need to have on my diapers as I often rely on that line. These diapers have no cute cartoon or graphics on them, which is fine, as that is one less chemical to worry about. The diapers just look very simple, clean, and straightforward.

Our little one doesn't have blowouts too often as we're mostly at home and we change him as frequently as needed. We rarely have to change him in the middle of the night or wake up to him soaked in his crib come morning. That said, we did experience 2-3 wet diaper leaks. One was during the day and two was at night, so I will not be using these for night time use anymore. Overall these work well in the day time though, and it isn't anything to where I'd say to avoid these or for me to never use this brand again. He could have just had too much water/milk that day, more than usual, so until I test this out throughout a longer period of time, I won't fully blame the quality of the diapers.

These diapers are advertised as plant based and eco friendly but I didn't see any information about how well these disintegrate in the landfill. I don't know if these do or if they just sit in the landfill for decades. I wish they provided more information from an eco conscious perspective, as that would have been something that would make me support this particular brand of diapers and make these diapers stand out from its competitors.

Overall I would say give these DYPER(s) a try. Diapers seem to be a personal thing that works differently for every baby, this might just be your new favorite. The diapers seem pretty "clean" and if that type of thing is important to you, definitely check this brand out.

Last thing I'll add is I would like to urge the company to hi-light the eco aspect of these, as that will be one of the things that will help you stand out from major big name brands. As of now, all I know is these are made from bamboo, but I'm not being convinced as to why I should make the switch to this material over some of the other "clean", plant based materials.

reviews.name: K. Chan
reviews.title: Excellent Quality Diapers, Runs a Bit Large - Ecofriendly Diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2022
reviews.review:
The DYPER Bamboo Baby Diapers are excellent diapers that are free of chlorine, latex, alcohol, lotions, TBT, or Phthalates. The diapers are unprinted, unscented, feel soft, and are durable enough to hold in large amounts of your kid's outputs. The diapers fit snugly, wicks moisture away well, and didn't irritate my nephew's skin. They are on par with other well-known brand-name diapers, and the nephew had no issues with leaks or blow-outs. The only real issue that we had with the diapers is that they do run larger than other diapers. This isn't a huge issue given that diaper sizes vary from baby to baby and because we could use the diapers on my nephew at a later time.

The thing that makes these diapers unique is that they are made with very eco-friendly materials. The diapers are made of bamboo and are packed in bags made with oxo-degradable materials. There is a service called Redyper where you can send back the used diapers via mail, or via local pick up so that the diapers and their contents can be composted. My niece didn't look up to try this service for her kid, but rested a little easier knowing that the diapers would at least compost down. Overall, as far as diapers go, this is an excellent quality diaper that is safe for your baby's skin and ensures your baby will be dry throughout the night.

reviews.name: G. Hearn
reviews.title: Just like "traditional" diapers.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2022
reviews.review:
I had my doubts about these diapers at first. But in the end, they actually work just as well as “traditional” diapers.

“Bamboo” has become a very popular catchphrase these days when it comes to bedding… Clothing… And now even diapers. The material that is made from bamboo is rayon. But you have to look at it this way… Sheets of paper that you write on… Use in your printer and copy machines… And so on is made from trees. But it takes a lot of working and chemical processing to go from a tree to a piece of paper. The same applies with bamboo. It takes a lot of work and chemical processing. I think you really have to do your own investigating to find out what you think about it. But in the end, I would rather use a renewable source such as bamboo, which grows quickly, rather than cutting down the Amazon rain forest.

reviews.name: K K OBrien
reviews.title: Our favorite diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2023
reviews.review:
Dyper has absolutely figured out the diaper game and should win any round of comparison to other diapers!

I'll start simply with the aesthetic in that I love that they are all white as they do not show through clothing and just overall look classic and so nice.

Now for the important part - these diapers WORK SO WELL and absorb SO MUCH. The quality of the materials and design of the diaper fit is better than anything else we have tried. The feel soft and luxurious to the touch, no rough edges or areas. They are easily adjustable to fit your little one and wear great throughout the day (even with a very mobile and wiggly little one).

I have a one year old that is in a size 3 or 4 and we just love them so much that I ordered a box of newborn size to gift to a friend giving birth soon because I just knew her family would fall in love with them too. However, this item shipped a size 3 which we were able to put to use and I just had to order more for the baby gift :) But heads up - it seems as though there may have been a mixup in the shipping warehouse so make sure you order lots and with plenty of backups on hand instead of waiting til the last minute for a restock.

reviews.name: Webb
reviews.title: More sustainable and soft
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2022
reviews.review:
We really like these diapers. The fact that they are made from bamboo is really great. They are slightly on the more expensive side but we are happy to pay a little more. They seem to be compostable but I'm not sure how that would work with our curbside composting. For now, we'll just be happy to be putting less plastic and chemicals in the landfill.

The diapers seem to be a bit on the larger side but they also seem to be designed to cover a bit higher than some other brands. The extra protection is welcome and it is nice to know we have a little more flexibility about when to go to the next size up. They also seem to work fine with the top of the front folded down in a pinch. The fact that they are slightly larger is actually an advantage since they can stay in a smaller size longer which includes more diapers in the pack for the same price.

My only small complaint is that the inner packages aren't labeled clearly with the size. It is marked in fine print on the edge but having opened multiple to see what the best sizes were it would be handy if they were more clearly marked.

Overall very happy with the "DYPER Bamboo Baby Diapers | Natural Honest Ingredients | Cloth Alternative | Day & Overnight | Plant-Based + Eco-Friendly | Hypoallergenic for Sensitive Newborn Skin | Unscented".

reviews.name: Stucco
reviews.title: No leaks, pricier than most alternatives, also didn't notice much difference for "skin sensitivity"
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2023
reviews.review:
I'm not sure what we were expecting to see or feel as a stand-out between these and big brand diapers when it came to skin sensitivity but honestly, if there's a difference we didn't really see it with our kiddo. Using these, we still saw the occasional instances of diaper rash on those rare occasions when the baby's output exceeded the diaper's absorbency (usually due to night outputs that the baby miraculously slept through). I'm not going to complain about getting a fuller night's sleep though.

These Dypers did a great job at absorbing MOST of those outputs though and the rashes, when they did occur were pretty limited in scope, meaning most of the moisture got wicked away, leaving just one or two spots or strips that needed to be powdered the next day to get rid of the rash.

These diapers fit snugly but were a little stiffer around the legs, although for 95% of the day that really didn't matter since the kiddo spends most of their time curled up in someone's arms, on someone's chest, etc. so it's not like their mobility was really impaired. Once they get a little bit bigger and more active that stiffness could become a problem though.

***Overall Value***

All-in-all, these worked as well as the Pampers we also had in rotation, the biggest difference between these and bigger brands just comes down to price per diaper, and these are definitely marked up at a premium that I'm not convinced is really warranted.

reviews.name: Rob
reviews.title: Good diapers, Work like they should but are slightly "fluffier" / bulky
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2023
reviews.review:
Build Quality:
The diapers fits well, has good elastic, is incredibly soft and has good "tape" or closure on the "flaps". There are no extra dyes or printing. A "yellow turns blue" wet strip is included.

Use:
The diapers works well and seems to be as absorbent as our other major brand choice. They work about how we expect and we are pleased to use them. They may be slightly more prone to a blow out - While using them we have noticed a few more blowouts than normal.

No Blowouts
We didn't have any blowouts or leaks. They are also constructed with leg guard which work well.

Recycling
These can be composted through a program called Redyper. There is a address checker on the manufacturer website for a pick up service. Unfortunately we aren't serviced in our area but many areas are including the bay area, Nashville, LA, NYC and Austin. The mail away service runs $149 per prepaid box.

Final thoughts,
These are good diapers that we recommend. They fit well and function well .

My toddler had to be cleaned out due to constipation and we tried Huggies, rascal and friends, and Huggies nighttime diapers. We even double diapered and it still wouldn’t hold everything and would leak everywhere. It was a mess and made us dread when he had a bowel movement. Ended up buying the DYPERs and one was able to hold everything in. No leakage no mess!

reviews.title: Exactly as described
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2023
reviews.review: Exactly as described

reviews.name: DBAGproductions
reviews.title: The best diapers we’ve tried!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2022
reviews.review:
These diapers have quickly become our favorite!
First, I love how simple they are. They are plain white, without color or pictures and I really like that. The color strip is easy to see and works well.
They are designed thoughtfully with lots if stretch to fit around baby’s curves. The tabs are strong but also gentle against baby’s skin.

Like other reviewers stated, these do run a little big. This really hasn’t been a problem. Even when using these with a 8-10lb baby, they fit well. They are able to reach higher than other diapers and this has prevented a lot of blowouts.

The absorbency is amazing! We’ve tried a lot of other “natural” diapers and didn’t have the best luck. Overnight leaking was pretty common. These completely changed that. We haven’t had any leaks since using these.

We alternate between these and cloth diapers when we’re traveling or if baby is in the care of someone else. I love that they’re a step up from other diapers in terms of sustainability and the quality of ingredients. Will definitely be sticking with these!!

reviews.name: Theresa H.
reviews.title: nice little newborn size diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2023
reviews.review:
I always tried to, when budget allowed, purchase the more eco-friendly diaper options that were available when my kiddos were little. These diapers would have checked all my boxes back then.

Currently, I use diapers in my gardening, which sounds weird, but hold on and listen for a minute. I generally line the sides of my hanging planters with them, it helps prevent the soil from drying out so quickly while sequestering some moisture but not retaining so much moisture that the plants drown. I did notice that with coconut coir hanging baskets. I would have to water at least twice a day on hot days but now that I started partially lining the basket with diapers. I can water once a day or sometimes every other day.

I did share a few with a friend who has a newborn and she was very happy to get them. Tiniest is about 6 and 1/2 lb and these diapers fit much better than the size ones they had been using.

Five stars

reviews.name: Oksana_gaevskaya
reviews.title: Soft and absorbent
