These DYPER Baby Diapers came in a cardboard box. The diaper is thin, lightweight, and absorbent. Diapers work well during the day and night.
I like that they are fragrance-free and made from plant-based materials. The diapers are soft and comfortable for my baby, and don't irritate her skin. I would recommend it to others.

reviews.name: Amazon Addict
reviews.title: These are great diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2022
reviews.review: I love these. They are so soft and don't seem to cause any irritations. The sizing is a bit off. Size 1 is supposed to start at 8 pounds, according to their recommendations, but that is ridiculous. They're more like 10 pounds or so. They are very large for an 8 pound baby. That didn't really matter much to me. I tossed these aside and waited until such time that he fit in them. There's no doubt that these are great quality. Just be aware they run a bit large.

reviews.name: M.C.
reviews.title: Very soft
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2022
reviews.review: I’m impressed with how soft these diapers are, as well as how snuggly they fit. I also appreciate the fact that they are made from eco-friendly bamboo, and are free of dyes and perfumes. I don’t need the diapers I use to be stamped with pictures and designs…white is just fine. If you’re looking for disposable diapers that are better for the environment than traditional disposables, check these out.

reviews.name: QponMomma
reviews.title: perfect for sensitive skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2022
reviews.review:
As an adult with a chronic skin condition that was caused by overuse of maxi pads (which aren't that indifferent from diapers), I'm really picky about what I'll allow to rest against my kids' skin. I have lichen sclerosis (I encourage all ladies to google it and the names of big brands it's linked to). Bamboo is about the only material that feels natural down there, and doesn't cause irritation or inflammation. So I'm naturally drawn to bamboo for baby.

This is affordable, and the company has a fun sense of humor. There's no characters or fancy images with licensing fees to pay for, or dye to seep into the diaper. There's no chemicals (except the wetness indicator). And they don't leak or rip. Theyre a win win win in every direction.

Do note that these run a little bit big. I don't think they're a full size too big, enough to order down. But they're great at night till baby fully grows into them.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2023

These DYPER Viscose from Bamboo Baby Diapers are Excellent!

reviews.title: Soft and absorbent, and great size!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2022
reviews.review: These DYPER Bamboo Baby Diapers Size 1 are our first experience with all natural diapers and they are quite soft and much more absorbent than we expected. We also like the size, as they are a bit larger, overall, than other newborn sized diapers. They are wider in the crotch, giving more "catch" coverage. They are wider, but also have a bit more height, which helps contain blow outs. They fit a normal weight newborn well, but can be used for a little longer than other brands, as they have more room for growth. You always lose the amount of diapers you get as you graduate to the next size, which is a bummer. We love these diapers and definitely recommend them!

reviews.name: Wynter Z.
reviews.title: Fits well.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2023
reviews.review: I love what they don't have in them! Plant based is amazing! They fit well, no leaks. Yes they are a bit pricey, but I feel the quality is well worth it.

reviews.name: The Unhip Housewife
reviews.title: Great company, great diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2023
reviews.review: These diapers are made just like the big name brand ones, just made from bamboo!! They are great for the environment. I enjoy doing my part to help reduce landfills and to help the environment.

reviews.name: The Indie Reviewer
reviews.title: Delyghted for Dypers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2022
reviews.review: These Dyper bamboo diapers are a unique blend of diapers that are actually eco-friendly. They tout being hypoallergenic, and can be used as day or overnight, and, as a cloth alternative, which is saying a lot for a disposable diaper. They come packaged in a paper-type of wrap (vs. a plastic bag), and the diapers themselves are simple (sans designs and colors). The diapers come with the customary wetness indicator, which is very useful and the elastic sides to prevent blowouts and create a snug fit. These are truly excellent diapers when it comes to actually being eco-friendly considering how much diapers can damage the planet as non-decomposable waste. These are costly but well worth the value.

reviews.name: Alyssa
reviews.title: Soft & Absorbent!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2022
reviews.review:
Dyper Bamboo Diapers are comfortable, absorbent and made with extremely soft bamboo viscose. The size 3 diapers come with 68 diapers total. They fit your baby comfortably and are soft and hypoallergenic. This product is made with zero chlorine, latex, alcohol, perfume, lotion, prints and phthalates. They are great for gifting, especially to new parents.

I highly recommend this product!

reviews.name: Cindy
reviews.title: Sizing Fits Great - Maybe on the Larger Side! Soft and Absorbent!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2022
reviews.review: Current price - 80 for $30.59. Plain white - no cutsie prints, but does the baby really care? Nope, everything the baby cares about is excellent - good fit, soft to the skin, no harmful ingredients and no leaks or blow-outs! Easy to use - Work great for us! 5 Stars! Hope you find this review and pictures helpful! It's hard selecting which diapers work for you or don't. I find it changes as the little gets older - they work until they don't, and then I switch! Sometimes brands - sometimes sizes. Diet plays a big part too!

reviews.name: district12girl
reviews.title: Great for my moving baby
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2022
reviews.review: My daughter is 10 months old and can currently only ware one brand of diapers (pampers) due to braking out or getting diaper rash. I didn’t expect much since we’ve tried a lot of brands but these worked great. They feel of good quality and my daughter has not gotten diaper rash from them. Love that it has the urine yellow to blue line.

reviews.name: Jam
reviews.title: No LEAKS!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2022
reviews.review: The size 3 is supposed to fit a 16 to 28 pound baby. They fit a 20 pound 1 year old fine, but they definitely are slightly on the larger side compared to other brands. And for 100% bamboo, I expected these diapers to be softer. Don’t get me wrong, they are very soft…but pretty average. I do appreciate that they are biodegradable though. With regards to absorbency, these are the real MVP with overnight blowouts. Haven’t had one leak. No irritation to report either. I also love that this big box is broken up into 4 smaller packs. I put one in the nursery, one in the family room, one in the closet, and tossed the remaining one in the car. I’m total covered wherever.

reviews.name: KHub
reviews.title: So Soft!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2022
reviews.review: These are so soft and hold up well to my very active kiddo. They also run a little bit big. Kiddo currently was wearing a size 3 in another well known brand but was on the verge of needing to go up to size 4. These size 3s fit great with additional room to grow. Kiddo has very sensitive skin and these haven't caused any reactions at all. Very happy with these!

reviews.name: Elise
reviews.title: What are blowouts???
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2022
reviews.review: I mainly chose to buy this brand after looking at all the eco friendly options and deciding I wasn’t one with no prints on it. Silly reason but I stayed with these diapers because my son is now 5 months old and he has had only TWO times that he leaked poo out of these diapers! I still cannot believe how amazing these diapers are! I tell everyone about them!

reviews.name: Jcolwell658
reviews.title: Must Have
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2022
reviews.review:
These diapers are amazing! We were using Huggies but she seemed to alwaysss have pee come out the sides especially during the night.
She hasn’t had a single blow out with these diapers. They can literally be filled to the max in the middle of the night and some now still not leak! Absolutely worth the price.

reviews.name: Emily J. Morris
reviews.title: Pricey, but very nice!

reviews.review: These may be more than many are willing to pay for diapers, but if you're looking for quality, here is quality. These have great roomy fits and the absorbency is phenomenal. I also find bamboo to be a handy option if you're worried about sensitivity.

reviews.name: KMP
reviews.title: Great diapers!

reviews.review: These are really great. I like that they’re not the typical branded diapers. They work quite well and are cheaper too. These do run really big, so keep that in mind!

reviews.title: Love a plant based diaper option.

reviews.review: This is the second order of these DYPER Viscose from Bamboo Baby Diapers. I received a size 3 instead of newborn though. That’s okay as they will still get used. These are a great plant based option made without chlorine, latex, alcohol, perfumes, PVC, lotions, TBT, parabens, sulphates, & phthalates. They are made using bamboo on the inside and outside layers which help with absorption. These diapers are also hypoallergenic and cruelty free. Great diapers that will keep leaks in the diaper and not on you.

reviews.name: Michelle
reviews.title: Never had any leaks!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2022
reviews.review: I received these as a baby shower gift and although they don’t look aesthetically pleasing they worked surprisingly well for an eco diaper! I’ve tried Pampers and Honest and I would say performance-wise these were superior. Even poop was contained well. I’ve heard they are not as eco friendly as advertised but they do hold up and I would definitely recommend.

reviews.name: Hunting Creek
reviews.title: Work very well for our six-week old
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2022
reviews.review: These diapers work very well for our six-week old baby boy. No leaks. Fit well. We've had no issues with these at all, they do exactly what they are supposed to do. Love them.

reviews.name: E&E0715
reviews.title: Great diapers.

They feel really soft, like cloth, but they're not cloth. They close with velcro, rather than with tape or the sticky tabs.
I'm very pleased with them and recommend them highly!

reviews.name: Momma Shark
reviews.title: I LOVE THESE!!! ECO FRIENDLY AND FAMILY FRIENDLY!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2022
reviews.review: These diapers are fantastic! They are soft, gentle, and clean! They are non-toxic and are free of chlorine, latex, alcohol, perfumes, PVC, lotions, TBT, parabens, sulphates, & phthalates. They are unprinted, unscented, hypoallergenic, and cruelty-free. They didn't cause any rashes on my little one who is very sensitive to EVERYTHING! They didnt have the nasty chlorine smell to them. These were simple, safe, and affordable!

reviews.name: Oceania
reviews.title: Good
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2022
reviews.review: These are not the best fit, but they don’t leak or cause irritation.

reviews.name: Ebony
reviews.title: Throughly Impressed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2022
reviews.review:
When I first saw the advertisement for Dyper on YouTube, I was skeptical. Normally, when a diaper brand boasts environmental friendliness and good-for-the-baby-butt qualities, they cost an arm and a leg. These diapers are surprisingly priced similarly to any box of diapers I can find at Wal-Mart. What really impressed me though is that my newborn had 2 should-have-been blowouts that these diapers completely locked in. The diapers themselves don't really smell like much of anything, which is great because I don't like putting scented things on my baby anyways. I don't have anything bad to say about these diapers. They do their job and they do it well, and I don't even have to feel guilty about the effects on the environment. I definitely plan on getting the subscription after we go through these newborn diapers.

Edit: Okay, now I know why everyone has leaky problems. I do too now that we need to go up a size. NB can support up to 10lbs, my baby is 9.5lbs and his diapers are now leaking. Size and weight definitely matter. Yes, these diapers appear bigger than other brands, but do NOT size down or wait for your baby to get bigger until they "appear" to git. Follow the weight recommendations as closely as possible to avoid leaking. If your NB is 9-10lbs, then you need a size 1, and so on.

reviews.name: Hope
reviews.title: Super great, sometimes there’s a few that are faulty
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2023
reviews.review: Love these diapers, hold way more the the brands I normally see in the stores. Used pampers when I ran out and my order got delayed. My son blew out so many times and soaked thru clothing, sometimes the tabs on the pampers would rip. Whilst Dyper diapers allows our son to sleep thru the night without any leaks. Sometimes there’s a few diapers that you can tell aren’t made properly as the material gets super wet, but it’s so rare we don’t mind, much better than his daily blowouts in pampers. He does randomly get blowouts in these, but it’s not daily like it was in his pampers.

reviews.name: Lizzie C.
reviews.title: Came back to buy more!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2023
reviews.review: I was gifted these at my shower and came back to buy more. I love them! I got size newborn for my 8lb baby and they fit right, with room to grow in to. I haven’t had any blowouts with them, they absorb well and don’t get soggy on the outside. They aren’t as soft as a “Millie & Moon” diaper but aren’t rough either. We tried coterie diapers and leaked out of everyone of them. These have been amazing and I’ll def keep buying! I also love there’s no scent to them.

reviews.name: sweets
reviews.title: Works overnight too!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2022

Absorbency is great. Baby floods every cloth diaper we’ve tried in a few hours so I was skeptical how the bamboo would work. These hold up overnight, with multiple nursing sessions with no leaks! Win!!

reviews.name: Devrin

reviews.review: These are the best diapers. Zero diaper rash or blow outs. Very soft and doesn't get saggy when wet. The only downside is affordability. I got these as a gift, cannot afford to buy them unfortunately. I wish all diapers had to be made of plant based materials!

reviews.name: Tavia V.
reviews.title: Perfect. Wish I had found sooner.

reviews.review: Sensitive baby bum was always getting rashes or bumps, every diaper I tried until Dyper. I'm in love lol. Soft, never had a leak, absorbent. Okeo tex 100 certified! They've got a loyal customer now.

reviews.name: Carole Balsley
reviews.title: Effective
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2023
reviews.review: Leak protection

reviews.name: Verified Purchase
reviews.title: They hold up well compared to Pampers Swaddlers, just a little less soft
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2022
reviews.review:
I've used different brands but the main ones we use for my daughter are Pampers Swaddlers. They have been our go to since day 1. In comparison, Dyper material feels a little rough on the outside. I know they are bamboo but they feel a tad paper like. And I'm so used to our soft bamboo pajamas, so I guess I was expecting something more along those lines instead. But the interior feels fine and not rough on her skin.

Both Swaddlers and Dyper have held up well absorbance-wise. No leaking for us. I have also noticed that they seem a little drier and absorb well, so it helps with potential diaper rashes as she's been prone to them lately.

Three other brands I've used are:
- Kirkland - pretty similar minus the softness that Kirkland diapers have. Also, I stopped using these because I sometimes notice a pee smell. Didn't notice that at all with Dyper.
- Huggies Overnight - these are much thicker in comparison because they are overnight. So a direct comparison is not really fair here.
- Coterie - these are defintely softer and more absorbent than Dyper brand. You can see and feel the difference in the higher quality. Much more expensive too tho. I wouldn't say that they are the best comparison but Dyper holds up fairly well next to these.

Even though I like them, they are pricier than what I pay for Swaddlers. Since I find them very similar, and I actually prefer the softness of Swaddlers, this is personally a dealbreaker for me. But if that weren't the case, I'd very easily alternate between the two.

reviews.name: Hyperiox
reviews.title: Good Diapers, Smell a Bit
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2022
reviews.review:
These diapers are true to size, and fit well. They only have the one velcro strip on each strap, unlike Huggies' double strips, but it isn't a problem yet for our son, who isn't finicking with his diaper much yet.

The diaper wicks away moisture very well from the skin, and keeps our son rash free quite well. It absorbs a lot of fluid, and we did not have any blowouts after going through about 100 diapers. For containing the mess, these are on par with the more common brands for sure.

The smell of urine does leak out much more than what we've noticed with Huggies and Kirkland brands... and these Bamboo DYPER's are quite a bit more expensive per unit... so it's hard for me to really recommend these over the competition for most babies, but if your child's skin is very sensitive to normal diapers, then definitely give these a try.

reviews.name: Zü
reviews.title: run large
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2022
reviews.review:
DYPER Bamboo Baby Diapers are super soft. They don't have any chemicals or designs on them, but they do have the wetness indicator to alert you that the diaper needs to be changed. They work well for daytime, but I still prefer Huggies for overnight as they seem to work better for us in terms of absorbency.
I am knocking off a star because these run large, and the tabs tend to unfasten themselves at times.

reviews.name: Katie
reviews.title: Super soft; wish the leg holes had more 'spring'
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2023
reviews.review:
I really like the materials that these are made out of. They are super soft, and don't stink. I also appreciate how they are just white and don't have any prints that can show through clothing or whatnot, and really are just unneeded on a diaper.

Overall, these are a pretty nice diaper, but there could be some improvements, too. I don't like that the leg elastics aren't as 'springy' as the Kirkland diapers that we were previously using. Also, the tabs don't have as large of a pad to stick.

reviews.name: Mrs. ChaCha
reviews.title: Good to start

reviews.review: These diapers are a good start, they don't absorb as well as I had hoped. They seem to be gentle on skin and a good alternative to cloth.

reviews.name: Chris C.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2023
reviews.review: This is a good option if you are looking for something more natural and safer on sensitive skin. They are constructed well, have a wetness indicator and hold a good amount of liquid. Seem to fit nicely but with any diaper your babies body type may or may not work well with it. It works well for us though!

reviews.name: Booknerd28

Has the pee line, which is super helpful.
Fit is overall decent, but I still like the way huggles little snugglers fit more (and overall cheaper).

The diapers themselves are very soft. They remind me of Millie Moon diapers if you’ve ever used that brand. These ones feel more durable to me though, which I appreciate.
The diapers felt nice and absorbent, and seem to hold a good amount of urine. My only thing, they don’t feel as dry when wet, compared to other brands I’ve used.
I do think these diapers run just slightly on the larger size.
Added bonus, their advertising is hilarious. I was having fun reading it upon arrival.

These offer great week protection even overnight and they're so soft. I would never have guessed these were made from bamboo. We will absolutely be buying more.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2023
reviews.review: I bought these because the box was from the actual company. Walmart is also producing these now. I have used both and am familiar with the differences (box, packaging, softness, absorbency). The walmart version is okay, but is definitely inferior- not as soft and not as absorbent. I was disappointed because these advertised in the originals box with the originals price, but were actually the Walmart presentations and quality.

reviews.review: These fit my petite newborn much better than several other brands we tried, but the thinness of the bamboo material made blowouts much more common - dirty diapers would leak right through the dypers immediately. Switched to Coterie which fit similarly well but with much thicker fabric.

reviews.name: Victoria
reviews.title: Leaky

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Thought it could be BETTER
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2022
reviews.review: An AMAZING product, unlike other brand it doesn’t absorb as much as you expect, could be better.

reviews.name: Princsskik
reviews.title: Not perfect
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2023
reviews.review: These bamboo diapers give mixed feelings for me. They are better for the environment but have some drawbacks. They do hold a lot but noticed that although liquid wasn't coming out of the diaper, it wasn't wicking away from the surface for the larger amounts, meaning dampness against the baby skin. So not sure I'd use these overnight. The sides also have no absorbancy or true waterproofing/plastic, so if the baby shifts around or it's not fitted correctly, if there is anything near that vicinity, the side leg band isn't going to stop it, and it will soak right through the side. It's basically just fabric there. The yellow line also took a really long time to start even hinting towards blue, much longer than I'm used to with other brands. They do have a soft silky feel to them which I like, but not sure they are worth the price. I can't see many people using the compost service. It sounds great in theory but I want dirty diapers out of the house asap before I smell the buildup of ammonia or fecal matter. I'm sure these are great for a subset of moms, but this is definitely a pro/con to decide on, not a no-brainer.

reviews.name: Aalea1
reviews.title: Nothing Special
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2022
reviews.review:
There's nothing special about the softness of these diapers. They feel identical to the others and there seems to be less absorbency as well.
I think they can work for daytime, the fit is accurate compared to others but I am not seeing anything that would.male me buy these over Hs.

reviews.name: Nottus81
reviews.title: Just okay
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2022
reviews.review: These diapers are very soft. They fit my baby a little big. My biggest complaint is that she pees right through them. In my experience, they have poor absorbency.

reviews.name: Elsa P
reviews.title: Expensive but useful
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2022
reviews.review: These diapers were purchased temporarily for my baby due to her having a diaper rash. I was looking for soft, breathable material (bamboo or cotton) with great absorbency so the acids within the urine or poop would not irritate my baby’s behind. I will say my baby was fitting out of them quickly. I got a size 1 and she is about 10 lbs (1 month old), but I probably would size up if purchasing another box. Compared to Pampers Pure, these were a little bit smaller. I am mainly giving these diapers a 3-star due to high in price and size. I got more for my money’s worth with Pampers Pure diapers that have worked just well considering absorbency so I have gone with using those. I did wait until my baby’s rash healed, one box was sufficient enough to help during that time. Now I am using the pure from Pampers line.

reviews.name: SMP
reviews.title: Leaky AF-your hands will do a better job
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2023
reviews.review: Out of all the diapers in all the land, I wouldn’t go for these diapers unless you have a waterproof cloth diaper outer to put on top of it. The good thing about this diaper though is my newborn did not get diaper rash so maybe it really is breathable.

reviews.name: kiera conlon
reviews.title: Leaks every time!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2022
reviews.review: I am shocked, since I have read so many great reviews of these diapers. I bought them because they seem to be very Eco friendly, but I am so disappointed! These diapers leak every time my newborn pees or poops.

reviews.name: Lj
reviews.title: This never arrived- seller unresponsive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2022
reviews.review: We find these diapers ok, they seem to have less chemicals and plastics. blow outs can happen, but mostly they are ok. My biggest issue is that my most recent order never arrived and seller has been entirely unresponsive.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Leakage Leakage Leakage
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2022
reviews.review: If you care more about the environment than changing your sheets on a regular these are for you! My baby leakage was in every scenario out the sides over the top. Poop coming out pee coming out. This diaper will leave you and the baby in the night.

reviews.name: Cd
reviews.title: Messy and not soft
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2022
reviews.review: Frequent BM leaks (we were simultaneously trying other diapers and didn't have issues with those diapers) and these are very scratchy. There are other bamboo options that hold up better and are softer.

reviews.name: madan
reviews.title: Blowout almost every single time
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2023
reviews.review: Its great that these are compostable but every single poo leaked from these diapers.

reviews.name: john
reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2022
reviews.review: Leaked every single time pee and poop too. :/ this was a real disappointment for me. I was very excited about using these.

reviews.name: Maximiliane
reviews.title: Leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2023
reviews.review:
We ordered a set of these diapers for our newborn because we ran out of the Coterie we received as a baby shower gift and were disappointed to have leaks and blowouts every diaper change! One time the pee even leaked all the way through the diaper into her clothes and through to the bassinet.

It’s a shame, because the clean materials and softness is a plus!
